2050    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
2051    def get_variable_truth_table(self, objType, entId=None):
2052        """
2053        gets a truth table indicating which variables are defined for
2054        specified entity type; if entId is not passed, then a concatenated
2055        truth table for all entities is returned with variable index
2056        cycling faster than entity index
2057
2058        >>> ssvar_truth_tab = exo.get_variable_truth_table('EX_SIDE_SET', sideSetID=side_set_id)
2059
2060        Parameters
2061        ----------
2062        entId : int, optional
2063            entity *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2064
2065        Returns
2066        -------
2067        truth_tab : <list<bool>>
2068            True for variable defined in an entity, False otherwise
2069        """
2070        if entId is None:
2071            return self.__ex_get_truth_table(objType)
2072        else:
2073            return self.__ex_get_object_truth_vector(objType, entId)
2074
2075    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
2076
2077    def set_variable_truth_table(self, objType, table):
2078        """
2079        stores a truth table indicating which variables are defined for
2080        all sets/blocks of the specified `objType` and all variables; variable index cycles
2081        faster than entity index
2082
2083        >>> status = exo.set_variable_truth_table('EX_NODE_SET', nsvar_truth_tab)
2084
2085        Parameters
2086        ----------
2087        table : <list<bool>>
2088            True for variable defined in a node set, False otherwise
2089
2090        Returns
2091        -------
2092        status : bool
2093            True = successful execution
2094        """
2095        return self.__ex_put_truth_table(objType, table)
2096
2097    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
2098
2099    def get_variable_names(self, objType):
2100        """
2101        get the list of variable names in the model for the specified object type.
2102
2103        >>> nar_names = exo.get_variable_names('EX_NODAL')
2104
2105        Returns
2106        -------
2107              <list<string>>  nvar_names
2108        """
2109        if self.__ex_get_variable_param(objType).value == 0:
2110            return []
2111        return self.__ex_get_variable_names(objType)
2112
2113    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
2114
2115    def get_reduction_variable_names(self, objType):
2116        """
2117        get the list of reduction variable names in the model for the specified object type.
2118
2119        >>> nar_names = exo.get_reduction_variable_names('EX_ASSEMBL"Y')
2120
2121        Returns
2122        -------
2123              <list<string>>  nvar_names
2124        """
2125        if self.__ex_get_reduction_variable_param(objType).value == 0:
2126            return []
2127        return self.__ex_get_reduction_variable_names(objType)
2128
2129    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
2130
2131    def get_reduction_variable_name(self, objType, varId):
2132        """
2133        get a single reduction variable name in the model for the specified object type and index.
2134
2135        >>> nar_name = exo.get_reduction_variable_name('EX_ASSEMBL"Y', 100)
2136
2137        Returns
2138        -------
2139              string  nvar_name
2140        """
2141        if self.__ex_get_reduction_variable_param(objType).value == 0:
2142            return ""
2143        return self.__ex_get_reduction_variable_name(objType, varId)
2144
2145    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
2146
2147    def get_variable_number(self, objType):
2148        """
2149        get the number of variables of the specified type in the model
2150
2151        >>> num_nvars = exo.get_variable_number('EX_NODAL')
2152
2153        Returns
2154        -------
2155        num_nvars :               <int>
2156        """
2157        return self.__ex_get_variable_param(objType).value
2158
2159    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
2160
2161    def get_reduction_variable_number(self, objType):
2162        """
2163        get the number of reduction variables of the specified type in the model
2164
2165        >>> num_nvars = exo.get_reduction_variable_number('EX_ASSEMBLY')
2166
2167        Returns
2168        -------
2169        num_nvars :               <int>
2170        """
2171        return self.__ex_get_reduction_variable_param(objType).value
2172
2173    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
2174
2175    def set_variable_number(self, objType, number):
2176        """
2177        update the number of variables in the model
2178
2179        >>> status = exo.set_variable_number('EX_NODAL', num_nvars)
2180
2181        Parameters
2182        ----------
2183        num_nvars :               <int>
2184
2185        Returns
2186        -------
2187        status : bool
2188            True = successful execution
2189        """
2190        self.__ex_put_variable_param(objType, number)
2191        return True
2192
2193    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
2194
2195    def set_reduction_variable_number(self, objType, number):
2196        """
2197        update the number of reduction variables in the model
2198
2199        >>> status = exo.set_reduction_variable_number('EX_ASSEMBLY', num_nvars)
2200
2201        Parameters
2202        ----------
2203        num_nvars :               <int>
2204
2205        Returns
2206        -------
2207        status : bool
2208            True = successful execution
2209        """
2210        self.__ex_put_reduction_variable_param(objType, number)
2211        return True
2212
2213    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
2214
2215    def put_variable_name(self, objType, name, index):
2216        """
2217        add the name and index of a new variable to the model;
2218        variable indexing goes from 1 to exo.get_variable_number()
2219
2220        >>> status = exo.put_variable_name('EX_NODAL', nvar_name, nvar_index)
2221
2222        Parameters
2223        ----------
2224        objType : string
2225            object type
2226        var_name : string
2227            name of new variable
2228        nvar_index : int
2229            1-based index of new nodal variable
2230
2231        Returns
2232        -------
2233        status : bool
2234            True = successful execution
2235
2236        Note:
2237        ----
2238        this method is often called within the following sequence:
2239
2240        >>> num_nvars = exo.get_variable_number('EX_NODAL')
2241        >>> new_nvar_index = num_nvars + 1
2242        >>> num_nvars += 1
2243        >>> exo.set_variable_number('EX_NODAL', num_nvars)
2244        >>> exo.put_variable_name('EX_NODAL', "new_nvar_name", new_nvar_index)
2245        """
2246        varNames = self.get_variable_names(objType)
2247        if name in varNames:
2248            print(f'WARNING: variable \"{name}\" already exists.')
2249        if index > len(varNames):
2250            raise Exception("ERROR: variable index out of range.")
2251        self.__ex_put_variable_name(objType, index, name)
2252        return True
2253
2254    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
2255
2256    def put_reduction_variable_name(self, objType, name, index):
2257        """
2258        add the name and index of a new reduction variable to the model;
2259        variable indexing goes from 1 to exo.get_reductino_variable_number()
2260
2261        >>> status = exo.put_reduction_variable_name('EX_ASSEMBLY', assemvar_name, assemvar_index)
2262
2263        Parameters
2264        ----------
2265        objType : string
2266            object type
2267        var_name : string
2268            name of new variable
2269        nvar_index : int
2270            1-based index of new nodal variable
2271
2272        Returns
2273        -------
2274        status : bool
2275            True = successful execution
2276
2277        Note:
2278        ----
2279        this method is often called within the following sequence:
2280
2281        >>> num_assem_vars = exo.get_reduction_variable_number('EX_ASSEMBLY')
2282        >>> new_assem_var_index = num_assem_vars + 1
2283        >>> num_assem_vars += 1
2284        >>> exo.set_reduction_variable_number('EX_ASSEMBLY', num_assem_vars)
2285        >>> exo.put_reduction_variable_name('EX_ASSEMBLY', "new_assem_var_name", new_assem_var_index)
2286        """
2287        varNames = self.get_reduction_variable_names(objType)
2288        if name in varNames:
2289            print(f'WARNING: variable \"{name}\" already exists.')
2290        if index > len(varNames):
2291            raise Exception("ERROR: variable index out of range.")
2292        self.__ex_put_reduction_variable_name(objType, index, name)
2293        return True
2294
2295    def get_entity_count(self, objType, entityId):
2296        """
2297        get number of nodes/elements in the specified set/block. Typically used internally
2298        by other user-callable functions.
2299
2300        Parameters
2301        ----------
2302        objType   : ex_entity_type
2303            type of object being queried
2304        entityId : int
2305            id of the entity (block, set) *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2306        """
2307
2308        numVals = 0
2309        if objType == "EX_NODAL":
2310            numVals = self.num_nodes()
2311        elif objType in ['EX_ELEM_BLOCK', 'EX_FACE_BLOCK', 'EX_EDGE_BLOCK']:
2312            (_elemType, numVals, _nodesPerElem, _numAttr) = self.__ex_get_block(objType, entityId)
2313        elif objType in ['EX_NODE_SET', 'EX_EDGE_SET', 'EX_FACE_SET', 'EX_SIDE_SET']:
2314            (numVals, _numDistFactInSet) = self.__ex_get_set_param(objType, entityId)
2315
2316        return numVals
2317
2318    def get_variable_values(self, objType, entityId, name, step):
2319        """
2320        get list of `objType` variable values for a specified object id
2321        block, variable name, and time step
2322
2323        >>> evar_vals = exo.get_variable_values('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', elem_blk_id,
2324        ...                                            evar_name, time_step)
2325
2326        Parameters
2327        ----------
2328        objType   : ex_entity_type
2329            type of object being queried
2330        entityId : int
2331            id of the entity (block, set) *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2332        name : string
2333            name of variable
2334        time_step : int
2335            1-based index of time step
2336
2337        Returns
2338        -------
2339
2340            if array_type == 'ctype':
2341              <list<ctypes.c_double>>  evar_vals
2342
2343            if array_type == 'numpy':
2344              <np_array<double>>  evar_vals
2345        """
2346        names = self.get_variable_names(objType)
2347        var_id = names.index(name) + 1
2348        numVals = self.get_entity_count(objType, entityId)
2349
2350        values = self.__ex_get_var(step, objType, var_id, entityId, numVals)
2351        if self.use_numpy:
2352            values = ctype_to_numpy(self, values)
2353        return values
2354
2355    def put_variable_values(self, objType, entityId, name, step, values):
2356        """
2357        store a list of element variable values for a specified element
2358        block, element variable name, and time step
2359
2360        >>> status = exo.put_variable_values('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', elem_blk_id,
2361        ...             evar_name, time_step, evar_vals)
2362
2363        Parameters
2364        ----------
2365        entityId : int  entity *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2366            <string>    name    name of variable
2367            <int>          time_step    1-based index of time step
2368            <list<float>>  values the variable values to be output
2369
2370        Returns
2371        -------
2372        status : bool
2373            True = successful execution
2374        """
2375        names = self.get_variable_names(objType)
2376        var_id = names.index(name) + 1
2377        numVals = self.get_entity_count(objType, entityId)
2378
2379        self.__ex_put_var(step, objType, var_id, entityId, numVals, values)
2380        return True
2381
2382    def get_attribute_count(self, objType, objId):
2383        """
2384        IS THIS NEEDED, PYTHONIC WAY MAY BE TO JUST GET THEM...
2385
2386        get the number of attributes on the specified entity
2387
2388        >>> num_attribute = exo.get_attribute_count('EX_ASSEMBLY', 100)
2389
2390        Parameters
2391        ----------
2392        objType   : ex_entity_type
2393            type of object being queried
2394        id        : int
2395            entity *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2396
2397        Returns
2398        -------
2399            <int>  num_attribute
2400        """
2401        return self.__ex_get_attribute_count(objType, objId)
2402
2403    def get_attributes(self, objType, objId):
2404        """
2405        >>> attributes = exo.get_attributes('EX_ASSEMBLY', 100)
2406
2407        Returns
2408        -------
2409            <ex_attribute list> attributes
2410        """
2411
2412        return self.__ex_get_attributes(objType, objId)
2413
2414    def put_attribute(self, attribute):
2415        """
2416        >>> attribute = exodus.attribute('Scale', 'EX_ASSEMBLY', 100)
2417        >>> attribute.values = [1.1, 1.0, 1.2]
2418        >>> attributes = exo.put_attribute(attribute)
2419
2420        Returns
2421        -------
2422            <ex_attribute list> attributes
2423        """
2424
2425        return self.__ex_put_attribute(attribute)
2426
2427    def num_assembly(self):
2428        """
2429        get the number of assemblies in the model
2430
2431        >>> num_assembly = exo.num_assembly()
2432
2433        Returns
2434        -------
2435            <int>  num_assembly
2436        """
2437        return self.inquire('EX_INQ_ASSEMBLY')
2438
2439    def get_assembly(self, object_id):
2440        """
2441        reads the assembly parameters and assembly data for one assembly
2442        """
2443        assem = ex_assembly(id=object_id)
2444        self.__ex_get_assembly(assem)
2445        assmbly = assembly(assem.name.decode('utf8'), assem.id, assem.type)
2446        for j in range(assem.entity_count):
2447            assmbly.entity_list.append(assem.entity_list[j])
2448        return assmbly
2449
2450    def get_assemblies(self, object_ids):
2451        """
2452        reads the assembly parameters and assembly data for all assemblies
2453        with ids in object_ids
2454        """
2455        assemblies = [ex_assembly(id=object_id) for object_id in object_ids]
2456        assems = (ex_assembly * len(assemblies))(*assemblies)
2457        self.__ex_get_assemblies(assems)
2458        assembs = [assembly(assem.name.decode('utf8'), assem.id, assem.type) for assem in
2459                   assems]
2460        for i, a in enumerate(assems):
2461            for j in range(a.entity_count):
2462                assembs[i].entity_list.append(a.entity_list[j])
2463        return assembs
2464
2465    def put_assembly(self, assembly):
2466        """
2467        writes the assembly parameters and assembly data for one assembly
2468        """
2469        self.__ex_put_assembly(assembly)
2470
2471    def put_assemblies(self, assemblies):
2472        """
2473        writes the assembly parameters and assembly data for multiple assemblies
2474        """
2475        self.__ex_put_assemblies(assemblies)
2476
2477    def num_blob(self):
2478        """
2479        get the number of blobs in the model
2480
2481        >>> num_assembly = exo.num_blob()
2482
2483        Returns
2484        -------
2485            <int>  num_blob
2486        """
2487        return self.numBlob.value
2488
2489    def get_blob(self, object_id):
2490        """
2491        reads the blob parameters and blob data for one blob
2492        """
2493        blob = ex_blob(id=object_id)
2494        self.__ex_get_blob(blob)
2495        return blob
2496
2497    def num_blks(self):
2498        """
2499        get the number of element blocks in the model
2500
2501        >>> num_elem_blks = exo.num_blks()
2502
2503        Returns
2504        -------
2505        num_elem_blks : int
2506        """
2507        return self.numElemBlk.value
2508
2509    def get_elem_blk_ids(self):
2510        """
2511        get mapping of exodus element block index to user- or
2512        application-defined element block id; elem_blk_ids is ordered
2513        by the element block *INDEX* ordering, a 1-based system going
2514        from 1 to exo.num_blks(), used by exodus for storage
2515        and input/output of array data stored on the element blocks; a
2516        user or application can optionally use a separate element block
2517        *ID* numbering system, so the elem_blk_ids array points to the
2518        element block *ID* for each element block *INDEX*
2519
2520        >>> elem_blk_ids = exo.get_elem_blk_ids()
2521
2522        Returns
2523        -------
2524
2525            if array_type == 'ctype':
2526              <list<int>>  elem_blk_ids
2527
2528            if array_type == 'numpy':
2529              <np_array<int>>  elem_blk_ids
2530        """
2531        return self.get_ids('EX_ELEM_BLOCK')
2532
2533    def get_elem_blk_name(self, object_id):
2534        """
2535        get the element block name
2536
2537        >>> elem_blk_name = exo.get_elem_blk_name(elem_blk_id)
2538
2539        Parameters
2540        ----------
2541        elem_blk_id : int
2542            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2543
2544        Returns
2545        -------
2546        elem_blk_name : string
2547        """
2548        return self.__ex_get_name('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', object_id)
2549
2550    def put_elem_blk_name(self, object_id, name):
2551        """
2552        store the element block name
2553
2554        >>> exo.put_elem_blk_name(elem_blk_id, elem_blk_name)
2555
2556        Parameters
2557        ----------
2558        elem_blk_id : int
2559            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2560        elem_blk_name : string
2561        """
2562        self.__ex_put_name('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', object_id, name)
2563
2564    def get_elem_blk_names(self):
2565        """
2566        get a list of all element block names ordered by block *INDEX*;
2567        (see `exodus.get_ids` for explanation of the
2568        difference between block *ID* and block *INDEX*)
2569
2570        >>> elem_blk_names = exo.get_elem_blk_names()
2571
2572        Returns
2573        -------
2574        elem_blk_names : <list<string>>
2575        """
2576        return self.__ex_get_names('EX_ELEM_BLOCK')
2577
2578    def put_elem_blk_names(self, names):
2579        """
2580        store a list of all element block names ordered by block *INDEX*;
2581        (see `exodus.get_ids` for explanation of the
2582        difference between block *ID* and block *INDEX*)
2583
2584        >>> exo.put_elem_blk_names(elem_blk_names)
2585
2586        Parameters
2587        ----------
2588        elem_blk_names : <list<string>>
2589        """
2590        self.__ex_put_names('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', names)
2591
2592    def elem_blk_info(self, object_id):
2593        """
2594        get the element block info
2595
2596        >>> elem_type, num_blk_elems, num_elem_nodes, num_elem_attrs
2597        ...       = exo.elem_blk_info(elem_blk_id)
2598
2599        Parameters
2600        ----------
2601        elem_blk_id : int
2602            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2603
2604        Returns
2605        -------
2606            <string>  elem_type       element type, e.g. 'HEX8'
2607            <int>     num_blk_elems   number of elements in the block
2608            <int>     num_elem_nodes  number of nodes per element
2609            <int>     num_elem_attrs  number of attributes per element
2610        """
2611        (elemType, numElem, nodesPerElem, numAttr) = self.__ex_get_block('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', object_id)
2612        return elemType, numElem, nodesPerElem, numAttr
2613
2614    def put_elem_blk_info(self, elem_blk_id, elem_type, num_blk_elems,
2615                          num_elem_nodes, num_elem_attrs):
2616        """
2617        store the element block *ID* and element block info
2618
2619        >>> exo.put_elem_blk_info(elem_blk_id, elem_type, num_blk_elems,
2620        ...                      num_elem_nodes, num_elem_attrs)
2621
2622        Parameters
2623        ----------
2624        elem_blk_id : int
2625            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2626        elem_type : string
2627            element type (all caps), e.g. 'HEX8'
2628        num_blk_elems : int
2629            number of elements in the block
2630        num_elem_nodes : int
2631            number of nodes per element
2632        num_elem_attrs : int
2633            number of attributes per element
2634        """
2635        self.__ex_put_block('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', elem_blk_id, elem_type, num_blk_elems,
2636                            num_elem_nodes, num_elem_attrs)
2637
2638    def put_concat_elem_blk(self, elem_blk_ids, elem_type, num_blk_elems,
2639                            num_elem_nodes, num_elem_attrs, defineMaps):
2640        """
2641        same as exo.put_elem_blk_info() but for all blocks at once
2642
2643        >>> status = exo.put_concat_elem_blk(elem_blk_ids, elem_types,
2644        ...                                 num_blk_elems, num_elem_nodes, num_elem_attrs)
2645
2646        Parameters
2647        ----------
2648            <list<int>>     elem_blk_ids     element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2649              for each block
2650            <list<string>>  elem_types       element type for each block
2651            <list<int>>     num_blk_elems    number of elements for each
2652              block
2653            <list<int>>     num_elem_nodes   number of nodes per element
2654              for each block
2655            <list<int>>     num_elem_attrs   number of attributes per
2656              element for each block
2657
2658        Returns
2659        -------
2660        status : bool
2661            True = successful execution
2662        """
2663        self.__ex_put_concat_elem_blk(
2664            elem_blk_ids,
2665            elem_type,
2666            num_blk_elems,
2667            num_elem_nodes,
2668            num_elem_attrs,
2669            defineMaps)
2670        return True
2671
2672    def get_elem_connectivity(self, object_id):
2673        """
2674        get the nodal connectivity, number of elements, and
2675        number of nodes per element for a single block
2676
2677        >>> elem_conn, num_blk_elems, num_elem_nodes
2678        ...        = exo.get_elem_connectivity(elem_blk_id)
2679
2680        Parameters
2681        ----------
2682        elem_blk_id : int
2683            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2684
2685        Returns
2686        -------
2687
2688            if array_type == 'ctype':
2689              <list<int>>  elem_conn  ordered list of node *INDICES* that
2690                define the connectivity of each element
2691                in the block; the list cycles through
2692                all nodes of the first element, then
2693                all nodes of the second element, etc.
2694                (see `exodus.get_id_map` for explanation
2695                of node *INDEX* versus node *ID*)
2696
2697            if array_type == 'numpy':
2698              <np_array<int>>  elem_conn  (same description)
2699
2700            <int>  num_blk_elems    number of elements in the block
2701            <int>  num_elem_nodes   number of nodes per element
2702        """
2703        (elem_block_connectivity, num_elem_this_blk,
2704         num_nodes_per_elem) = self.__ex_get_elem_conn(object_id)
2705        if self.use_numpy:
2706            elem_block_connectivity = ctype_to_numpy(
2707                self, elem_block_connectivity)
2708        return elem_block_connectivity, num_elem_this_blk, num_nodes_per_elem
2709
2710    def put_elem_connectivity(self, object_id, connectivity):
2711        """
2712        store the nodal connectivity, number of elements, and
2713        number of nodes per element for a single block
2714
2715        >>> exo.put_elem_connectivity(elem_blk_id, elem_conn)
2716
2717        Parameters
2718        ----------
2719        elem_blk_id : int
2720            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2721            <list<int>>  elem_conn    ordered list of node *INDICES* that
2722              define the connectivity of each
2723              element in the block; the list cycles
2724              through all nodes of the first element,
2725              then all nodes of the second element,
2726              etc.
2727              (see `exodus.get_id_map` for explanation
2728              of node *INDEX* versus node *ID*)
2729        """
2730        _d1, numBlkElems, numNodesPerElem, _d2 = self.elem_blk_info(object_id)
2731        assert len(connectivity) == (numBlkElems * numNodesPerElem)
2732        self.__ex_put_elem_conn(object_id, connectivity)
2733
2734    def get_elem_attr(self, elem_blk_id):
2735        """
2736        get all attributes for each element in a block
2737
2738        >>> elem_attrs = exo.get_elem_attr(elem_blk_id)
2739
2740        Parameters
2741        ----------
2742        elem_blk_id : int
2743            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2744
2745        Returns
2746        -------
2747            if array_type == 'ctype' : <list<float>> elem_attrs
2748            if array_type == 'numpy' : <np_array<float>> elem_attrs
2749                list of attribute values for all
2750                elements in the block; the list cycles
2751                through all attributes of the first
2752                element, then all attributes of the
2753                second element, etc. Attributes are
2754                ordered by the ordering of the names
2755                returned by exo.get_attribute_names()
2756        """
2757        elem_attrs = self.__ex_get_elem_attr(elem_blk_id)
2758        if self.use_numpy:
2759            elem_attrs = ctype_to_numpy(self, elem_attrs)
2760        return elem_attrs
2761
2762    def get_elem_attr_values(self, elem_blk_id, elem_attr_name):
2763        """
2764        get an attribute for each element in a block
2765
2766        >>> elem_attrs = exo.get_elem_attr(elem_blk_id)
2767
2768        Parameters
2769        ----------
2770            <int>    elem_blk_id     element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2771            <string> elem_attr_name  element attribute name
2772
2773        Returns
2774        -------
2775            if array_type == 'ctype': <list<float>>  values
2776            if array_type == 'numpy': <np_array<float>>  values
2777                array of values for the requested
2778                attribute.  Array has dimensions of
2779                1 x num_elem, where num_elem is the
2780                number of elements on the element block.
2781        """
2782        # Determine index of requested attribute in attribute list
2783        elem_attr_names = self.get_attribute_names('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', elem_blk_id)
2784        a_ndx = elem_attr_names.index(elem_attr_name)
2785
2786        values = self.__ex_get_one_attr('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', elem_blk_id, a_ndx + 1)
2787        if self.use_numpy:
2788            values = ctype_to_numpy(self, values)
2789        return values
2790
2791    def get_attr_values(self, objType, elem_blk_id, elem_attr_name):
2792        """
2793        get an attribute for each element in a block
2794
2795        >>> elem_attrs = exo.get_elem_attr(elem_blk_id)
2796
2797        Parameters
2798        ----------
2799            <int>    elem_blk_id     element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2800            <string> elem_attr_name  element attribute name
2801
2802        Returns
2803        -------
2804            if array_type == 'ctype': <list<float>>  values
2805            if array_type == 'numpy': <np_array<float>>  values
2806                array of values for the requested
2807                attribute.  Array has dimensions of
2808                1 x num_elem, where num_elem is the
2809                number of elements on the element block.
2810        """
2811        # Determine index of requested attribute in attribute list
2812        elem_attr_names = self.get_attribute_names('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', elem_blk_id)
2813        a_ndx = elem_attr_names.index(elem_attr_name)
2814
2815        values = self.__ex_get_one_attr('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', elem_blk_id, a_ndx + 1)
2816        if self.use_numpy:
2817            values = ctype_to_numpy(self, values)
2818        return values
2819
2820    def put_elem_attr(self, elem_blk_id, elem_attrs):
2821        """
2822        store all attributes for each element in a block
2823
2824        >>> exo.put_elem_attr(elem_blk_id, elem_attrs)
2825
2826        Parameters
2827        ----------
2828        elem_blk_id : int
2829            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2830        <list<float>>  elem_attrs     list of all attribute values for all
2831            elements in the block; the list
2832            cycles through all attributes of
2833            the first element, then all attributes
2834            of the second element, etc. Attributes
2835            are ordered by the ordering of the
2836            names returned by
2837            exo.get_attribute_names()
2838        """
2839        self.__ex_put_elem_attr(elem_blk_id, elem_attrs)
2840
2841    def put_elem_attr_values(self, elem_blk_id, elem_attr_name, values):
2842        """
2843        store an attribute for each element in a block
2844
2845        >>> exo.put_elem_attr_values(elem_blk_id, elem_attr_name, values)
2846
2847        Parameters
2848        ----------
2849        elem_blk_id : int
2850            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2851        <string>       elem_attr_name element attribute name
2852        <list<float>>  values         list of values for a single attribute
2853                                        on a element block.  List dimensions
2854                                        should be 1 x N_elem, where N_elem is
2855                                        the number of elements on the element
2856                                        block.
2857        """
2858        # Determine index of requested attribute in attribute list
2859        elem_attr_names = self.get_attribute_names('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', elem_blk_id)
2860        a_ndx = elem_attr_names.index(elem_attr_name)
2861        self.__ex_put_one_attr('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', elem_blk_id, a_ndx + 1, values)
2862
2863    def elem_type(self, object_id):
2864        """
2865        get the element type, e.g. "HEX8", for an element block
2866
2867        >>> elem_type = exo.elem_type(elem_blk_id)
2868
2869        Parameters
2870        ----------
2871        elem_blk_id : int
2872            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2873
2874        Returns
2875        -------
2876            <string>  elem_type
2877        """
2878        (elemType, _numElem, _nodesPerElem, _numAttr) = self.__ex_get_block('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', object_id)
2879        return elemType
2880
2881    def num_attr(self, object_id):
2882        """
2883        get the number of attributes per element for an element block
2884
2885        >>> num_elem_attrs = exo.num_attr(elem_blk_id)
2886
2887        Parameters
2888        ----------
2889        elem_blk_id : int
2890            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2891
2892        Returns
2893        -------
2894            <int>  num_elem_attrs
2895        """
2896        (_elemType, _numElem, _nodesPerElem, numAttr) = self.__ex_get_block('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', object_id)
2897        return numAttr
2898
2899    def num_elems_in_blk(self, object_id):
2900        """
2901        get the number of elements in an element block
2902
2903        >>> num_blk_elems = exo.num_elems_in_blk(elem_blk_id)
2904
2905        Parameters
2906        ----------
2907        elem_blk_id : int
2908            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2909
2910        Returns
2911        -------
2912            <int>  num_blk_elems
2913        """
2914        vals = self.get_entity_count('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', object_id)
2915        return vals
2916
2917    def num_nodes_per_elem(self, object_id):
2918        """
2919        get the number of nodes per element for an element block
2920
2921        >>> num_elem_nodes = exo.num_nodes_per_elem(elem_blk_id)
2922
2923        Parameters
2924        ----------
2925        elem_blk_id : int
2926            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2927
2928        Returns
2929        -------
2930            <int>  num_elem_nodes
2931        """
2932        (_elemType, _numElem, nodesPerElem, _numAttr) = self.__ex_get_block('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', object_id)
2933        return nodesPerElem
2934
2935    def get_element_variable_truth_table(self, entId=None):
2936        """
2937        See `exodus.get_variable_truth_table`
2938        """
2939        return self.get_variable_truth_table('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', entId)
2940
2941    def set_element_variable_truth_table(self, table):
2942        """
2943        See `exodus.set_variable_truth_table`
2944        """
2945        return self.set_variable_truth_table('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', table)
2946
2947    def get_element_variable_values(self, blockId, name, step):
2948        """
2949        get list of element variable values for a specified element
2950        block, element variable name, and time step
2951
2952        >>> evar_vals = exo.get_element_variable_values(elem_blk_id,
2953        ...                                            evar_name, time_step)
2954
2955        Parameters
2956        ----------
2957        elem_blk_id : int
2958            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2959        evar_name : string
2960            name of element variable
2961        time_step : int
2962            1-based index of time step
2963
2964        Returns
2965        -------
2966
2967            if array_type == 'ctype':
2968              <list<ctypes.c_double>>  evar_vals
2969
2970            if array_type == 'numpy':
2971              <np_array<double>>  evar_vals
2972        """
2973        return self.get_variable_values('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', blockId, name, step)
2974
2975    def get_partial_element_variable_values(self, blockId, name, step, start_index, num_elements):
2976        """
2977        get list of element variable values for a specified element
2978        block, element variable name, and time step
2979
2980        >>> evar_vals = exo.get_element_variable_values(elem_blk_id,
2981        ...                                            evar_name, time_step)
2982
2983        Parameters
2984        ----------
2985        elem_blk_id : int
2986            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2987        evar_name : string
2988            name of element variable
2989        time_step : int
2990            1-based index of time step
2991        start_index: int
2992            1-based index of element in block to start returning data
2993        num_elements: int
2994            number of elements to return data for.
2995
2996        Returns
2997        -------
2998
2999            if array_type == 'ctype':
3000              <list<ctypes.c_double>>  evar_vals
3001
3002            if array_type == 'numpy':
3003              <np_array<double>>  evar_vals
3004        """
3005        names = self.get_variable_names('EX_ELEM_BLOCK')
3006        var_id = names.index(name) + 1
3007        values = self.__ex_get_partial_var(step, 'EX_ELEM_BLOCK', var_id, blockId, start_index, num_elements)
3008        if self.use_numpy:
3009            values = ctype_to_numpy(self, values)
3010        return values
3011
3012    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3013
3014    def put_element_variable_values(self, blockId, name, step, values):
3015        """
3016        store a list of element variable values for a specified element
3017        block, element variable name, and time step
3018
3019        >>> status = exo.put_element_variable_values(elem_blk_id,
3020        ...             evar_name, time_step, evar_vals)
3021
3022        Parameters
3023        ----------
3024        elem_blk_id : int
3025            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3026            <string>       evar_name    name of element variable
3027            <int>          time_step    1-based index of time step
3028            <list<float>>  evar_vals
3029
3030        Returns
3031        -------
3032        status : bool
3033            True = successful execution
3034        """
3035        self.put_variable_values('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', blockId, name, step, values)
3036        return True
3037
3038    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3039
3040    def get_element_variable_number(self):
3041        """
3042        get the number of element variables in the model
3043
3044        >>> num_evars = exo.get_element_variable_number()
3045
3046        Returns
3047        -------
3048              <int>  num_evars
3049        """
3050        return self.__ex_get_variable_param('EX_ELEM_BLOCK').value
3051
3052    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3053
3054    def set_element_variable_number(self, number):
3055        """
3056        update the number of element variables in the model
3057
3058        >>> status = exo.set_element_variable_number(num_evars)
3059
3060        Parameters
3061        ----------
3062              <int>  num_evars
3063
3064        Returns
3065        -------
3066        status : bool
3067            True = successful execution
3068        """
3069        self.__ex_put_variable_param('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', number)
3070        return True
3071
3072    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3073
3074    def get_element_variable_names(self):
3075        """
3076        get the list of element variable names in the model
3077
3078        >>> evar_names = exo.get_element_variable_names()
3079
3080        Returns
3081        -------
3082              <list<string>>  evar_names
3083        """
3084        if self.__ex_get_variable_param('EX_ELEM_BLOCK').value == 0:
3085            return []
3086        return self.__ex_get_variable_names('EX_ELEM_BLOCK')
3087
3088    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3089
3090    def put_element_variable_name(self, name, index):
3091        """
3092        add the name and index of a new element variable to the model;
3093        element variable indexing goes from 1 to
3094        exo.get_element_variable_number()
3095
3096        >>> status = exo.put_element_variable_name(evar_name, evar_index)
3097
3098        Parameters
3099        ----------
3100            <string>  evar_name   name of new element variable
3101            <int>     evar_index  1-based index of new element variable
3102
3103        Returns
3104        -------
3105        status : bool
3106            True = successful execution
3107
3108        Note:
3109        ----
3110        this method is often called within the following sequence:
3111
3112        >>> num_evars = exo.get_element_variable_number()
3113        >>> new_evar_index = num_evars + 1
3114        >>> num_evars += 1
3115        >>> exo.set_element_variable_number(num_evars)
3116        >>> exo.put_element_variable_name("new_evar", new_evar_index)
3117        """
3118        EBvarNames = self.get_variable_names('EX_ELEM_BLOCK')
3119        if name in EBvarNames:
3120            print(f'WARNING: element variable \"{name}\" already exists.')
3121        if index > len(EBvarNames):
3122            print(("index", index, "len", len(EBvarNames)))
3123            raise Exception("ERROR: variable index out of range.")
3124        self.__ex_put_variable_name('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', index, name)
3125        return True
3126
3127    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3128
3129    def get_attribute_names(self, objType, blkId):
3130        """
3131        get the list of attribute names for the specified block/set
3132
3133        >>> attr_names = exo.get_attribute_names('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', elem_blk_id)
3134
3135        Parameters
3136        ----------
3137        objType:
3138            entity type
3139        blkId : int
3140            block/set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3141
3142        Returns
3143        -------
3144            <list<string>>  attr_names
3145        """
3146        names = self.__ex_get_attr_names(objType, blkId)
3147        return list(names)
3148
3149    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3150
3151    def get_element_attribute_names(self, blkId):
3152        """

3156
3157        Parameters
3158        ----------
3159        blkId : int
3160            block/set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3161
3162        Returns
3163        -------
3164            <list<string>>  attr_names
3165        """
3166        names = self.__ex_get_attr_names('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', blkId)
3167        return list(names)

3216        """

3237
3238        Parameters
3239        ----------

3245        -------
3246            <int>  eprop_val
3247        """
3248        propVal = self.__ex_get_prop('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', object_id, name)
3249        return int(propVal)

3282
3283    def num_node_sets(self):
3284        """
3285        get the number of node sets in the model
3286
3287        >>> num_node_sets = exo.num_node_sets()
3288
3289        Returns
3290        -------
3291            <int>  num_node_sets
3292        """
3293        return self.numNodeSets.value
3294
3295    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3296
3297    def get_node_set_ids(self):
3298        """
3299        get mapping of exodus node set index to user- or application-
3300        defined node set id; node_set_ids is ordered
3301        by the *INDEX* ordering, a 1-based system going from
3302        1 to exo.num_node_sets(), used by exodus for storage
3303        and input/output of array data stored on the node sets; a
3304        user or application can optionally use a separate node set
3305        *ID* numbering system, so the node_set_ids array points to the
3306        node set *ID* for each node set *INDEX*
3307
3308        >>> node_set_ids = exo.get_ids('EX_NODE_SET')
3309
3310        Returns
3311        -------
3312
3313            if array_type == 'ctype':
3314              <list<int>>  node_set_ids
3315
3316            if array_type == 'numpy':
3317              <np_array<int>>  node_set_ids
3318        """
3319        return self.get_ids('EX_NODE_SET')
3320
3321    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3322
3323    def get_node_set_name(self, object_id):
3324        """
3325        get the name of a node set
3326
3327        >>> node_set_name = exo.get_node_set_name(node_set_id)
3328
3329        Parameters
3330        ----------
3331            <int>  node_set_id  node set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3332
3333        Returns
3334        -------
3335            <string>  node_set_name
3336        """
3337        return self.__ex_get_name('EX_NODE_SET', object_id)
3338
3339    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3340

3342        """

3344

3346
3347        Parameters
3348        ----------
3349            <int>     node_set_id    node set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3350            <string>  node_set_name
3351        """
3352        self.__ex_put_name('EX_NODE_SET', object_id, name)
3353
3354    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3355
3356    def get_node_set_names(self):
3357        """
3358        get a list of all node set names ordered by node set *INDEX*;
3359        (see `exodus.get_ids` for explanation of the
3360        difference between node set *ID* and node set *INDEX*)
3361
3362        >>> node_set_names = exo.get_node_set_names()
3363
3364        Returns
3365        -------
3366            <list<string>>  node_set_names
3367        """
3368        return self.__ex_get_names('EX_NODE_SET')
3369
3370    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3371
3372    def put_node_set_names(self, names):
3373        """
3374        store a list of all node set names ordered by node set *INDEX*;
3375        (see `exodus.get_ids` for explanation of the
3376        difference between node set *ID* and node set *INDEX*)
3377
3378        >>> exo.put_node_set_names(node_set_names)
3379
3380        Parameters
3381        ----------
3382            <list<string>>  node_set_names
3383        """
3384        self.__ex_put_names('EX_NODE_SET', names)
3385
3386    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3387
3388    def num_nodes_in_node_set(self, object_id):
3389        """
3390        get the number of nodes in a node set
3391
3392        >>> num_ns_nodes = exo.num_nodes_in_node_set(node_set_id)
3393
3394        Parameters
3395        ----------
3396            <int>  node_set_id  node set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3397
3398        Returns
3399        -------
3400            <int>  num_ns_nodes
3401        """
3402        node_set_nodes = self.get_node_set_nodes(object_id)
3403        return len(node_set_nodes)
3404
3405    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3406
3407    def get_node_set_nodes(self, object_id):
3408        """
3409        get the list of node *INDICES* in a node set
3410        (see `exodus.get_id_map` for explanation of node *INDEX*
3411        versus node *ID*)
3412
3413        >>> ns_nodes = exo.get_node_set_nodes(node_set_id)
3414
3415        Parameters
3416        ----------
3417            <int>  node_set_id  node set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3418
3419        Returns
3420        -------
3421
3422            if array_type == 'ctype':
3423              <list<int>>  ns_nodes
3424
3425            if array_type == 'numpy':
3426              <np_array<int>>  ns_nodes
3427        """
3428        node_set_ids = self.get_ids('EX_NODE_SET')
3429        assert object_id in node_set_ids
3430        node_set_nodes = self.__ex_get_node_set(object_id)
3431        node_set_nodes = list(node_set_nodes)
3432        if self.use_numpy:
3433            node_set_nodes = self.np.array(node_set_nodes)
3434        return node_set_nodes
3435
3436    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3437
3438    def put_node_set(self, object_id, nodeSetNodes):
3439        """
3440        store a node set by its id and the list of node *INDICES* in
3441        the node set (see `exodus.get_id_map` for explanation of node
3442        *INDEX* versus node *ID*)
3443
3444        >>> exo.put_node_set(node_set_id, ns_nodes)
3445
3446        Parameters
3447        ----------
3448            <int>        node_set_id  node set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3449            <list<int>>  ns_nodes
3450        """
3451        self.__ex_put_node_set(object_id, nodeSetNodes)
3452
3453    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3454
3455    def get_node_set_dist_facts(self, object_id):
3456        """
3457        get the list of distribution factors for nodes in a node set
3458
3459        >>> ns_dist_facts = exo.get_node_set_dist_facts(node_set_id)
3460
3461        Parameters
3462        ----------
3463            <int>        node_set_id  node set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3464
3465        Returns
3466        -------
3467
3468            if array_type == 'ctype':
3469              <list<float>>  ns_dist_facts  a list of distribution factors,
3470                e.g. nodal 'weights'
3471
3472            if array_type == 'numpy':
3473              <np_array<double>>  ns_dist_facts  a list of distribution
3474                factors, e.g. nodal
3475                'weights'
3476        """
3477        node_set_dfs = self.__ex_get_node_set_dist_fact(object_id)
3478        node_set_dfs = list(node_set_dfs)
3479        if self.use_numpy:
3480            node_set_dfs = self.np.array(node_set_dfs)
3481        return node_set_dfs
3482
3483    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3484
3485    def put_node_set_dist_fact(self, object_id, nodeSetDistFact):
3486        """
3487        store the list of distribution factors for nodes in a node set
3488
3489        >>> exo.put_node_set_dist_fact(node_set_id, ns_dist_facts)
3490
3491        Parameters
3492        ----------
3493            <int>          node_set_id    node set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3494            <list<float>>  ns_dist_facts  a list of distribution factors,
3495              e.g. nodal 'weights'
3496        """
3497        self.__ex_put_node_set_dist_fact(object_id, nodeSetDistFact)
3498
3499    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3500
3501    def get_node_set_variable_number(self):
3502        """
3503        get the number of node set variables in the model
3504
3505        >>> num_nsvars = exo.get_node_set_variable_number()
3506
3507        Returns
3508        -------
3509              <int>  num_nsvars
3510        """
3511        return self.__ex_get_variable_param('EX_NODE_SET').value
3512
3513    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3514
3515    def set_node_set_variable_number(self, number):
3516        """
3517        update the number of node set variables in the model
3518
3519        >>> status = exo.set_node_set_variable_number(num_nsvars)
3520
3521        Parameters
3522        ----------
3523              <int>  num_nsvars
3524
3525        Returns
3526        -------
3527        status : bool
3528            True = successful execution
3529        """
3530        self.__ex_put_variable_param('EX_NODE_SET', number)
3531        return True

3535    def get_node_set_variable_truth_table(self, entId=None):
3536        """
3537        See `exodus.get_variable_truth_table`
3538        """
3539        return self.get_variable_truth_table('EX_NODE_SET', entId)
3540
3541    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3542
3543    def set_node_set_variable_truth_table(self, table):
3544        """
3545        See `exodus.set_variable_truth_table`
3546        """
3547        return self.set_variable_truth_table('EX_NODE_SET', table)
3548
3549    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3550
3551    def get_node_set_variable_names(self):
3552        """
3553        get the list of node set variable names in the model
3554
3555        >>> nsvar_names = exo.get_node_set_variable_names()
3556
3557        Returns
3558        -------
3559              <list<string>>  nsvar_names
3560        """
3561        if self.__ex_get_variable_param('EX_NODE_SET').value == 0:
3562            return []
3563        return self.__ex_get_variable_names('EX_NODE_SET')
3564
3565    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3566
3567    def put_node_set_variable_name(self, name, index):
3568        """
3569        add the name and index of a new node set variable to the model;
3570        node set variable indexing goes from 1 to
3571        exo.get_node_set_variable_number()
3572
3573        >>> status = exo.put_node_set_variable_name(nsvar_name, nsvar_index)
3574
3575        Parameters
3576        ----------
3577            <string>  nsvar_name   name of new node set variable
3578            <int>     nsvar_index  1-based index of new node set variable
3579
3580        Returns
3581        -------
3582        status : bool
3583            True = successful execution
3584
3585        Note:
3586        -----
3587        this method is often called within the following sequence:
3588
3589        >>> num_nsvars = exo.get_node_set_variable_number()
3590        >>> new_nsvar_index = num_nsvars + 1
3591        >>> num_nsvars += 1
3592        >>> exo.set_node_set_variable_number(num_nsvars)
3593        >>> exo.put_node_set_variable_name("new_nsvar", new_nsvar_index)
3594        """
3595        NSvarNames = self.get_variable_names('EX_NODE_SET')
3596        if name in NSvarNames:
3597            print(f'WARNING: Node set variable \"{name}\" already exists.')
3598        if index > len(NSvarNames):
3599            raise Exception("ERROR: variable index out of range.")
3600        self.__ex_put_variable_name('EX_NODE_SET', index, name)
3601        return True
3602
3603    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3604
3605    def get_node_set_variable_values(self, object_id, name, step):
3606        """
3607        get list of node set variable values for a specified node
3608        set, node set variable name, and time step; the list has
3609        one variable value per node in the set
3610
3611        >>> nsvar_vals =
3612        ...   exo.get_node_set_variable_values(node_set_id,
3613        ...    nsvar_name, time_step)
3614
3615        Parameters
3616        ----------
3617            <int>     node_set_id  node set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3618            <string>  nsvar_name   name of node set variable
3619            <int>     time_step    1-based index of time step
3620
3621        Returns
3622        -------
3623
3624            if array_type == 'ctype':
3625              <list<ctypes.c_double>>  nsvar_vals
3626
3627            if array_type == 'numpy':
3628              <np_array<double>>  nsvar_vals
3629        """
3630        return self.get_variable_values('EX_NODE_SET', object_id, name, step)
3631
3632    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3633
3634    def get_partial_node_set_variable_values(self, object_id, name, step, start_index, num_nodes):
3635        """
3636        get list of node set variable values for a specified node
3637        set, node set variable name, and time step; the list has
3638        one variable value per node in the set
3639
3640        >>> nsvar_vals =
3641        ...   exo.get_node_set_variable_values(node_set_id,
3642        ...    nsvar_name, time_step)
3643
3644        Parameters
3645        ----------
3646            <int>     node_set_id  node set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3647            <string>  nsvar_name   name of node set variable
3648            <int>     time_step    1-based index of time step
3649            <int>     start_index 1-based index of node to start returning data
3650            <int>     num_nodes   number of nodes to return data for.
3651
3652        Returns
3653        -------
3654
3655            if array_type == 'ctype':
3656              <list<ctypes.c_double>>  nsvar_vals
3657
3658            if array_type == 'numpy':
3659              <np_array<double>>  nsvar_vals
3660        """
3661        names = self.get_variable_names('EX_NODE_SET')
3662        var_id = names.index(name) + 1
3663        values = self.__ex_get_partial_var(step, 'EX_NODE_SET', var_id, object_id, start_index, num_nodes)
3664        if self.use_numpy:
3665            values = ctype_to_numpy(self, values)
3666        return values
3667
3668    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3669
3670    def put_node_set_variable_values(self, object_id, name, step, values):
3671        """
3672        store a list of node set variable values for a specified node
3673        set, node set variable name, and time step; the list has one
3674        variable value per node in the set
3675
3676        >>> status =
3677        ... exo.put_node_set_variable_values(node_set_id,
3678        ...     nsvar_name, time_step, nsvar_vals)
3679
3680        Parameters
3681        ----------
3682            <int>          node_set_id  node set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3683            <string>       nsvar_name   name of node set variable
3684            <int>          time_step    1-based index of time step
3685            <list<float>>  nsvar_vals
3686
3687        Returns
3688        -------
3689        status : bool
3690            True = successful execution
3691        """
3692        self.put_variable_values('EX_NODE_SET', object_id, name, step, values)
3693        return True
3694
3695    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3696
3697    def get_all_node_set_params(self):
3698        """
3699        get total number of nodes and distribution factors (e.g. nodal
3700        'weights') combined among all node sets
3701
3702        >>> tot_num_ns_nodes,
3703        ... tot_num_ns_dist_facts = exo.get_all_node_set_params()
3704
3705        Returns
3706        -------
3707            <int>  tot_num_ns_nodes
3708            <int>  tot_num_ns_dist_facts
3709        """
3710        nodeSetIds = self.__ex_get_ids('EX_NODE_SET')
3711        totNumSetNodes, totNumSetDistFacts = 0, 0
3712        for nodeSetId in nodeSetIds:
3713            (numSetNodes, numSetDistFacts) = self.__ex_get_set_param('EX_NODE_SET', nodeSetId)
3714            totNumSetNodes += numSetNodes
3715            totNumSetDistFacts += numSetDistFacts
3716        return totNumSetNodes, totNumSetDistFacts
3717
3718    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3719
3720    def get_set_params(self, object_type, object_id):
3721        """
3722        get number of entities and distribution factors (e.g. nodal
3723        'weights') in the specified set
3724
3725        >>> num_ns_nodes, num_ns_dist_facts =
3726        ...     exo.get_set_params('EX_NODE_SET', node_set_id)
3727
3728        Parameters
3729        ----------
3730        set_id : int
3731            set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3732
3733        Returns
3734        -------
3735        num_set_entities : int
3736        num_set_dist_facts : int
3737        """
3738        (numSetEntities, numSetDistFacts) = self.__ex_get_set_param(object_type, object_id)
3739        return numSetEntities, numSetDistFacts
3740
3741    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3742
3743    def put_set_params(self, object_type, object_id, numSetEntity, numSetDistFacts=None):
3744        """
3745        initialize a new set of the specified type
3746
3747        >>> exo.put_set_params('EX_NODE_SET', node_set_id,
3748        ...                 num_ns_nodes, num_ns_dist_facts)
3749
3750        Parameters
3751        ----------
3752        set_id : int
3753            set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3754        num_set_entity : int
3755            number of nodes/edges/faces/elements to be added to set
3756        num_dist_facts : int, optional
3757            number of distribution factors (e.g. nodal 'weights') --
3758            must be equal to zero or num_set_entity
3759        """
3760        if numSetDistFacts is None:
3761            numSetDistFacts = numSetEntity
3762        assert numSetDistFacts in (0, numSetEntity)
3763        self.__ex_put_set_param(object_type, object_id, numSetEntity, numSetDistFacts)
3764
3765    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3766
3767    def get_node_set_params(self, object_id):
3768        """ See `exodus.put_set_params` """
3769
3770        (numSetNodes, numSetDistFacts) = self.__ex_get_set_param('EX_NODE_SET', object_id)
3771        return numSetNodes, numSetDistFacts
3772
3773    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3774
3775    def put_node_set_params(self, object_id, numSetNodes, numSetDistFacts=None):
3776        """ See `exodus.put_set_params` """
3777        if numSetDistFacts is None:
3778            numSetDistFacts = numSetNodes
3779        assert numSetDistFacts in (0, numSetNodes)
3780        self.__ex_put_set_param('EX_NODE_SET', object_id, numSetNodes, numSetDistFacts)
3781
3782    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3783
3784    def get_node_set_property_names(self):
3785        """
3786        get the list of node set property names for all node sets in
3787        the model
3788
3789        >>> nsprop_names = exo.get_node_set_property_names()
3790
3791        Returns
3792        -------
3793            <list<string>>  nsprop_names
3794        """
3795        names = self.__ex_get_prop_names('EX_NODE_SET', 'EX_INQ_NS_PROP')
3796        return list(names)
3797
3798    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3799
3800    def get_node_set_property_value(self, object_id, name):
3801        """
3802        get node set property value (an integer) for a specified node
3803        set and node set property name
3804
3805        >>> nsprop_val = exo.get_node_set_property_value(node_set_id, nsprop_name)
3806
3807        Parameters
3808        ----------
3809            <int>     node_set_id  node set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3810            <string>  nsprop_name
3811
3812        Returns
3813        -------
3814            <int>  nsprop_val
3815        """
3816        propVal = self.__ex_get_prop('EX_NODE_SET', object_id, name)
3817        return int(propVal)
3818
3819    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3820
3821    def put_node_set_property_value(self, object_id, name, value):
3822        """
3823        store a node set property name and its integer value for a
3824        node set
3825
3826        >>> status = exo.put_node_set_property_value(node_set_id,
3827        ...                   nsprop_name, nsprop_val)
3828
3829        Parameters
3830        ----------
3831            <int>     node_set_id  node set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3832            <string>  nsprop_name
3833            <int>     nsprop_val
3834
3835        Returns
3836        -------
3837        status : bool
3838            True = successful execution
3839        """
3840        return self.__ex_put_prop('EX_NODE_SET', object_id, name, value)
3841
3842    #
3843    # sidesets
3844    #
3845    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3846
3847    def num_side_sets(self):
3848        """
3849        get the number of side sets in the model
3850
3851        >>> num_side_sets = exo.num_side_sets()
3852
3853        Returns
3854        -------
3855            <int>  num_side_sets
3856        """
3857        return self.numSideSets.value
3858
3859    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3860
3861    def get_side_set_ids(self):
3862        """
3863        get mapping of exodus side set index to user- or application-
3864        defined side set id; side_set_ids is ordered
3865        by the *INDEX* ordering, a 1-based system going from
3866        1 to exo.num_side_sets(), used by exodus for storage
3867        and input/output of array data stored on the side sets; a
3868        user or application can optionally use a separate side set
3869        *ID* numbering system, so the side_set_ids array points to the
3870        side set *ID* for each side set *INDEX*
3871
3872        >>> side_set_ids = exo.get_ids('EX_SIDE_SET')
3873
3874        Returns
3875        -------
3876
3877            if array_type == 'ctype':
3878              <list<int>>  side_set_ids
3879
3880            if array_type == 'numpy':
3881              <np_array<int>>  side_set_ids
3882        """
3883        return self.get_ids('EX_SIDE_SET')
3884
3885    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3886
3887    def get_side_set_name(self, object_id):
3888        """
3889        get the name of a side set
3890
3891        >>> side_set_name = exo.get_side_set_name(side_set_id)
3892
3893        Parameters
3894        ----------
3895            <int>  side_set_id  side set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3896
3897        Returns
3898        -------
3899            <string>  side_set_name
3900        """
3901        return self.__ex_get_name('EX_SIDE_SET', object_id)
3902
3903    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3904
3905    def put_side_set_name(self, object_id, name):
3906        """
3907        store the name of a side set
3908
3909        >>> exo.put_side_set_name(side_set_id, side_set_name)
3910
3911        Parameters
3912        ----------
3913            <int>     side_set_id    side set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3914            <string>  side_set_name
3915        """
3916        self.__ex_put_name('EX_SIDE_SET', object_id, name)
3917
3918    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3919
3920    def get_side_set_names(self):
3921        """
3922        get a list of all side set names ordered by side set *INDEX*;
3923        (see `exodus.get_ids` for explanation of the
3924        difference between side set *ID* and side set *INDEX*)
3925
3926        >>> side_set_names = exo.get_side_set_names()
3927
3928        Returns
3929        -------
3930            <list<string>>  side_set_names
3931        """
3932        return self.__ex_get_names('EX_SIDE_SET')
3933
3934    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3935
3936    def put_side_set_names(self, names):
3937        """
3938        store a list of all side set names ordered by side set *INDEX*;
3939        (see `exodus.get_ids` for explanation of the
3940        difference between side set *ID* and side set *INDEX*)
3941
3942        >>> exo.put_side_set_names(side_set_names)
3943
3944        Parameters
3945        ----------
3946            <list<string>>  side_set_names
3947        """
3948        self.__ex_put_names('EX_SIDE_SET', names)
3949
3950    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3951
3952    def num_faces_in_side_set(self, object_id):
3953        """
3954        get the number of faces in a side set
3955
3956        >>> num_ss_faces = exo.num_faces_in_side_set(side_set_id)
3957
3958        Parameters
3959        ----------
3960            <int>  side_set_id  side set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3961
3962        Returns
3963        -------
3964            <int>  num_ss_faces
3965        """
3966        ssids = self.get_ids('EX_SIDE_SET')
3967        if object_id not in ssids:
3968            print("WARNING: queried side set ID does not exist in database")
3969            return 0
3970        (num_side_in_set, _num_dist_fact_in_set) = self.__ex_get_set_param('EX_SIDE_SET', object_id)
3971        return num_side_in_set
3972
3973    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3974
3975    def get_all_side_set_params(self):
3976        """
3977        get total number of sides, nodes, and distribution factors
3978        (e.g. nodal 'weights') combined among all side sets
3979
3980        >>> tot_num_ss_sides, tot_num_ss_nodes, tot_num_ss_dist_facts =
3981        ...          exo.get_all_side_set_params()
3982
3983        Returns
3984        -------
3985            <int>  tot_num_ss_sides
3986            <int>  tot_num_ss_nodes
3987            <int>  tot_num_ss_dist_facts
3988
3989        Note:
3990        -----
3991        The number of nodes (and distribution factors) in a side set is
3992        the sum of all face nodes.  A single node can be counted more
3993        than once, i.e. once for each face it belongs to in the side set.
3994        """
3995        ids = self.__ex_get_ids('EX_SIDE_SET')
3996        totNumSetSides, totNumSetDistFacts = 0, 0  # totNumSetDistFacts = totNumSetNodes
3997        for sideSetId in ids:
3998            (numSetSides, numSetDistFacts) = self.__ex_get_set_param('EX_SIDE_SET', sideSetId)
3999            totNumSetSides += numSetSides
4000            totNumSetDistFacts += numSetDistFacts
4001        totNumSetNodes = totNumSetDistFacts
4002        return totNumSetSides, totNumSetNodes, totNumSetDistFacts
4003
4004    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4005
4006    def get_side_set_params(self, object_id):
4007        """
4008        get number of sides and nodal distribution factors (e.g. nodal
4009        'weights') in a side set
4010
4011        >>> num_ss_sides, num_ss_dist_facts = exo.get_side_set_params(side_set_id)
4012
4013        Parameters
4014        ----------
4015            <int>  side_set_id  side set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
4016
4017        Returns
4018        -------
4019            <int>  num_ss_sides
4020            <int>  num_ss_dist_facts
4021
4022        Note:
4023        -----
4024        The number of nodes (and distribution factors) in a side set is
4025        the sum of all face nodes.  A single node can be counted more
4026        than once, i.e. once for each face it belongs to in the side set.
4027        """
4028        (numSetSides, numSetDistFacts) = self.__ex_get_set_param('EX_SIDE_SET', object_id)
4029        return numSetSides, numSetDistFacts
4030
4031    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4032
4033    def put_side_set_params(self, object_id, numSetSides, numSetDistFacts):
4034        """
4035        initialize a new side set
4036
4037        >>> exo.put_side_set_params(side_set_id, num_ss_sides, num_ss_dist_facts)
4038
4039        Parameters
4040        ----------
4041            <int>  side_set_id        side set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
4042            <int>  num_ss_sides       number of sides to be added to set
4043            <int>  num_ss_dist_facts  number of nodal distribution factors
4044              (e.g. nodal 'weights')
4045
4046        Note:
4047        -----
4048        The number of nodes (and distribution factors) in a side set is
4049        the sum of all face nodes.  A single node can be counted more
4050        than once, i.e. once for each face it belongs to in the side set.
4051        """
4052        self.__ex_put_set_param('EX_SIDE_SET', object_id, numSetSides, numSetDistFacts)
4053
4054    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4055
4056    def get_side_set(self, object_id):
4057        """
4058        get the lists of element and side indices in a side set; the
4059        two lists correspond: together, ss_elems[i] and ss_sides[i]
4060        define the face of an element
4061
4062        >>> ss_elems, ss_sides = exo.get_side_set(side_set_id)
4063
4064        Parameters
4065        ----------
4066            <int>  side_set_id  side set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
4067
4068        Returns
4069        -------
4070
4071            if array_type == 'ctype':
4072              <list<int>>  ss_elems
4073              <list<int>>  ss_sides
4074
4075            if array_type == 'numpy':
4076              <np_array<int>>  ss_elems
4077              <np_array<int>>  ss_sides
4078        """
4079        (side_set_elem_list, side_set_side_list) = self.__ex_get_side_set(object_id)
4080        if self.use_numpy:
4081            side_set_elem_list = ctype_to_numpy(self, side_set_elem_list)
4082            side_set_side_list = ctype_to_numpy(self, side_set_side_list)
4083        return side_set_elem_list, side_set_side_list
4084
4085    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4086
4087    def put_side_set(self, object_id, sideSetElements, sideSetSides):
4088        """
4089        store a side set by its id and the lists of element and side
4090        indices in the side set; the two lists correspond: together,
4091        ss_elems[i] and ss_sides[i] define the face of an element
4092
4093        >>> exo.put_side_set(side_set_id, ss_elems, ss_sides)
4094
4095        Parameters
4096        ----------
4097            <int>        side_set_id  side set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
4098            <list<int>>  ss_elems
4099            <list<int>>  ss_sides
4100        """
4101        self.__ex_put_side_set(object_id, sideSetElements, sideSetSides)
4102
4103    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4104
4105    def get_side_set_dist_fact(self, object_id):
4106        """
4107        get the list of distribution factors for nodes in a side set
4108
4109        >>> ss_dist_facts = exo.get_side_set_dist_fact(side_set_id)
4110
4111        Parameters
4112        ----------
4113            <int>        side_set_id  side set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
4114
4115        Returns
4116        -------
4117
4118            if array_type == 'ctype':
4119              <list<float>>  ss_dist_facts  a list of distribution factors,
4120                e.g. nodal 'weights'
4121
4122            if array_type == 'numpy':
4123              <np_array<double>>  ss_dist_facts  a list of distribution
4124                factors, e.g. nodal
4125                'weights'
4126
4127        Note:
4128        -----
4129        The number of nodes (and distribution factors) in a side set is
4130        the sum of all face nodes.  A single node can be counted more
4131        than once, i.e. once for each face it belongs to in the side set.
4132        """
4133        side_set_dfs = list(self.__ex_get_side_set_dist_fact(object_id))
4134        if self.use_numpy:
4135            side_set_dfs = self.np.array(side_set_dfs)
4136        return side_set_dfs
4137
4138    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4139
4140    def put_side_set_dist_fact(self, object_id, sideSetDistFact):
4141        """
4142        store the list of distribution factors for nodes in a side set
4143
4144        >>> exo.put_side_set_dist_fact(side_set_id, ss_dist_facts)
4145
4146        Parameters
4147        ----------
4148            <int>          node_set_id    node set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
4149            <list<float>>  ns_dist_facts  a list of distribution factors,
4150              e.g. nodal 'weights'
4151
4152        Note:
4153        -----
4154        The number of nodes (and distribution factors) in a side set is
4155        the sum of all face nodes.  A single node can be counted more
4156        than once, i.e. once for each face it belongs to in the side set.
4157        """
4158        self.__ex_put_side_set_dist_fact(object_id, sideSetDistFact)
4159
4160    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4161
4162    def get_side_set_node_list(self, object_id):
4163        """
4164        get two lists:
4165         1. number of nodes for each side in the set
4166         2. concatenation of the nodes for each side in the set
4167
4168        >>> ss_num_nodes_per_side, ss_nodes = exo.get_side_set_node_list(side_set_id)
4169
4170        Parameters
4171        ----------
4172            <int>        side_set_id  side set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
4173
4174        Returns
4175        -------
4176
4177            if array_type == 'ctype':
4178              <list<int>>  ss_num_side_nodes
4179              <list<int>>  ss_nodes
4180
4181            if array_type == 'numpy':
4182              <np_array<int>>  ss_num_side_nodes
4183              <np_array<int>>  ss_nodes
4184
4185        Note:
4186        -----
4187        The number of nodes (and distribution factors) in a side set is
4188        the sum of all face nodes.  A single node can be counted more
4189        than once, i.e. once for each face it belongs to in the side set.
4190        """
4191        (side_set_node_cnt_list,
4192         side_set_node_list) = self.__ex_get_side_set_node_list(object_id)
4193        if self.use_numpy:
4194            side_set_node_cnt_list = ctype_to_numpy(
4195                self, side_set_node_cnt_list)
4196            side_set_node_list = ctype_to_numpy(self, side_set_node_list)
4197        return side_set_node_cnt_list, side_set_node_list
4198
4199    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4200
4201    def get_side_set_variable_truth_table(self, entId=None):
4202        """
4203        See `exodus.get_variable_truth_table`
4204        """
4205        return self.get_variable_truth_table('EX_SIDE_SET', entId)
4206
4207    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4208
4209    def set_side_set_variable_truth_table(self, table):
4210        """
4211        See `exodus.set_variable_truth_table`
4212        """
4213        return self.set_variable_truth_table('EX_SIDE_SET', table)
4214
4215    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4216
4217    def get_side_set_variable_number(self):
4218        """
4219        get the number of side set variables in the model
4220
4221        >>> num_ssvars = exo.get_side_set_variable_number()
4222
4223        Returns
4224        -------
4225              <int>  num_ssvars
4226        """
4227        return self.__ex_get_variable_param('EX_SIDE_SET').value
4228
4229    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4230
4231    def set_side_set_variable_number(self, number):
4232        """
4233        update the number of side set variables in the model
4234
4235        >>> status = exo.set_side_set_variable_number(num_ssvars)
4236
4237        Parameters
4238        ----------
4239              <int>  num_ssvars
4240
4241        Returns
4242        -------
4243        status : bool
4244            True = successful execution
4245        """
4246        self.__ex_put_variable_param('EX_SIDE_SET', number)
4247        return True
4248
4249    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4250
4251    def get_side_set_variable_names(self):
4252        """
4253        get the list of side set variable names in the model
4254
4255        >>> ssvar_names = exo.get_side_set_variable_names()
4256
4257        Returns
4258        -------
4259              <list<string>>  ssvar_names
4260        """
4261        if self.__ex_get_variable_param('EX_SIDE_SET').value == 0:
4262            return []
4263        return self.__ex_get_variable_names('EX_SIDE_SET')
4264
4265    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4266
4267    def put_side_set_variable_name(self, name, index):
4268        """
4269        add the name and index of a new side set variable to the model;
4270        side set variable indexing goes from 1 to
4271        exo.get_side_set_variable_number()
4272
4273        >>> status = exo.put_side_set_variable_name(ssvar_name, ssvar_index)
4274
4275        Parameters
4276        ----------
4277            <string>  ssvar_name   name of new side set variable
4278            <int>     ssvar_index  1-based index of new side set variable
4279
4280        Returns
4281        -------
4282        status : bool
4283            True = successful execution
4284
4285        Note:
4286        -----
4287        this method is often called within the following sequence:
4288
4289        >>> num_ssvars = exo.get_side_set_variable_number()
4290        >>> new_ssvar_index = num_ssvars + 1
4291        >>> num_ssvars += 1
4292        >>> exo.set_side_set_variable_number(num_ssvars)
4293        >>> exo.put_side_set_variable_name("new_ssvar", new_ssvar_index)
4294
4295        """
4296        SSvarNames = self.get_variable_names('EX_SIDE_SET')
4297        if name in SSvarNames:
4298            print(f'WARNING: Side set variable \"{name}\" already exists.')
4299        if index > len(SSvarNames):
4300            raise Exception("ERROR: variable index out of range.")
4301        self.__ex_put_variable_name('EX_SIDE_SET', index, name)
4302        return True
4303
4304    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4305
4306    def get_side_set_variable_values(self, object_id, name, step):
4307        """
4308        get list of side set variable values for a specified side
4309        set, side set variable name, and time step; the list has
4310        one variable value per side in the set
4311
4312        >>> ssvar_vals = exo.get_side_set_variable_values(side_set_id,
4313        ...    ssvar_name, time_step)
4314
4315        Parameters
4316        ----------
4317            <int>     side_set_id  side set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
4318            <string>  ssvar_name   name of side set variable
