6098        obj_id = ctypes.c_longlong(objId)
6099        prop_name = ctypes.create_string_buffer(propName.encode('ascii'), MAX_STR_LENGTH + 1)
6100        if EXODUS_LIB.ex_int64_status(self.fileId) & EX_IDS_INT64_API:
6101            prop_val = ctypes.c_longlong(0)
6102        else:
6103            prop_val = ctypes.c_int(0)
6104        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_prop(
6105            self.fileId,
6106            obj_type,
6107            obj_id,
6108            ctypes.byref(prop_name),
6109            ctypes.byref(prop_val))
6110        return prop_val.value
6111
6112    def __ex_put_prop(self, objType, objId, propName, propVal):
6113        obj_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(objType))
6114        obj_id = ctypes.c_longlong(objId)
6115        prop_name = ctypes.create_string_buffer(propName.encode('ascii'), MAX_STR_LENGTH + 1)
6116        prop_val = ctypes.c_longlong(propVal)
6117        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_prop(
6118            self.fileId,
6119            obj_type,
6120            obj_id,
6121            ctypes.byref(prop_name),
6122            prop_val)
6123        return True
6124
6125    def __ex_update(self):
6126        EXODUS_LIB.ex_update(self.fileId)
6127        return True
6128
6129# --------------------------------------------------------------------
6130# Utility Functions
6131# --------------------------------------------------------------------
6132
6133
6134def collectElemConnectivity(exodusHandle, connectivity):
6135    """
6136      This function generates a list of lists that represent the element connectivity.
6137
6138    Usage:
6139    ------
6140    >>> with exodus("file.g", "r") as exodusHandle:
6141    >>>     connectivity = []
6142    >>>     collectElemConnectivity(exodusHandle, connectivity)
6143    """
6144
6145    if not isinstance(connectivity, list):
6146        raise Exception(
6147            "ERROR: connectivity is not a list in call to collectElemConnectivity().")
6148    if connectivity:
6149        raise Exception(
6150            "ERROR: connectivity is not empty in call to collectElemConnectivity().")
6151
6152    blockIds = exodusHandle.get_ids('EX_ELEM_BLOCK')
6153    for blId in blockIds:
6154        (elem_block_conn, num_elem, num_nodes) = exodusHandle.get_elem_connectivity(blId)
6155        for k in range(num_elem):
6156            i = k * num_nodes
6157            j = i + num_nodes
6158            local_elem_conn = elem_block_conn[i:j]
6159            connectivity.append(local_elem_conn)
6160
6161
6162def collectLocalNodeToLocalElems(
6163        exodusHandle,
6164        connectivity,
6165        localNodeToLocalElems):
6166    """
6167      This function generates a list of lists to go from local node id
6168      to local elem id.
6169
6170    Usage:
6171    ------
6172    >>> connectivity = [] ## If this is not empty it will assume it is already filled.
6173    >>> localNodeToLocalElems = []
6174    >>> with exodus("file.g", "r") as exodusHandle:
6175    >>>     collectLocalNodeToLocalElems(exodusHandle, connectivity, localNodeToLocalElems)
6176    """
6177
6178    if not isinstance(connectivity, list):
6179        raise Exception(
6180            "ERROR: connectivity is not a list in call to collectLocalNodeToLocalElems().")
6181    if not isinstance(localNodeToLocalElems, list):
6182        raise Exception(
6183            "ERROR: localNodeToLocalElems is not a list in call to collectLocalNodeToLocalElems().")
6184    if localNodeToLocalElems:
6185        raise Exception(
6186            "ERROR: localNodeToLocalElems is not empty in call to collectLocalNodeToLocalElems().")
6187
6188    if not connectivity:
6189        collectElemConnectivity(exodusHandle, connectivity)
6190
6191    numNodes = exodusHandle.num_nodes()
6192    for _i in range(numNodes + 1):
6193        localNodeToLocalElems.append([])
6194
6195    localElemId = 0
6196    for local_elem_conn in connectivity:
6197        for n in local_elem_conn:
6198            localNodeToLocalElems[n].append(localElemId)
6199        localElemId = localElemId + 1
6200
6201
6202def collectLocalElemToLocalElems(
6203        exodusHandle,
6204        connectivity,
6205        localNodeToLocalElems,
6206        localElemToLocalElems):
6207    """
6208      This function generates a list of lists to go from local elem id
6209      to connected local elem ids.
6210
6211    Usage:
6212    ------
6213    >>> connectivity = [] ## If this is not empty it will assume it is already filled.
6214    >>> localNodeToLocalElems = [] ## If this is not empty it will assume it is already filled.
6215    >>> localElemToLocalElems = []
6216    >>> with exodus("file.g", "r") as exodusHandle:
6217    >>>     collectLocalElemToLocalElems(exodusHandle, connectivity, localNodeToLocalElems,
6218    ...                              localElemToLocalElems)
6219    """
6220
6221    if not isinstance(connectivity, list):
6222        raise Exception(
6223            "ERROR: connectivity is not a list in call to collectLocalElemToLocalElems().")
6224    if not isinstance(localNodeToLocalElems, list):
6225        raise Exception(
6226            "ERROR: localNodeToLocalElems is not a list in call to collectLocalElemToLocalElems().")
6227    if not isinstance(localElemToLocalElems, list):
6228        raise Exception(
6229            "ERROR: localElemToLocalElems is not a list in call to collectLocalElemToLocalElems().")
6230    if localElemToLocalElems:
6231        raise Exception(
6232            "ERROR: localElemToLocalElems is not empty in call to collectLocalElemToLocalElems().")
6233
6234    if not connectivity:
6235        collectElemConnectivity(exodusHandle, connectivity)
6236    if not localNodeToLocalElems:
6237        collectLocalNodeToLocalElems(
6238            exodusHandle, connectivity, localNodeToLocalElems)
6239
6240    numElems = exodusHandle.num_elems()
6241    for _i in range(numElems):
6242        localElemToLocalElems.append([])
6243    for localElemId in range(numElems):
6244        nodeList = list(connectivity[localElemId])
6245        newConnectedElems = []
6246        for n in nodeList:
6247            newConnectedElems.extend(iter(localNodeToLocalElems[n]))
6248        localElemToLocalElems[localElemId] = list(set(newConnectedElems))
6249
6250
6251def copy_mesh(fromFileName, toFileName, exoFromObj=None, additionalElementAttributes=None, array_type='ctype'):
6252    """
6253    Copies the mesh data from an existing exodus database to a new exodus
6254    database.
6255
6256    Parameters
6257    ----------
6258    fromFileName : string
6259        File name of the exodus mesh to be copied
6260    toFileName : string
6261        File name of the new exodus mesh
6262    exoFromObj : exodus object, optional
6263        Exodus object to be copied from.  If an exodus object is supplied, the
6264        fromFileName string will be ignored.
6265    additionalElementAttributes : list
6266        list of element attribute names to add to all blocks or tuples
6267        ( name, blkIds ) where name is the element attribute to add and blkIds is
6268        a list of blkIds to add it to.
6269    array_type : 'ctype' | 'numpy'
6270        Specifies whether arrays will be imported and copied as ctype or numpy
6271        arrays.  (This option should make no difference to the user, but it can
6272        be used by developers to test whether the commands within this function
6273        handle both array types correctly.)
6274
6275    Returns
6276    -------
6277    exo_to : exodus object
6278        New exodus mesh
6279
6280    Note:
6281    -----
6282    This function also allows one to add new element attributes during the copy
6283    process.  The number of element attributes is permanently set when the
6284    block is created, meaning new element attributes can only be added to an
6285    existing mesh by copying it to a new mesh.  The values of the element
6286    attributes are set to their defaults so that the user can populate them
6287    later.
6288    """
6289    if additionalElementAttributes is None:
6290        additionalElementAttributes = []
6291    # If the user did not supply a exodus object to copy from, attempt to read an
6292    # exodus database with the name "fromFileName"
6293    if exoFromObj is None:
6294        exoFrom = exodus(fromFileName, "r", array_type=array_type)
6295    else:
6296        exoFrom = exoFromObj
6297
6298    if os.path.isfile(toFileName):
6299        raise Exception(
6300            "ERROR: ",
6301            toFileName,
6302            " file already exists cowardly exiting instead of overwriting in call to copy_mesh().")
6303
6304    title = exoFrom.title().encode('ascii')
6305    ex_pars = ex_init_params(num_dim=exoFrom.num_dimensions(),
6306                             num_nodes=exoFrom.num_nodes(),
6307                             num_elem=exoFrom.num_elems(),
6308                             num_elem_blk=exoFrom.num_blks(),
6309                             num_node_sets=exoFrom.num_node_sets(),
6310                             num_side_sets=exoFrom.num_side_sets(),
6311                             num_assembly=exoFrom.num_assembly(),
6312                             num_blob=exoFrom.num_blob())
6313
6314    exo_to = exodus(toFileName, mode="w", array_type=array_type,
6315                    title=title, init_params=ex_pars)
6316
6317    debugPrint = False
6318    if debugPrint:
6319        print("Transfer QA records")
6320    qaRecords = exoFrom.get_qa_records()
6321    exo_to.put_qa_records(qaRecords)
6322
6323    if debugPrint:
6324        print("Transfer Nodal Coordinates and Names")
6325    exo_to.put_coord_names(exoFrom.get_coord_names())
6326    (xCoords, yCoords, zCoords) = exoFrom.get_coords()
6327    exo_to.put_coords(xCoords, yCoords, zCoords)
6328
6329    if debugPrint:
6330        print("Transfer Node Id Map")
6331    nodeIdMap = exoFrom.get_node_id_map()
6332    exo_to.put_node_id_map(nodeIdMap)
6333
6334    if debugPrint:
6335        print("Construct mapping from block ID to element attribute data")
6336    # The exodus library does not provide a way to add only new element
6337    # attributes, so we must collect both the new and the old element
6338    # attributes
6339    e_attr_names = {}
6340    e_attr_vals = {}
6341    # Collect the old element attribute names and the number of elements in each
6342    # block
6343    blk_ids = exoFrom.get_ids('EX_ELEM_BLOCK')
6344    blk_num_elem = {}
6345    for blk_id in blk_ids:
6346        (elemType, numElem, nodesPerElem, numAttr) = exoFrom.elem_blk_info(blk_id)
6347        e_attr_names[blk_id] = []
6348        e_attr_vals[blk_id] = []
6349        if numAttr > 0:
6350            e_attr_names[blk_id].extend(
6351                exoFrom.get_attribute_names('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', blk_id))
6352            e_attr_vals[blk_id].extend(exoFrom.get_elem_attr(blk_id))
6353        blk_num_elem[blk_id] = numElem
6354    # Collect the new element attribute names
6355    # (The new names are mapped from "attribute name" to "list of block IDs that
6356    # contain that attribute".  We need to have them be mapped as "block ID" to
6357    # "list of attribute names contained in that block".)
6358    for item in additionalElementAttributes:
6359        if isinstance(item, tuple):
6360            e_attr_name = item[0]
6361            e_attr_blk_ids = item[1]
6362        elif isinstance(item, str):
6363            e_attr_name = item
6364            e_attr_blk_ids = blk_ids
6365        else:
6366            print(f"Warning additional element attribute item {item} is not right type to add.")
6367
6368            print("should be a string or tuple, skipping")
6369        for blk_id in e_attr_blk_ids:
6370            if blk_id in blk_ids:
6371                e_attr_names[blk_id].append(e_attr_name)
6372                # Concatenate all element attribute values into a single big list,
6373                # because that is format required by exo.put_elem_attr().
6374                e_attr_vals[blk_id].extend([0.0] * blk_num_elem[blk_id])
6375
6376    if debugPrint:
6377        print("Transfer Element Data")
6378    blkIds = exoFrom.get_ids('EX_ELEM_BLOCK')
6379    for blkId in blkIds:
6380        (elemType, numElem, nodesPerElem, _oldnumAttr) = exoFrom.elem_blk_info(blkId)
6381        numAttr = len(e_attr_names[blkId])
6382        exo_to.put_elem_blk_info(blkId, elemType, numElem, nodesPerElem, numAttr)
6383        (connectivity, numElem, nodesPerElem) = exoFrom.get_elem_connectivity(blkId)
6384        exo_to.put_elem_connectivity(blkId, connectivity)
6385        if numAttr > 0:
6386            exo_to.put_attribute_names('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', blkId, e_attr_names[blkId])
6387            exo_to.put_elem_attr(blkId, e_attr_vals[blkId])
6388        elemProps = exoFrom.get_element_property_names()
6389        for elemProp in elemProps:
6390            propVal = exoFrom.get_element_property_value(blkId, elemProp)
6391            if elemProp == "ID" and propVal == blkId:
6392                continue
6393            else:
6394                exo_to.put_element_property_value(blkId, elemProp, propVal)
6395        blockName = exoFrom.get_name('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', blkId)
6396        exo_to.put_name('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', blkId, blockName)
6397
6398    if debugPrint:
6399        print("Transfer Element Id Map")
6400    elemIdMap = exoFrom.get_elem_id_map()
6401    exo_to.put_elem_id_map(elemIdMap)
6402
6403    if debugPrint:
6404        print("Transfer Node Sets")
6405    if exoFrom.num_node_sets() > 0:
6406        nodeSetProps = exoFrom.get_node_set_property_names()
6407        nodeSetIds = exoFrom.get_ids('EX_NODE_SET')
6408        for nsId in nodeSetIds:
6409            (numSetNodes, numSetDistFacts) = exoFrom.get_set_params('EX_NODE_SET', nsId)
6410            exo_to.put_node_set_params(nsId, numSetNodes, numSetDistFacts)
6411            nsNodes = exoFrom.get_node_set_nodes(nsId)
6412            exo_to.put_node_set(nsId, nsNodes)
6413            if numSetDistFacts > 0:
6414                nsDF = exoFrom.get_node_set_dist_facts(nsId)
6415                exo_to.put_node_set_dist_fact(nsId, nsDF)
6416            nodeSetName = exoFrom.get_name('EX_NODE_SET', nsId)
6417            exo_to.put_name('EX_NODE_SET', nsId, nodeSetName)
6418            for nodeSetProp in nodeSetProps:
6419                propVal = exoFrom.get_node_set_property_value(
6420                    nsId, nodeSetProp)
6421                if nodeSetProp == "ID" and propVal == nsId:
6422                    continue
6423                else:
6424                    exo_to.put_node_set_property_value(
6425                        nsId, nodeSetProp, propVal)
6426
6427    if debugPrint:
6428        print("Transfer Side Sets")
6429    if exoFrom.num_side_sets() > 0:
6430        sideSetProps = exoFrom.get_side_set_property_names()
6431        sideSetIds = exoFrom.get_ids('EX_SIDE_SET')
6432        for ssId in sideSetIds:
6433            (numSetSides, numSetDistFacts) = exoFrom.get_set_params('EX_SIDE_SET', ssId)
6434            exo_to.put_side_set_params(ssId, numSetSides, numSetDistFacts)
6435            (elemList, sideList) = exoFrom.get_side_set(ssId)
6436            exo_to.put_side_set(ssId, elemList, sideList)
6437            if numSetDistFacts > 0:
6438                ssDF = exoFrom.get_side_set_dist_fact(ssId)
6439                exo_to.put_side_set_dist_fact(ssId, ssDF)
6440            sideSetName = exoFrom.get_name('EX_SIDE_SET', ssId)
6441            exo_to.put_name('EX_SIDE_SET', ssId, sideSetName)
6442            for sideSetProp in sideSetProps:
6443                propVal = exoFrom.get_side_set_property_value(
6444                    ssId, sideSetProp)
6445                if sideSetProp == "ID" and propVal == ssId:
6446                    continue
6447                else:
6448                    exo_to.put_side_set_property_value(
6449                        ssId, sideSetProp, propVal)
6450
6451    # If the user did not supply an exodus object to copy from, then close the
6452    # database.
6453    if exoFromObj is None:
6454        exoFrom.close()
6455
6456    return exo_to
6457
6458
6459def transfer_variables(exoFrom, exo_to, array_type='ctype', additionalGlobalVariables=None, additionalNodalVariables=None, additionalElementVariables=None, additionalNodeSetVariables=None, additionalSideSetVariables=None):
6460    """
6461    This function transfers variables from `exoFrom` to `exo_to` and allows
6462    additional variables to be added with `additionalGlobalVariables`,
6463    `additionalNodalVariables`, and `additionalElementVariables`.  Additional
6464    variables values are set to their defaults so that the user can populate
6465    them later.
6466
6467    Parameters
6468    ----------
6469    exoFrom : exodus database object
6470        exodus object to transfer from
6471
6472    exo_to : exodus database object
6473        exodus object to transfer to
6474
6475    additionalGlobalVariables : list
6476        list of global variable names to add.
6477
6478    additionalNodalVariables : list
6479        list of nodal variable names to add.
6480
6481    additionalElementVariables : list
6482        should be a list of element variable names to add to all blocks or
6483        tuples `(name, blkIds)` where `name` is the element variable to add
6484        and `blkIds` is a list of block ids to add it to.
6485    """
6486    if additionalGlobalVariables is None:
6487        additionalGlobalVariables = []
6488    if additionalNodalVariables is None:
6489        additionalNodalVariables = []
6490    if additionalElementVariables is None:
6491        additionalElementVariables = []
6492    if additionalNodeSetVariables is None:
6493        additionalNodeSetVariables = []
6494    if additionalSideSetVariables is None:
6495        additionalSideSetVariables = []
6496    # IDEA: It may make sense to make transfer_variables() strictly transfer
6497    # variables, and use add_variables() to add new variables.  Alternatively,
6498    # add_variables() could be called within transfer_variables() to add
6499    # new variables to the exo_to database.  Either way, we should minimize
6500    # duplicate code if possible.
6501
6502    debugPrint = False
6503
6504    if not isinstance(additionalGlobalVariables, list):
6505        raise Exception("ERROR: additionalGlobalVariables is not a list.")
6506    if not isinstance(additionalNodalVariables, list):
6507        raise Exception("ERROR: additionalNodalVariables is not a list.")
6508    if not isinstance(additionalElementVariables, list):
6509        raise Exception("ERROR: additionalElementVariables is not a list.")
6510    if not isinstance(additionalNodeSetVariables, list):
6511        raise Exception("ERROR: additionalNodeSetVariables is not a list.")
6512    if not isinstance(additionalSideSetVariables, list):
6513        raise Exception("ERROR: additionalSideSetVariables is not a list.")
6514
6515    if debugPrint:
6516        print("Transfer Info records")
6517    numInfoRecs = exoFrom.num_info_records()
6518    if numInfoRecs > 0:
6519        infoRecs = exoFrom.get_info_records()
6520        exo_to.put_info_records(infoRecs)
6521    if debugPrint:
6522        print("Transfer time values")
6523
6524    nSteps = exoFrom.num_times()
6525    if nSteps == 0:
6526        return exo_to
6527
6528    timeVals = exoFrom.get_times()
6529    for step in range(nSteps):
6530        exo_to.put_time(step + 1, timeVals[step])
6531
6532    if debugPrint:
6533        print("Add Global Variables")
6534    nNewGlobalVars = len(additionalGlobalVariables)
6535    nGlobalVars = exoFrom.get_variable_number('EX_GLOBAL') + nNewGlobalVars
6536    defaultNewVarVals = [0.0 for _ in range(nNewGlobalVars)]
6537    if nGlobalVars > 0:
6538        exo_to.set_variable_number('EX_GLOBAL', nGlobalVars)
6539        gVarNames = exoFrom.get_variable_names('EX_GLOBAL')
6540        gVarNames.extend(additionalGlobalVariables)
6541        for nameIndex in range(nGlobalVars):
6542            globalVarName = gVarNames[nameIndex]
6543            exo_to.put_variable_name('EX_GLOBAL', globalVarName, nameIndex + 1)
6544        for step in range(nSteps):
6545            gValues = exoFrom.get_all_global_variable_values(step + 1)
6546            if array_type == 'numpy':
6547                gValues = exo_to.np.append(gValues, defaultNewVarVals)
6548            else:
6549                gValues.extend(defaultNewVarVals)
6550            exo_to.put_all_global_variable_values(step + 1, gValues)
6551
6552    if debugPrint:
6553        print("Add Nodal Variables")
6554    nNewNodalVars = len(additionalNodalVariables)
6555    nOrigNodalVars = exoFrom.get_variable_number('EX_NODAL')
6556    nNodalVars = nOrigNodalVars + nNewNodalVars
6557    if nNodalVars > 0:
6558        exo_to.set_variable_number('EX_NODAL', nNodalVars)
6559        nVarNames = exoFrom.get_variable_names('EX_NODAL')
6560        nVarNames.extend(additionalNodalVariables)
6561        for nameIndex in range(nNodalVars):
6562            nodalVarName = nVarNames[nameIndex]
6563            exo_to.put_variable_name('EX_NODAL', nodalVarName, nameIndex + 1)
6564            if nameIndex < nOrigNodalVars:
6565                for step in range(nSteps):
6566                    nValues = exoFrom.get_node_variable_values(
6567                        nodalVarName, step + 1)
6568                    exo_to.put_node_variable_values(
6569                        nodalVarName, step + 1, nValues)
6570
6571    internal_transfer_variables(exoFrom, exo_to, 'EX_ELEM_BLOCK', additionalElementVariables, debugPrint)
6572    internal_transfer_variables(exoFrom, exo_to, 'EX_NODE_SET', additionalNodeSetVariables, debugPrint)
6573    internal_transfer_variables(exoFrom, exo_to, 'EX_SIDE_SET', additionalSideSetVariables, debugPrint)
6574    return exo_to
6575
6576
6577def internal_transfer_variables(exoFrom, exo_to, obj_type, additionalVariables, debugPrint):
6578    """ Internal support function for `exodus.transfer_variables` """
6579    if debugPrint:
6580        print("Construct Truth Table for additionalVariables")
6581    blkIds = exoFrom.get_ids(obj_type)
6582    numBlks = len(blkIds)
6583    newVariableNames = []
6584    newVariableBlocks = []
6585    for item in additionalVariables:
6586        if isinstance(item, tuple):
6587            newVariableNames.append(item[0])
6588            inBlks = [blkId for blkId in item[1] if blkId in blkIds]
6589            newVariableBlocks.append(inBlks)
6590        elif isinstance(item, str):
6591            newVariableNames.append(item)
6592            newVariableBlocks.append(blkIds)
6593        else:
6594            print(("Warning additionalVariable item ",
6595                   item, " is not right type to add."))
6596            print("should be a string or tuple, skipping")
6597
6598    nSteps = exoFrom.num_times()
6599    if debugPrint:
6600        print("Add Variables")
6601    nNewVars = len(newVariableNames)
6602    nOrigVars = exoFrom.get_variable_number(obj_type)
6603    nVars = nOrigVars + nNewVars
6604    if nVars > 0:
6605        exo_to.set_variable_number(obj_type, nVars)
6606        origVarNames = exoFrom.get_variable_names(obj_type)
6607        origVarNames.extend(newVariableNames)
6608        truthTable = []
6609        if nOrigVars > 0:
6610            truthTable = exoFrom.get_variable_truth_table(obj_type)
6611        if nNewVars > 0:
6612            newTruth = []
6613            for j in range(numBlks):
6614
6615                for k in range(nOrigVars):
6616                    index = j * nOrigVars + k
6617                    newTruth.append(truthTable[index])
6618                for m in range(nNewVars):
6619                    if blkIds[j] in newVariableBlocks[m]:
6620                        newTruth.append(True)
6621                    else:
6622                        newTruth.append(False)
6623            truthTable = newTruth
6624        exo_to.set_variable_truth_table(obj_type, truthTable)
6625        for nameIndex in range(nVars):
6626            varName = origVarNames[nameIndex]
6627            exo_to.put_variable_name(obj_type, varName, nameIndex + 1)
6628        truthIndex = 0
6629        for blkId in blkIds:
6630            for origVarName in origVarNames:
6631                if truthTable[truthIndex]:
6632                    for step in range(nSteps):
6633                        eValues = exoFrom.get_variable_values(obj_type, blkId,
6634                                                              origVarName, step + 1)
6635                        exo_to.put_variable_values(obj_type, blkId,
6636                                                   origVarName, step + 1, eValues)
6637                truthIndex = truthIndex + 1
6638            truthIndex = truthIndex + nNewVars
6639
6640
6641def add_variables(exo, global_vars=None, nodal_vars=None, element_vars=None, node_set_vars=None, side_set_vars=None):
6642    """
6643    This function adds variables to the exodus object.  The values of the
6644    variables are set to their defaults so that the user can populate them later.
6645
6646    Parameters
6647    ----------
6648    exo : exodus database object
6649        Exodus database that variables will be added to.
6650    global_vars : list
6651        global variable names to add.
6652    nodal_vars : list
6653        nodal variable names to add.
6654    element_vars : list
6655        list of element variable names to add to all blocks or tuples
6656        ( name, blkIds ) where name is the element variable to add and blkIds is
6657        a list of blkIds to add it to.
6658    node_set_vars : list
6659        list of node set variable names to add to all sets or tuples
6660        ( name, setIds ) where name is the node set variable to add and `setIds` is
6661        a list of `setIds` to add it to.
6662    side_set_vars : list
6663        list of side set variable names to add to all sets or tuples
6664        ( name, setIds ) where name is the side set variable to add and `setIds` is
6665        a list of `setIds` to add it to.
6666
6667    Returns
6668    -------
6669    exo : exodus database object
6670        Exodus database with variables added to it.  (The values of the variables
6671        are set to their defaults so that the user can populate them later.)
6672
6673    Note
6674    ----
6675    This function does not allow one to add element attributes to an exodus
6676    database.  See `exodus.copy_mesh` function for that capability.
6677    """
6678    if global_vars is None:
6679        global_vars = []
6680    if nodal_vars is None:
6681        nodal_vars = []
6682    if element_vars is None:
6683        element_vars = []
6684    if node_set_vars is None:
6685        node_set_vars = []
6686    if side_set_vars is None:
6687        side_set_vars = []
6688    debugPrint = False
6689
6690    if not isinstance(global_vars, list):
6691        raise Exception("ERROR: global_vars is not a list.")
6692    if not isinstance(nodal_vars, list):
6693        raise Exception("ERROR: nodal_vars is not a list.")
6694    if not isinstance(element_vars, list):
6695        raise Exception("ERROR: element_vars is not a list.")
6696    if not isinstance(node_set_vars, list):
6697        raise Exception("ERROR: node_set_vars is not a list.")
6698    if not isinstance(side_set_vars, list):
6699        raise Exception("ERROR: side_set_vars is not a list.")
6700
6701    if exo.modeChar == 'r':
6702        raise Exception(
6703            "ERROR: variables cannot be added to an exodus object in read only mode")
6704
6705    if debugPrint:
6706        print("Add Global Variables")
6707    n_new_vars = len(global_vars)
6708    n_old_vars = exo.get_variable_number('EX_GLOBAL')
6709    n_vars = n_old_vars + n_new_vars
6710    default_vals = [0.0] * n_new_vars
6711    if n_new_vars > 0:
6712        exo.set_variable_number('EX_GLOBAL', n_vars)
6713        for i, var_name in enumerate(global_vars):
6714            exo.put_variable_name('EX_GLOBAL', var_name, n_old_vars + i + 1)
6715        # One might wish to put all the values for a given global variable in the
6716        # database at once, but exo.put_global_variable_value() ends up loading
6717        # all the global variables for a given step and then putting them all back
6718        # in, so we might as well just use
6719        # exo.put_all_global_variable_values().
6720        nSteps = exo.num_times()
6721        for step in range(nSteps):
6722            gValues = exo.get_all_global_variable_values(step + 1)
6723            if exo.use_numpy:
6724                gValues = exo.np.append(gValues, default_vals)
6725            else:
6726                gValues.extend(default_vals)
6727            exo.put_all_global_variable_values(step + 1, gValues)
6728
6729    if debugPrint:
6730        print("Add Nodal Variables")
6731    n_new_vars = len(nodal_vars)
6732    n_old_vars = exo.get_variable_number('EX_NODAL')
6733    n_vars = n_old_vars + n_new_vars
6734    if n_new_vars > 0:
6735        exo.set_variable_number('EX_NODAL', n_vars)
6736        for i, var_name in enumerate(nodal_vars):
6737            exo.put_variable_name('EX_NODAL', var_name, i + n_old_vars + 1)
6738
6739    internal_add_variables(exo, 'EX_ELEM_BLOCK', element_vars, debugPrint)
6740    internal_add_variables(exo, 'EX_NODE_SET', node_set_vars, debugPrint)
6741    internal_add_variables(exo, 'EX_SIDE_SET', side_set_vars, debugPrint)
6742
6743    return exo
6744
6745
6746def internal_add_variables(exo, obj_type, entvars, debugPrint):
6747    """ Internal support function for `exodus.add_variables` """
6748
6749    if len(entvars) == 0:
6750        return
6751
6752    if debugPrint:
6753        print("Construct Truth Table for additional variables")
6754
6755    new_var_blks = []
6756    blk_ids = exo.get_ids(obj_type)
6757    new_var_names = []
6758    for item in entvars:
6759        if isinstance(item, tuple):
6760            new_var_names.append(item[0])
6761            in_blks = [blk_id for blk_id in item[1] if blk_id in blk_ids]
6762            new_var_blks.append(in_blks)
6763        elif isinstance(item, str):
6764            new_var_names.append(item)
6765            new_var_blks.append(blk_ids)
6766        else:
6767            print(f"Warning additional variable item {item} is not right type to add.")
6768            print("should be a string or tuple, skipping")
6769
6770    if debugPrint:
6771        print("Add Variables")
6772    n_new_vars = len(new_var_names)
6773    if n_new_vars > 0:
6774        n_old_vars = exo.get_variable_number(obj_type)
6775        n_vars = n_old_vars + n_new_vars
6776        exo.set_variable_number(obj_type, n_vars)
6777        old_truth_table = []
6778        if n_old_vars > 0:
6779            old_truth_table = exo.get_variable_truth_table(obj_type)
6780        truth_table = []
6781        n_blks = len(blk_ids)
6782        for j in range(n_blks):
6783            for k in range(n_old_vars):
6784                ndx = j * n_old_vars + k
6785                truth_table.append(old_truth_table[ndx])
6786            for m in range(n_new_vars):
6787                if blk_ids[j] in new_var_blks[m]:
6788                    truth_table.append(True)
6789                else:
6790                    truth_table.append(False)
6791        exo.set_variable_truth_table(obj_type, truth_table)
6792        for i, var_name in enumerate(new_var_names):
6793            exo.put_variable_name(obj_type, var_name, n_old_vars + i + 1)
6794
6795
6796def copyTransfer(fromFileName, toFileName, array_type='ctype', additionalGlobalVariables=None, additionalNodalVariables=None, additionalElementVariables=None, additionalNodeSetVariables=None, additionalSideSetVariables=None, additionalElementAttributes=None):
6797    """
6798    This function creates an exodus file `toFileName` and copies
6799    everything from exodus file `fromFileName` returning a file handle
6800    to `toFileName`.
6801
6802    Additional space is allocated for `additionalGlobalVariables`,
6803    `additionalNodalVariables` and `additionalElementVariables` if
6804    specified.
6805
6806    Parameters
6807    ----------
6808    fromFileName : string
6809        File name of the exodus mesh to be copied
6810    toFileName : string
6811        File name of the new exodus mesh
6812    array_type : 'ctype' | 'numpy'
6813        Specifies whether arrays will be imported and copied as ctype or numpy
6814        arrays.  (This option should make no difference to the user, but it can
6815        be used by developers to test whether the commands within this function
6816        handle both array types correctly.)
6817    additionalGlobalVariables : list
6818        list of global variable names to add.
6819    additionalNodalVariables: list
6820        list of nodal variable names to add.
6821    additionalElementVariables: list
6822        should be a list of element variable
6823        names to add to all blocks or tuples (name, blkIds) where name is
6824        the element variable to add and blkIds is a list of blkIds to add
6825        it to.
6826    additionalElementAttributes: list
6827        list of element attribute names to
6828         add to all blocks or tuples ( name, blkIds ) where name is the
6829         element attribute to add and blkIds is a list of blkIds to add it
6830         to.
6831
6832    Usage:
6833    ------
6834    >>> fromFileName = "input.e"
6835    >>> toFileName = "output.e"
6836    >>> addGlobalVariables = [] ## Do not add any new global variables
6837    >>> ## Add node_dummy1 and node_dummy2 as new node variables
6838    >>> addNodeVariables = ["node_dummy1", "node_dummy2"]
6839    >>> ## Add elem_dummy1 on blkIds 1, 2, 3 and elem_dummy2 on all blocks
6840    >>> addElementVariables = [ ("elem_dummy1", [1, 2, 3]), "elem_dummy2" ]
6841    >>> ## Add elem_attr_dummy1 on blkIds 1,2,3 and elem_attr_dummy2 on all blocks
6842    >>> addElementAttributes = [ ("elem_attr_dummy1",[1,2,3]), "elem_attr_dummy2" ]
6843
6844    >>> toFileHandle = copyTransfer(fromFileName,toFileName,addGlobalVariables,addNodeVariables,
6845    ...                             addElementVariables,addElementAttributes)
6846
6847    >>> ## Fill in new variables
6848
6849    >>> toFileHandle.close()
6850    """
6851
6852    if additionalGlobalVariables is None:
6853        additionalGlobalVariables = []
6854    if additionalNodalVariables is None:
6855        additionalNodalVariables = []
6856    if additionalElementVariables is None:
6857        additionalElementVariables = []
6858    if additionalNodeSetVariables is None:
6859        additionalNodeSetVariables = []
6860    if additionalSideSetVariables is None:
6861        additionalSideSetVariables = []
6862    if additionalElementAttributes is None:
6863        additionalElementAttributes = []
6864    with exodus(fromFileName, "r", array_type=array_type) as exoFrom:
6865        exo_to = copy_mesh(fromFileName, toFileName, exoFromObj=exoFrom,
6866                           additionalElementAttributes=additionalElementAttributes,
6867                           array_type=array_type)
6868
6869        exo_to = transfer_variables(
6870            exoFrom,
6871            exo_to,
6872            additionalGlobalVariables=additionalGlobalVariables,
6873            additionalNodalVariables=additionalNodalVariables,
6874            additionalElementVariables=additionalElementVariables,
6875            additionalNodeSetVariables=additionalNodeSetVariables,
6876            additionalSideSetVariables=additionalSideSetVariables,
6877            array_type=array_type)
6878
6879    return exo_to
6880
6881
6882def ctype_to_numpy(exo, c_array):
6883    """
6884    Converts a c-type array into a numpy array
6885
6886    Parameters
6887    ----------
6888    exo : exodus object
6889        exodus database object initialized with the option `array_type = 'numpy'`
6890    c_array : c-type array
6891        c-type array to be converted into a numpy array
6892
6893    Returns
6894    -------
6895    np_array : numpy array
6896        Numpy array converted from c-type array
6897    """
6898    # ctypes currently produce invalid PEP 3118 type codes, which causes numpy
6899    # to issue a warning.  This is a bug and can be ignored.
6900    # http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4964101/pep-3118-warning-when-using-ctypes-array-as-numpy-array
6901    if not c_array:
6902        return exo.np.array([])
6903
6904    with exo.warnings.catch_warnings():
6905        exo.warnings.simplefilter('ignore')
6906        np_array = exo.np.ctypeslib.as_array(c_array)
6907    return np_array
def basename(file_name): 
105def basename(file_name):
106    """
107    Extract base name from file_name.
108    `basename("test.e") -> "test"`
109    """
110    return os.path.splitext(file_name)[0]

Extract base name from file_name. basename("test.e") -> "test"

def getExodusVersion(): 
113def getExodusVersion():
114    """
115    Parse the exodusII.h header file and return the version number or 0 if not
116    found.
117    """
118
119    return _parse_exodus_version('#define EXODUS_VERSION       "8.22"')

Parse the exodusII.h header file and return the version number or 0 if not found.

class ex_options(enum.Enum): 
136class ex_options(Enum):
137    """
138    `ex_opts()` function codes - codes are OR'ed into exopts
139
140    Parameters
141    ----------
142    EX_DEFAULT
143         Application responsible for calling `ex_err()` to get error and warning messages to output; library is quiet
144    EX_VERBOSE
145         Verbose mode -- output all error and warning messages
146    EX_DEBUG
147         Output Debug messages
148    EX_ABORT
149         If an error is detected, library will abort instead of letting application decide
150    EX_NULLVERBOSE
151         Output error and warning messages for NULL Entity errors and warnings
152    """
153    EX_DEFAULT = 0
154    EX_VERBOSE = 1
155    EX_DEBUG = 2
156    EX_ABORT = 4
157    EX_NULLVERBOSE = 8

ex_opts() function codes - codes are OR'ed into exopts

Parameters

EX_DEFAULT Application responsible for calling ex_err() to get error and warning messages to output; library is quiet EX_VERBOSE Verbose mode -- output all error and warning messages EX_DEBUG Output Debug messages EX_ABORT If an error is detected, library will abort instead of letting application decide EX_NULLVERBOSE Output error and warning messages for NULL Entity errors and warnings

EX_DEFAULT = <ex_options.EX_DEFAULT: 0>
EX_VERBOSE = <ex_options.EX_VERBOSE: 1>
EX_DEBUG = <ex_options.EX_DEBUG: 2>
EX_ABORT = <ex_options.EX_ABORT: 4>
EX_NULLVERBOSE = <ex_options.EX_NULLVERBOSE: 8>

231    EX_INQ_NODES = 6                        # inquire number of nodes
232    EX_INQ_ELEM = 7                         # inquire number of elements
233    EX_INQ_ELEM_BLK = 8                     # inquire number of element blocks
234    EX_INQ_NODE_SETS = 9                    # inquire number of node sets
235    EX_INQ_NS_NODE_LEN = 10                 # inquire length of node set node list
236    EX_INQ_SIDE_SETS = 11                   # inquire number of side sets
237    EX_INQ_SS_NODE_LEN = 12                 # inquire length of side set node list
238    EX_INQ_SS_ELEM_LEN = 13                 # inquire length of side set element list

247    # inquire length of side set distribution factor list
248    EX_INQ_SS_DF_LEN = 21
249    EX_INQ_LIB_VERS = 22                    # inquire API Lib vers number

251    EX_INQ_NM_PROP = 24                     # inquire number of node map properties
252    EX_INQ_ELEM_MAP = 25                    # inquire number of element maps
253    EX_INQ_NODE_MAP = 26                    # inquire number of node maps
254    EX_INQ_EDGE = 27                        # inquire number of edges

260    EX_INQ_ES_DF_LEN = 31
261    # inquire number of properties stored per edge block
262    EX_INQ_EDGE_PROP = 32
263    # inquire number of properties stored per edge set
264    EX_INQ_ES_PROP = 33
265    EX_INQ_FACE = 34                        # inquire number of faces

274    # inquire number of properties stored per face set

276    EX_INQ_ELEM_SETS = 41                   # inquire number of element sets
277    # inquire length of concat element set element list

286    # inquire size of MAX_NAME_LENGTH dimension on database
287    EX_INQ_DB_MAX_ALLOWED_NAME_LENGTH = 48
288    # inquire size of MAX_NAME_LENGTH dimension on database
289    EX_INQ_DB_MAX_USED_NAME_LENGTH = 49
290    # inquire client-specified max size of returned names
291    EX_INQ_MAX_READ_NAME_LENGTH = 50
292    # inquire size of floating-point values stored on database
293    EX_INQ_DB_FLOAT_SIZE = 51
294    EX_INQ_ASSEMBLY = 60
295    EX_INQ_BLOB = 61
296    EX_INQ_INVALID = -1

Create a collection of name/value pairs.

Example enumeration:

>>> class Color(Enum):
...     RED = 1
...     BLUE = 2
...     GREEN = 3

Access them by:

  • attribute access::
>>> Color.RED
<Color.RED: 1>
  • value lookup:
>>> Color(1)
<Color.RED: 1>
  • name lookup:
>>> Color['RED']
<Color.RED: 1>

Enumerations can be iterated over, and know how many members they have:

>>> len(Color)
3

>>> list(Color)
[<Color.RED: 1>, <Color.BLUE: 2>, <Color.GREEN: 3>]

Methods can be added to enumerations, and members can have their own attributes -- see the documentation for details.

def ex_obj_to_inq(objType): 
320def ex_obj_to_inq(objType):
321    """
322    Return the ex_inquiry string corresponding to the specified objType.
323    This can be passed to the ex_inquiry_map() function to get the number of
324    objects of the specified objType
325    """
326    entity_dictionary = {
327        'EX_ASSEMBLY': 'EX_INQ_ASSEMBLY',
328        'EX_BLOB': 'EX_INQ_BLOB',
329        'EX_EDGE_BLOCK': 'EX_INQ_EDGE_BLK',
330        'EX_FACE_BLOCK': 'EX_INQ_FACE_BLK',
331        'EX_ELEM_BLOCK': 'EX_INQ_ELEM_BLK',
332        'EX_NODE_SET': 'EX_INQ_NODE_SETS',
333        'EX_EDGE_SET': 'EX_INQ_EDGE_SETS',
334        'EX_FACE_SET': 'EX_INQ_FACE_SETS',
335        'EX_ELEM_SET': 'EX_INQ_ELEM_SETS',
336        'EX_SIDE_SET': 'EX_INQ_SIDE_SETS',
337        'EX_NODE_MAP': 'EX_INQ_NODES',
338        'EX_EDGE_MAP': 'EX_INQ_EDGE',
339        'EX_FACE_MAP': 'EX_INQ_FACE',
340        'EX_ELEM_MAP': 'EX_INQ_ELEM',
341    }
342
343    return entity_dictionary.get(objType, -1)

Return the ex_inquiry string corresponding to the specified objType. This can be passed to the ex_inquiry_map() function to get the number of objects of the specified objType

def ex_entity_type_to_objType(entity_type): 
346def ex_entity_type_to_objType(entity_type):
347    """
348    """
349    entity_dictionary = {
350        get_entity_type('EX_ASSEMBLY'): "assembly",
351        get_entity_type('EX_BLOB'): "blob",
352        get_entity_type('EX_EDGE_BLOCK'): "edge block",
353        get_entity_type('EX_FACE_BLOCK'): "face block",
354        get_entity_type('EX_ELEM_BLOCK'): "element block",
355        get_entity_type('EX_NODE_SET'): "node set",
356        get_entity_type('EX_EDGE_SET'): "edge set",
357        get_entity_type('EX_FACE_SET'): "face set",
358        get_entity_type('EX_ELEM_SET'): "element set",
359        get_entity_type('EX_SIDE_SET'): "side set",
360        get_entity_type('EX_NODE_MAP'): "node map",
361        get_entity_type('EX_EDGE_MAP'): "edge map",
362        get_entity_type('EX_FACE_MAP'): "face map",
363        get_entity_type('EX_ELEM_MAP'): "element map"
364    }
365
366    return entity_dictionary.get(entity_type, 'EX_INVALID')
class ex_entity_type(enum.Enum): 
369class ex_entity_type(Enum):
370    """
371    The ex_entity_type enum from the exodusII.h include file
372
373    Parameters
374    ----------
375    EX_NODAL
376         nodal \"block\" for variables
377    EX_NODE_BLOCK
378         alias for EX_NODAL
379    EX_NODE_SET
380         node set property code
381    EX_EDGE_BLOCK
382         edge block property code
383    EX_EDGE_SET
384         edge set property code
385    EX_FACE_BLOCK
386         face block property code
387    EX_FACE_SET
388         face set property code
389    EX_ELEM_BLOCK
390         element block property code
391    EX_ELEM_SET
392         face set property code
393    EX_SIDE_SET
394         side set property code
395    EX_ELEM_MAP
396         element map property code
397    EX_NODE_MAP
398         node map property code
399    EX_EDGE_MAP
400         edge map property code
401    EX_FACE_MAP
402         face map property code
403    EX_GLOBAL
404         global \"block\" for variables
405    EX_COORDINATE
406         kluge so some internal wrapper functions work
407    EX_ASSEMBLY
408         assemblies (collections of other entities)
409    EX_BLOB
410         blob (arbitrary sized binary object)
411    EX_INVALID
412         invalid
413    """
414    EX_NODAL = 14
415    EX_NODE_BLOCK = 14
416    EX_NODE_SET = 2
417    EX_EDGE_BLOCK = 6
418    EX_EDGE_SET = 7
419    EX_FACE_BLOCK = 8
420    EX_FACE_SET = 9
421    EX_ELEM_BLOCK = 1
422    EX_ELEM_SET = 10
423    EX_SIDE_SET = 3
424    EX_ELEM_MAP = 4
425    EX_NODE_MAP = 5
426    EX_EDGE_MAP = 11
427    EX_FACE_MAP = 12
428    EX_GLOBAL = 13
429    EX_COORDINATE = 15
430    EX_ASSEMBLY = 16
431    EX_BLOB = 17
432    EX_INVALID = -1

The ex_entity_type enum from the exodusII.h include file

Parameters

EX_NODAL nodal "block" for variables EX_NODE_BLOCK alias for EX_NODAL EX_NODE_SET node set property code EX_EDGE_BLOCK edge block property code EX_EDGE_SET edge set property code EX_FACE_BLOCK face block property code EX_FACE_SET face set property code EX_ELEM_BLOCK element block property code EX_ELEM_SET face set property code EX_SIDE_SET side set property code EX_ELEM_MAP element map property code EX_NODE_MAP node map property code EX_EDGE_MAP edge map property code EX_FACE_MAP face map property code EX_GLOBAL global "block" for variables EX_COORDINATE kluge so some internal wrapper functions work EX_ASSEMBLY assemblies (collections of other entities) EX_BLOB blob (arbitrary sized binary object) EX_INVALID invalid

def get_entity_type(varType): 
435def get_entity_type(varType):
436    """
437    Map the exodus ex_entity_type flags to an integer value.
438    """
439    try:
440        return ex_entity_type[varType].value
441    except KeyError:
442        return varType if (isinstance(varType, int)) else varType.value

Map the exodus ex_entity_type flags to an integer value.

class ex_init_params(_ctypes.Structure): 
446class ex_init_params(ctypes.Structure):
447    """
448    Parameters defining the model dimension, note that many are optional.
449
450    Parameters
451    ----------
452    num_dim : int
453        number of model dimensions
454    num_nodes : int
455        number of model nodes
456    num_edge : int
457        number of model edges
458    num_edge_blk : int
459        number of model edge blocks
460    num_face : int
461        number of model faces
462    num_face_blk : int
463        number of model face blocks
464    num_elem : int
465        number of model elements
466    num_elem_blk : int
467        number of model element blocks
468    num_node_sets : int
469        number of model node sets
470    num_edge_sets : int
471        number of model edge sets
472    num_face_sets : int
473        number of model face sets
474    num_side_sets : int
475        number of model side sets
476    num_elem_sets : int
477        number of model elem sets
478    num_node_maps : int
479        number of model node maps
480    num_edge_maps : int
481        number of model edge maps
482    num_face_maps : int
483        number of model face maps
484    num_elem_maps : int
485        number of model elem maps
486    num_assembly : int
487        number of assemblies
488    num_blob : int
489        number of blobs
490    """
491    _fields_ = [("title", ctypes.c_char * (MAX_LINE_LENGTH + 1)),
492                ("num_dim", ctypes.c_longlong),
493                ("num_nodes", ctypes.c_longlong),
494                ("num_edge", ctypes.c_longlong),
495                ("num_edge_blk", ctypes.c_longlong),
496                ("num_face", ctypes.c_longlong),
497                ("num_face_blk", ctypes.c_longlong),
498                ("num_elem", ctypes.c_longlong),
499                ("num_elem_blk", ctypes.c_longlong),
500                ("num_node_sets", ctypes.c_longlong),
501                ("num_edge_sets", ctypes.c_longlong),
502                ("num_face_sets", ctypes.c_longlong),
503                ("num_side_sets", ctypes.c_longlong),
504                ("num_elem_sets", ctypes.c_longlong),
505                ("num_node_maps", ctypes.c_longlong),
506                ("num_edge_maps", ctypes.c_longlong),
507                ("num_face_maps", ctypes.c_longlong),
508                ("num_elem_maps", ctypes.c_longlong),
509                ("num_assembly", ctypes.c_longlong),
510                ("num_blob", ctypes.c_longlong)]

Parameters defining the model dimension, note that many are optional.

Parameters

num_dim : int number of model dimensions num_nodes : int number of model nodes num_edge : int number of model edges num_edge_blk : int number of model edge blocks num_face : int number of model faces num_face_blk : int number of model face blocks num_elem : int number of model elements num_elem_blk : int number of model element blocks num_node_sets : int number of model node sets num_edge_sets : int number of model edge sets num_face_sets : int number of model face sets num_side_sets : int number of model side sets num_elem_sets : int number of model elem sets num_node_maps : int number of model node maps num_edge_maps : int number of model edge maps num_face_maps : int number of model face maps num_elem_maps : int number of model elem maps num_assembly : int number of assemblies num_blob : int number of blobs

_ctypes.Structure
Structure
class assembly: 
513class assembly:
514    def __init__(self, name, id, type):
515        self.name = name
516        self.id = id
517        if isinstance(type, str):
518            type = ex_entity_type[type].value
519        if isinstance(type, ex_entity_type):
520            type = type.value
521        self.type = type
522        self.entity_list = []
523
524    def __repr__(self):
525        return "assembly(name=%r, type=%r, id=%r, members=%r)" % (self.name, self.type, self.id, self.entity_list)
assembly(name, id, type) 
514    def __init__(self, name, id, type):
515        self.name = name
516        self.id = id
517        if isinstance(type, str):
518            type = ex_entity_type[type].value
519        if isinstance(type, ex_entity_type):
520            type = type.value
521        self.type = type
522        self.entity_list = []
class ex_assembly(_ctypes.Structure): 
528class ex_assembly(ctypes.Structure):
529    """
530    Structure defining the assembly parameters.
531
532    Parameters
533    ----------
534    id : int64_t
535    name : char *
536    type : ex_entity_type
537    entity_count : int
538    entity_list : void_int *
539    """
540    _fields_ = [("id", ctypes.c_longlong),
541                ("name", ctypes.c_char_p),
542                ("type", ctypes.c_int),
543                ("entity_count", ctypes.c_int),
544                ("entity_list", ctypes.POINTER(ctypes.c_longlong))]

Structure
def setup_ex_assembly(assembly): 
547def setup_ex_assembly(assembly):
548    ctype_assem = ex_assembly(id=assembly.id, name=assembly.name.encode(), type=assembly.type)
549    ctype_assem.entity_count = len(assembly.entity_list)
550    ctype_assem.entity_list = (ctypes.c_longlong * ctype_assem.entity_count)(*assembly.entity_list)
551    return ctype_assem
class blob:

class attribute: 
579class attribute:
580    def __init__(self, name, type, id):
581        self.name = name
582        if isinstance(type, str):
583            type = ex_entity_type[type].value
584        if isinstance(type, ex_entity_type):
585            type = type.value
586        self.entity_type = type
587        self.entity_id = id
588        self.values = []
589
590    def __repr__(self):
591        return "attribute(name=%r, entity_type=%r, entity_id=%r, values=%r)" % (self.name, self.entity_type, self.entity_id, self.values)

class ex_attribute(_ctypes.Structure): 
594class ex_attribute(ctypes.Structure):
595    """
596    Used for accessing underlying exodus library...
597
598    Parameters
599    ----------
600    entity_type : ex_entity_type
601    entity_id : int64_t
602    name : char[257]
603    type : ex_type
604    value_count : int
605    values : void*
606    """
607    _fields_ = [("entity_type", ctypes.c_int),
608                ("entity_id", ctypes.c_longlong),
609                ("name", ctypes.c_char * 257),
610                ("type", ctypes.c_int),
611                ("value_count", ctypes.c_int),
612                ("values", ctypes.c_void_p)]

Structure
class exodus: 
 615class exodus:
 616    """
 617    The exodus model abstraction
 618    """
 619
 620    #
 621    # construction of a new exodus object
 622    #
 623    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
 624
 625    def __init__(self, file, mode=None, array_type='ctype', title=None,
 626                 numDims=None, numNodes=None, numElems=None, numBlocks=None,
 627                 numNodeSets=None, numSideSets=None, numAssembly=None,
 628                 numBlob=None, init_params=None, io_size=0):
 629        """
 630        Open exodus database for data insertion/extraction.
 631
 632        Parameters
 633        ----------
 634        file_name : string
 635           name of exodus file to open
 636        mode : string
 637          'r' for read, 'a' for append, 'w' for write, 'w+' for write+clobber existing file
 638        title : string
 639           database title
 640        array_type : string
 641           'ctype' for c-type arrays, 'numpy' for numpy arrays
 642        num_dims : int
 643           number of model dimensions ('w'/'w+' mode only)
 644        num_nodes : int
 645           number of model nodes ('w'/'w+' mode only)
 646        num_elems : int
 647           number of model elements ('w'/'w+' mode only)
 648        num_blocks : int
 649           number of model element blocks ('w'/'w+' mode only)
 650        num_ns : int
 651           number of model node sets ('w'/'w+' mode only)
 652        num_ss : int
 653           number of model side sets ('w'/'w+' mode only)
 654
 655        init_params : ex_init_params
 656           see `exodus.ex_init_params` for more info.
 657
 658        Returns
 659        -------
 660        exo : exodus object
 661            the open exodus database
 662
 663        Usage
 664        -----
 665
 666        >>> ex_pars = ex_init_params(num_dim=numDims, num_nodes=numNodes,
 667        ...                          num_elem=numElems, num_elem_blk=numElemBlocks, num_assembly=numAssembly)
 668
 669        >>> exo = exodus(file_name, mode=mode, title=title,
 670        ...             array_type=array_type, init_params=ex_pars)
 671        >>> with exodus(file_name, mode=mode, title=title,\
 672        ...             array_type=array_type, init_params=ex_pars) as exo:
 673        ...     pass
 674        """
 675        global SHOW_BANNER
 676        if SHOW_BANNER:
 677            print(EXODUS_PY_COPYRIGHT)
 678            SHOW_BANNER = False
 679
 680        if mode is None:
 681            mode = 'r'
 682
 683        if array_type == 'numpy':
 684            # Import numpy to convert from c-type arrays to numpy arrays
 685            # (Numpy is imported here rather than at the module level, so that
 686            # the import only occurs if the user specifies a numpy array type.
 687            # This way, platforms without numpy installed can still import the
 688            # exodus.py module and just use ctype arrays.)
 689            import numpy as np
 690            self.np = np
 691            self.use_numpy = True
 692            # Warnings module is needed to suppress the invalid warning when
 693            # converting from c-type arrays to numpy arrays
 694            # http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4964101/pep-3118-warning-when-using-ctypes-array-as-numpy-array
 695            import warnings
 696            self.warnings = warnings
 697        else:
 698            self.use_numpy = False
 699
 700        self.EXODUS_LIB = EXODUS_LIB
 701        self.fileName = str(file)
 702        self.basename = basename(file)
 703        self.modeChar = mode
 704        self.fileId = None
 705        self.__open(io_size=io_size)
 706        EXODUS_LIB.ex_set_max_name_length(self.fileId, MAX_NAME_LENGTH)
 707        if mode.lower() in ['w', 'w+']:
 708            if init_params is not None:
 709                self.init_params = init_params
 710                if title is not None:
 711                    self.init_params.title = title
 712                self.put_info_ext(self.init_params)
 713            else:
 714                if numNodeSets is None:
 715                    numNodeSets = 0
 716                if numSideSets is None:
 717                    numSideSets = 0
 718                if numNodes is None:
 719                    numNodes = 0
 720                if numElems is None:
 721                    numElems = 0
 722                if numBlocks is None:
 723                    numBlocks = 0
 724
 725                info = [title, numDims, numNodes, numElems, numBlocks,
 726                        numNodeSets, numSideSets]
 727                if None not in info:
 728                    self.__ex_put_info(info)
 729
 730            self.numTimes = ctypes.c_int(0)
 731        else:
 732            self.__ex_get_info()
 733            self.numTimes = ctypes.c_int(
 734                self.__ex_inquire_int(
 735                    ex_inquiry_map('EX_INQ_TIME')))
 736
 737        self.coordsX = None
 738        self.coordsY = None
 739        self.coordsZ = None
 740        self.times = None
 741
 742    def __enter__(self):
 743        return self
 744
 745    def __exit__(self, type, value, traceback):
 746        self.close()
 747        if not traceback:
 748            return True
 749
 750    def summarize(self):
 751        """
 752        Outputs a summary of the exodus file data. Output is similar to:
 753        ```
 754        Database: base_ioshell_copy.e
 755        Title:  This is the title
 756
 757        Number of spatial dimensions = 3                                                 Number of global variables     = 10
 758        Number of node blocks        = 1         Number of nodes              = 1,331    Number of nodal variables      =  2
 759        Number of element blocks     = 1         Number of elements           = 1,000    Number of element variables    =  5
 760        Number of node sets          = 3         Length of node list          =   363    Number of nodeset variables    =  4
 761        Number of element side sets  = 3         Length of element sides      =   300    Number of sideset variables    =  3
 762        Number of assemblies         = 4                                                 Number of assembly variables   = 10
 763        Number of blobs              = 0                                                 Number of blob     variables   =  0
 764        Number of time steps         = 5
 765        ```
 766        """
 767
 768        sidesets = self.get_ids('EX_SIDE_SET')
 769        total_sides = sum(self.num_faces_in_side_set(sideset) for sideset in sidesets)
 770        nodesets = self.get_ids('EX_NODE_SET')
 771        total_ns_nodes = sum(self.num_nodes_in_node_set(nodeset) for nodeset in nodesets)
 772
 773        num_glo_vars = self.get_variable_number('EX_GLOBAL')
 774        num_nod_vars = self.get_variable_number('EX_NODAL')
 775        num_ele_vars = self.get_variable_number('EX_ELEM_BLOCK')
 776        num_ns_vars = self.get_variable_number('EX_NODE_SET')
 777        num_ss_vars = self.get_variable_number('EX_SIDE_SET')
 778        num_assem_vars = self.get_reduction_variable_number('EX_ASSEMBLY')
 779        num_blob_vars = self.get_reduction_variable_number('EX_BLOB')
 780
 781        print("\n Database: {0}\n"
 782              " Title:\t{17}\n\n"
 783              " Number of spatial dimensions = {1:3d}\t"
 784              "                                   {2:11s}\t"
 785              " Number of global variables     = {11:6d}\n"
 786              " Number of node blocks        = {5:3d}\t"
 787              " Number of nodes              = {3:10n}\t"
 788              " Number of nodal variables      = {12:6d}\n"
 789              " Number of element blocks     = {6:3n}\t"
 790              " Number of elements           = {4:10n}\t"
 791              " Number of element variables    = {13:6d}\n"
 792              " Number of node sets          = {7:3n}\t"
 793              " Length of node list          = {9:10n}\t"
 794              " Number of nodeset variables    = {14:6d}\n"
 795              " Number of element side sets  = {8:3n}\t"
 796              " Length of element sides      = {10:10n}\t"
 797              " Number of sideset variables    = {15:6d}\n"
 798              " Number of assemblies         = {18:3n}\t"
 799              "                                   {2:11s}\t"
 800              " Number of assembly red vars    = {19:6d}\n"
 801              " Number of blobs              = {20:3n}\t"
 802              "                                   {2:11s}\t"
 803              " Number of blob red vars        = {21:6d}\n"
 804              " Number of time steps         = {16:3n}\n"
 805              .format(self.fileName,
 806                      self.num_dimensions(), "",
 807                      self.num_nodes(),
 808                      self.num_elems(),
 809                      1,
 810                      self.num_blks(),
 811                      self.num_node_sets(),
 812                      self.num_side_sets(),
 813                      total_ns_nodes, total_sides,
 814                      num_glo_vars, num_nod_vars, num_ele_vars,
 815                      num_ns_vars, num_ss_vars, self.num_times(), self.title(),
 816                      self.num_assembly(), num_assem_vars,
 817                      self.num_blob(), num_blob_vars))
 818
 819    def put_info_ext(self, p):
 820        """
 821        put initialization information into exodus file
 822
 823        >>> e.put_info_ext(info_struct)
 824        """
 825        if len(p.title) > MAX_LINE_LENGTH:
 826            print(f'WARNING: Exodus title \"{p.title}\" exceeds maximum line length ({MAX_LINE_LENGTH}). It will be truncated.')
 827
 828            p.title = p.title[-1 * MAX_LINE_LENGTH:]
 829
 830        self.Title = ctypes.create_string_buffer(p.title, MAX_LINE_LENGTH + 1)
 831        self.numDim = ctypes.c_longlong(p.num_dim)
 832        self.numNodes = ctypes.c_longlong(p.num_nodes)
 833        self.numElem = ctypes.c_longlong(p.num_elem)
 834        self.numElemBlk = ctypes.c_longlong(p.num_elem_blk)
 835        self.numNodeSets = ctypes.c_longlong(p.num_node_sets)
 836        self.numSideSets = ctypes.c_longlong(p.num_side_sets)
 837        self.numAssembly = ctypes.c_longlong(p.num_assembly)
 838
 839        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_init_ext(self.fileId, ctypes.byref(p))
 840        return True
 841
 842    def copy(self, fileName, include_transient=False, mode='a'):
 843        """
 844        Copies exodus database to file_name and returns an opened copy as a
 845        new exodus object. This object will need to be closed when it is done
 846        being used.
 847
 848        >>> exo_copy = exo.copy(file_name)
 849        >>> exo_copy.close()
 850
 851        Parameters
 852        ----------
 853        file_name : str
 854            name of exodus file to open
 855
 856        Returns
 857        -------
 858        exo_copy : exodus object opened in append mode by default
 859        """
 860        i64Status = EXODUS_LIB.ex_int64_status(self.fileId)
 861        fileId = EXODUS_LIB.ex_create_int(fileName.encode('ascii'), EX_NOCLOBBER | i64Status,
 862                                          ctypes.byref(self.comp_ws),
 863                                          ctypes.byref(self.io_ws),
 864                                          EX_API_VERSION_NODOT)
 865
 866        self.copy_file(fileId, include_transient)
 867        EXODUS_LIB.ex_close(fileId)
 868
 869        return exodus(fileName, mode)
 870
 871    def copy_file(self, file_id, include_transient=False):
 872        """
 873        Copies exodus database to the database pointed to by `fileId`
 874        Returns the passed in `file_id`.
 875
 876        >>> with exodus.exodus(file_name, mode='w') as exofile:
 877        >>>     with exo.copy_file(exofile.fileId, include_transient=True) as exo_copy:
 878        >>>         exo_copy.close()
 879
 880        Parameters
 881        ----------
 882        fileId : str
 883            name of exodus file to open
 884        include_transient: bool
 885            should the transient data in the original file also be copied to the output file
 886            or just the mesh (non-transient) portion.
 887
 888        Returns
 889        -------
 890        file_id: The file_id of the copied to file
 891
 892        """
 893        EXODUS_LIB.ex_copy(self.fileId, file_id)
 894        if include_transient:
 895            EXODUS_LIB.ex_copy_transient(self.fileId, file_id)
 896
 897        return file_id
 898
 899    def title(self):
 900        """
 901        get the database title
 902
 903        >>> title = exo.title()
 904
 905        Returns
 906        -------
 907        title : string
 908        """
 909        return self.Title.value.decode('utf8')
 910
 911    def version_num(self):
 912        """
 913        get exodus version number used to create the database
 914
 915        >>> version = exo.version_num()
 916
 917        Returns
 918        -------
 919        version : string
 920            representation of version number
 921        """
 922        return "%1.2f" % self.version.value
 923
 924    def put_info(self, Title, numDim, numNodes, numElem, numElemBlk,
 925                 numNodeSets, numSideSets):
 926        """
 927        Initialize static metadata for the database.
 928
 929        >>> status = exo.put_info(title, num_dims, num_nodes, num_elems,
 930        ...                      num_blocks, num_ns, num_ss)
 931
 932        Parameters
 933        ----------
 934        title : string
 935            database title
 936        num_dims : int
 937            number of model dimensions
 938        num_nodes : int
 939            number of model nodes
 940        num_elems : int
 941            number of model elements
 942        num_blocks : int
 943            number of model element blocks
 944        num_ns : int
 945            number of model node sets
 946        num_ss : int
 947            number of model side sets
 948
 949        Returns
 950        -------
 951        status : bool
 952            True = successful execution
 953
 954        """
 955        self.__ex_put_info([Title, numDim, numNodes, numElem,
 956                            numElemBlk, numNodeSets, numSideSets])
 957        return True
 958
 959    def inquire(self, inquiry):
 960        """
 961        Inquire about various properties of the database
 962
 963        Returns
 964        -------
 965        inq_res : int
 966        """
 967        return self.__ex_inquire_int(ex_inquiry_map(inquiry))
 968
 969    def num_qa_records(self):
 970        """
 971        get the number of qa records
 972
 973        >>> num_qa_recs = exo.num_qa_records()
 974
 975        Returns
 976        -------
 977        num_qa_recs : int
 978        """
 979        return int(self.__ex_inquire_int(ex_inquiry_map('EX_INQ_QA')))
 980
 981    def get_qa_records(self):
 982        """
 983        get a list of QA records where each QA record is a length-4 tuple of strings:
 984          1. the software name that accessed/modified the database
 985          2. the software descriptor, e.g. version
 986          3. additional software data
 987          4. time stamp
 988
 989        >>> qa_recs = exo.get_qa_records()
 990
 991
 992        Returns
 993        -------
 994        qa_recs : <list<tuple[4]<string>>>
 995        """
 996        return self.__ex_get_qa()
 997
 998    def put_qa_records(self, records):
 999        """
1000        store a list of QA records where each QA record is a length-4 tuple of strings:
1001          1. the software name that accessed/modified the database
1002          2. the software descriptor, e.g. version
1003          3. additional software data
1004          4. time stamp
1005
1006        >>> status = exo.put_qa_records()
1007
1008        Parameter
1009        ---------
1010        qa_recs : <list<tuple[4]<string>>>
1011
1012        Returns
1013        ------
1014        status : bool
1015            True = successful execution
1016        """
1017        for rec in records:
1018            assert len(rec) == 4
1019            for recEntry in rec:
1020                assert len(str(recEntry).encode('ascii')) < MAX_STR_LENGTH
1021        return self.__ex_put_qa(records)
1022
1023    def num_info_records(self):
1024        """
1025        get the number of info records
1026
1027        >>> num_info_recs = exo.num_info_records()
1028
1029        Returns
1030        -------
1031        num_info_recs : int
1032        """
1033        return int(self.__ex_inquire_int(ex_inquiry_map('EX_INQ_INFO')))
1034
1035    def get_info_records(self):
1036        """
1037        get a list info records where each entry in the list is one info
1038        record, e.g. a line of an input deck
1039
1040        >>> info_recs = exo.get_info_records()
1041
1042        Returns
1043        -------
1044        info_recs : <list<string>>
1045
1046        """
1047        return self.__ex_get_info_recs()
1048
1049    def put_info_records(self, info):
1050        """
1051        store a list of info records where each entry in the list is
1052        one line of info, e.g. a line of an input deck
1053
1054        >>> status = exo.put_info_records(info)
1055
1056        Parameters
1057        ----------
1058        info_recs : <list<tuple[4]<string>>>
1059
1060        Returns
1061        -------
1062        status : bool
1063            True = successful execution
1064        """
1065        for rec in info:
1066            if len(str(rec).encode('ascii')) > MAX_LINE_LENGTH:
1067                print("WARNING: max line length reached for one or more info records;")
1068                print(
1069                    "         info stored to exodus file is incomplete for these records")
1070                break
1071        return self.__ex_put_info_recs(info)
1072
1073    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1074
1075    def get_sierra_input(self, inpFileName=None):
1076        """
1077        parse sierra input deck from the info records if inp_file_name
1078        is passed the deck is written to this file; otherwise a list
1079        of input deck file lines is returned
1080
1081        >>> inp = exo.get_sierra_input(inpFileName=inp_file_name)
1082
1083        Parameters
1084        ----------
1085        inp_file_name : string, optional
1086           Name of text file where info records corresponding to the Sierra input deck will be written
1087
1088        Returns
1089        -------
1090        inp : list<string>
1091           lines if inp_file_name not provided; otherwise, an empty list
1092
1093        """
1094        info_recs = self.__ex_get_info_recs()
1095        sierra_inp = []
1096        begin = False
1097        for rec in info_recs:
1098            vals = rec.split()
1099            if not begin:  # have not reached Sierra block
1100                if len(vals) >= 2 and vals[0].lower() == "begin" and vals[1].lower() == "sierra":
1101                    begin = True
1102            if begin:  # inside Sierra block
1103                sierra_inp.append(rec)
1104                if len(rec) > MAX_LINE_LENGTH:
1105                    print(
1106                        "WARNING: max line length reached for one or more input lines;")
1107                    print("         input data might be incomplete for these lines")
1108                    break
1109                if len(vals) >= 2 and vals[0].lower() == "end" and vals[1].lower() == "sierra":
1110                    break  # end of Sierra block
1111
1112        if inpFileName:
1113            with open(inpFileName.encode('ascii'), "w") as fd:
1114                for fileLine in sierra_inp:
1115                    fd.write(fileLine + "\n")
1116            return []
1117
1118        return sierra_inp
1119
1120    #
1121    # time steps
1122    #
1123    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1124
1125    def num_times(self):
1126        """
1127        get the number of time steps
1128
1129        >>> num_times = exo.num_times()
1130
1131        Returns
1132        -------
1133        num_times : int
1134        """
1135        return self.numTimes.value
1136
1137    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1138
1139    def get_times(self):
1140        """
1141        get the time values
1142
1143        >>> time_vals = exo.get_times()
1144
1145        Returns
1146        -------
1147            if array_type == 'ctype' :
1148              <list<ctypes.c_double>>  time_vals
1149
1150            if array_type == 'numpy' :
1151              <np_array<double>>  time_vals
1152        """
1153        if self.numTimes.value == 0:
1154            self.times = []
1155        else:
1156            self.__ex_get_all_times()
1157        if self.use_numpy:
1158            self.times = ctype_to_numpy(self, self.times)
1159        return self.times
1160
1161    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1162
1163    def put_time(self, step, value):
1164        """
1165        store a new time
1166
1167        >>> exo.put_time(time_step, time_val)
1168
1169        Parameters
1170        ----------
1171        time_step : int
1172            time step index (1-based)
1173        time_val : float
1174            time value for this step
1175
1176        Returns
1177        -------
1178        status : bool
1179            True = successful execution
1180        """
1181        self.__ex_put_time(step, value)
1182        self.numTimes = ctypes.c_int(self.__ex_inquire_int(ex_inquiry_map('EX_INQ_TIME')))
1183        return True
1184
1185    #
1186    # coordinate system
1187    #
1188    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1189
1190    def num_dimensions(self):
1191        """
1192        get the number of model spatial dimensions
1193
1194        >>> num_dims = exo.num_dimensions()
1195
1196        Returns
1197        -------
1198        num_dims : <int
1199        """
1200        return self.numDim.value
1201
1202    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1203
1204    def get_coord_names(self):
1205        """
1206        get a list of length exo.num_dimensions() that has the name
1207        of each model coordinate direction, e.g. ['x', 'y', 'z']
1208
1209        >>> coord_names = exo.get_coord_names()
1210
1211        Returns
1212        -------
1213            <list<string>>  coord_names
1214        """
1215        return self.__ex_get_coord_names()
1216
1217    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1218
1219    def put_coord_names(self, names):
1220        """
1221        store a list of length exo.num_dimensions() that has the name
1222        of each model coordinate direction, e.g. ['x', 'y', 'z']
1223
1224        >>> exo.put_coord_names()
1225
1226        Parameters
1227        ----------
1228            <list<string>>  coord_names
1229        """
1230        self.__ex_put_coord_names(names)
1231
1232    #
1233    # nodes
1234    #
1235    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1236
1237    def num_nodes(self):
1238        """
1239        get the number of nodes in the model
1240
1241        >>> num_nodes = exo.num_nodes()
1242
1243        Returns
1244        -------
1245        num_nodes : int
1246        """
1247        return self.numNodes.value
1248
1249    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1250
1251    def get_coords(self):
1252        """
1253        get model coordinates of all nodes; for each coordinate
1254        direction, a length exo.num_nodes() list is returned
1255
1256        >>> x_coords, y_coords, z_coords = exo.get_coords()
1257
1258        Returns
1259        -------
1260
1261            if array_type == 'ctype':
1262              <list<ctypes.c_double>>  x_coords  global x-direction coordinates
1263              <list<ctypes.c_double>>  y_coords  global y-direction coordinates
1264              <list<ctypes.c_double>>  z_coords  global z-direction coordinates
1265
1266            if array_type == 'numpy':
1267              <np_array<double>>  x_coords  global x-direction coordinates
1268              <np_array<double>>  y_coords  global y-direction coordinates
1269              <np_array<double>>  z_coords  global z-direction coordinates
1270        """
1271        self.__ex_get_coord()
1272        if self.use_numpy:
1273            self.coordsX = ctype_to_numpy(self, self.coordsX)
1274            self.coordsY = ctype_to_numpy(self, self.coordsY)
1275            self.coordsZ = ctype_to_numpy(self, self.coordsZ)
1276        return self.coordsX, self.coordsY, self.coordsZ
1277
1278    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1279
1280    def get_coord(self, i):
1281        """
1282        get model coordinates of a single node
1283
1284        >>> x_coord, y_coord, z_coord = exo.get_coord(node_index)
1285
1286        Parameters
1287        ----------
1288        node_index : int
1289            the 1-based node index (indexing is from 1 to exo.num_nodes())
1290
1291        Returns
1292        -------
1293        x_coord : double
1294            global x-direction coordinate
1295        y_coord : double
1296            global y-direction coordinate
1297        z_coord : double
1298            global z-direction coordinate
1299
1300        Note:
1301        -----
1302        >>> x_coords, y_coords, z_coords = exo.get_coords()
1303        >>> x_coord = x_coords[node_index-1]
1304        >>> y_coord = y_coords[node_index-1]
1305        >>> z_coord = z_coords[node_index-1]
1306            ... is equivalent to ...
1307        >>> x_coord, y_coord, z_coord = exo.get_coords(node_index)
1308
1309        """
1310        listX, listY, listZ = self.__ex_get_partial_coord(i, 1)
1311        return listX[0], listY[0], listZ[0]
1312
1313    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1314
1315    def put_coords(self, xCoords, yCoords, zCoords):
1316        """
1317        store model coordinates of all nodes; for each coordinate
1318        direction, a length exo.num_nodes() list is input
1319
1320        >>> status = exo.put_coords(x_coords, y_coords, z_coords)
1321
1322        Parameters
1323        ----------
1324        x_coord : <list<float>>
1325            global x-direction coordinates
1326        y_coord : <list<float>>
1327            global y-direction coordinates
1328        z_coord : <list<float>>
1329            global z-direction coordinates
1330
1331        Returns
1332        -------
1333        status : bool
1334            True = successful execution
1335        """
1336        self.__ex_put_coord(xCoords, yCoords, zCoords)
1337        return True
1338
1339    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1340
1341    def get_node_num_map(self):
1342        """
