1343        **DEPRECATED** use: `get_node_id_map()`
1344
1345        get mapping of exodus node index to user- or application-
1346        defined node id; node_id_map is ordered the same as the nodal
1347        coordinate arrays returned by exo.get_coords() -- this ordering
1348        follows the exodus node *INDEX* order, a 1-based system going
1349        from 1 to exo.num_nodes(); a user or application can optionally
1350        use a separate node *ID* numbering system, so the node_id_map
1351        points to the node *ID* for each node *INDEX*
1352
1353        >>> node_id_map = exo.get_node_num_map()
1354
1355        Returns
1356        -------
1357            <list<ctypes.c_int>>  node_id_map
1358        """
1359        return self.__ex_get_node_num_map()
1360
1361    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1362
1363    def put_node_id_map(self, id_map):
1364        """
1365        store mapping of exodus node index to user- or application-
1366        defined node id; node_id_map is ordered the same as the nodal
1367        coordinate arrays returned by exo.get_coords() -- this ordering
1368        follows the exodus node *INDEX* order, a 1-based system going
1369        from 1 to exo.num_nodes(); a user or application can optionally
1370        use a separate node *ID* numbering system, so the node_id_map
1371        points to the node *ID* for each node *INDEX*
1372
1373        >>> status = exo.put_node_id_map(node_id_map)
1374
1375        Parameters
1376        ----------
1377            <list<int>>  node_id_map
1378
1379        Returns
1380        -------
1381        status : bool
1382            True = successful execution
1383        """
1384        return self.__ex_put_id_map('EX_NODE_MAP', id_map)
1385
1386    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1387
1388    def get_node_variable_names(self):
1389        """
1390        get the list of nodal variable names in the model
1391
1392        >>> nvar_names = exo.get_node_variable_names()
1393
1394        Returns
1395        -------
1396              <list<string>>  nvar_names
1397        """
1398        if self.__ex_get_variable_param('EX_NODAL').value == 0:
1399            return []
1400        return self.__ex_get_variable_names('EX_NODAL')
1401
1402    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1403
1404    def get_node_variable_number(self):
1405        """
1406        get the number of nodal variables in the model
1407
1408        >>> num_nvars = exo.get_node_variable_number()
1409
1410        Returns
1411        -------
1412        num_nvars : int
1413        """
1414        return self.__ex_get_variable_param('EX_NODAL').value
1415
1416    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1417
1418    def set_node_variable_number(self, number):
1419        """
1420        update the number of nodal variables in the model
1421
1422        >>> status = exo.set_node_variable_number(num_nvars)
1423
1424        Parameters
1425        ----------
1426        num_nvars : int
1427
1428        Returns
1429        -------
1430        status : bool
1431            True = successful execution
1432        """
1433        self.__ex_put_variable_param('EX_NODAL', number)
1434        return True
1435
1436    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1437
1438    def put_node_variable_name(self, name, index):
1439        """
1440        add the name and index of a new nodal variable to the model;
1441        nodal variable indexing goes from 1 to exo.get_node_variable_number()
1442
1443        >>> status = exo.put_node_variable_name(nvar_name, nvar_index)
1444
1445        Parameters
1446        ----------
1447            <string>  nvar_name   name of new nodal variable
1448            <int>     nvar_index  1-based index of new nodal variable
1449
1450        Returns
1451        -------
1452        status : bool
1453            True = successful execution
1454
1455        Note:
1456        ----
1457        this method is often called within the following sequence:
1458
1459        >>> num_nvars = exo.get_node_variable_number()
1460        >>> new_nvar_index = num_nvars + 1
1461        >>> num_nvars += 1
1462        >>> exo.set_node_variable_number(num_nvars)
1463        >>> exo.put_node_variable_name("new_nvar_name", new_nvar_index)
1464        """
1465        NDvarNames = self.get_variable_names('EX_NODAL')
1466        if name in NDvarNames:
1467            print(f'WARNING: node variable \"{name}\" already exists.')
1468        if index > len(NDvarNames):
1469            raise Exception("ERROR: variable index out of range.")
1470        self.__ex_put_variable_name('EX_NODAL', index, name)
1471        return True
1472
1473    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1474
1475    def get_node_variable_values(self, name, step):
1476        """
1477        get list of nodal variable values for a nodal variable name
1478        and time step
1479
1480        >>> nvar_vals = exo.get_node_variable_values(nvar_name, time_step)
1481
1482        Parameters
1483        ----------
1484            <string>  nvar_name  name of nodal variable
1485            <int>     time_step  1-based index of time step
1486
1487        Returns
1488        -------
1489
1490            if array_type == 'ctype':
1491              <list<ctypes.c_double>>  nvar_vals
1492
1493            if array_type == 'numpy':
1494              <np_array<double>>  nvar_vals
1495        """
1496        names = self.get_variable_names('EX_NODAL')
1497        var_id = names.index(name) + 1
1498        numVals = self.num_nodes()
1499        values = self.__ex_get_var(step, 'EX_NODAL', var_id, 0, numVals)
1500        if self.use_numpy:
1501            values = ctype_to_numpy(self, values)
1502        return values
1503
1504    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1505
1506    def get_partial_node_variable_values(self, name, step, start_index, num_nodes):
1507        """
1508        get partial list of nodal variable values for a nodal variable name
1509        and time step.  Start at node `node_index` (1-based) and return `num_nodes`
1510        from that point.
1511
1512        >>> nvar_vals = exo.get_partial_node_variable_values(nvar_name, time_step, 10, 100)
1513
1514        Parameters
1515        ----------
1516            <string>  nvar_name   name of nodal variable
1517            <int>     time_step   1-based index of time step
1518            <int>     start_index 1-based index of node to start returning data
1519            <int>     num_nodes   number of nodes to return data for.
1520
1521        Returns
1522        -------
1523
1524            if array_type == 'ctype':
1525              <list<ctypes.c_double>>  nvar_vals
1526
1527            if array_type == 'numpy':
1528              <np_array<double>>  nvar_vals
1529        """
1530        names = self.get_variable_names('EX_NODAL')
1531        var_id = names.index(name) + 1
1532        values = self.__ex_get_partial_var(step, 'EX_NODAL', var_id, 0, start_index, num_nodes)
1533        if self.use_numpy:
1534            values = ctype_to_numpy(self, values)
1535        return values
1536
1537    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1538
1539    def put_node_variable_values(self, name, step, values):
1540        """
1541        store a list of nodal variable values for a nodal variable
1542        name and time step
1543
1544        >>> status = exo.put_node_variable_values(nvar_name, time_step, nvar_vals)
1545
1546        Parameters
1547        ----------
1548            <string>       nvar_name  name of nodal variable
1549            <int>          time_step  1-based index of time step
1550            <list<float>>  nvar_vals
1551
1552        Returns
1553        -------
1554        status : bool
1555            True = successful execution
1556        """
1557        names = self.get_variable_names('EX_NODAL')
1558        var_id = names.index(name) + 1
1559        numVals = self.num_nodes()
1560        self.__ex_put_var(step, 'EX_NODAL', var_id, 0, numVals, values)
1561        return True
1562
1563    #
1564    # elements
1565    #
1566    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1567
1568    def num_elems(self):
1569        """
1570        get the number of elements in the model
1571
1572        >>> num_elems = exo.num_elems()
1573
1574        Returns
1575        -------
1576        num_elems : int
1577        """
1578        return self.numElem.value
1579
1580    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1581
1582    def get_num_map(self, mapType, idx):
1583        """
1584        get user-defined map of exodus element/node/edge/face index to user- or
1585        application- defined element/node/edge/face values. Map values are arbitary integers
1586
1587        >>> elem_num_map = exo.get_num_map('EX_ELEM_MAP', 1)
1588
1589        Parameters
1590        ----------
1591            mapType   : ex_entity_type
1592                        type of map being queried ('EX_ELEM_MAP', 'EX_NODE_MAP', 'EX_FACE_MAP', 'EX_EDGE_MAP')
1593            idx       : int
1594                        which map to return (1-based).  Use `inquire(mapType)` to get number of maps stored on database.
1595        Returns
1596        -------
1597
1598            if array_type == 'ctype':
1599              <list<int>>  num_map
1600
1601            if array_type == 'numpy':
1602              <np_array<int>>  num_map
1603
1604
1605        Usage
1606        -----
1607        >>> em_cnt = exo.inquire('EX_INQ_ELEM_MAP')
1608        >>> em     = exo.get_names('EX_ELEM_MAP')
1609        >>> map    = exo.get_num_map('EX_ELEM_MAP', 2)
1610
1611        """
1612        return self.__ex_get_num_map(mapType, idx)
1613
1614    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1615
1616    def put_num_map(self, mapType, idx, num_map):
1617        """
1618        put user-defined map of exodus element/node/edge/face index to user- or
1619        application- defined element/node/edge/face values. Map values are arbitary integers
1620
1621
1622        Parameters
1623        ----------
1624            mapType   : ex_entity_type
1625                        type of map being written ('EX_ELEM_MAP', 'EX_NODE_MAP', 'EX_FACE_MAP', 'EX_EDGE_MAP')
1626            idx       : int
1627                        which map to write (1-based).  Use `put_map_param(node_map_cnt, elem_map_cnt)` prior to this
1628                        function to define number of maps on the database.
1629            <list<int>>  elem_id_map
1630
1631
1632        Usage
1633        -----
1634
1635        >>> exo.put_map_param(nm_cnt, em_cnt)
1636        >>> nm[0] = "My_Node_Map"
1637        >>> exo.put_names('EX_NODE_MAP', nm);
1638        >>> exo.put_num_map('EX_NODE_MAP', 1, scale_map)
1639
1640        """
1641        return self.__ex_put_num_map(mapType, idx, num_map)
1642
1643    def put_map_param(self, node_map_cnt, elem_map_cnt):
1644        """
1645        Define number of node and element maps that will be written to the database
1646
1647        Parameters
1648        ----------
1649        node_map_cnt  : int
1650                        number of node maps
1651        elem_map_cnt  : int
1652                        number of element maps
1653
1654        """
1655        return self.__ex_put_map_param(node_map_cnt, elem_map_cnt)
1656
1657    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1658
1659    def get_id_map(self, mapType):
1660        """
1661        get mapping of exodus element/node/edge/face index to user- or
1662        application- defined element/node/edge/face id; id_map is ordered by the
1663        *INDEX* ordering, a 1-based system going from 1 to
1664        exo.num_???s(), used by exodus for storage and input/output
1665        of array data stored on the elements/nodes/edges/faces; a user or application
1666        can optionally use a separate *ID* numbering system,
1667        so the id_map points to the element/node/edge/face *ID* for each
1668        *INDEX*
1669
1670        >>> elem_id_map = exo.get_id_map('EX_ELEM_MAP')
1671
1672        Parameters
1673        ----------
1674            mapType   : ex_entity_type
1675                        type of map being queried ('EX_ELEM_MAP', 'EX_NODE_MAP', 'EX_FACE_MAP', 'EX_EDGE_MAP')
1676        Returns
1677        -------
1678
1679            if array_type == 'ctype':
1680              <list<int>>  id_map
1681
1682            if array_type == 'numpy':
1683              <np_array<int>>  id_map
1684
1685        """
1686        return self.__ex_get_id_map(mapType)
1687
1688    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1689
1690    def get_elem_id_map(self):
1691        """
1692        get mapping of exodus element index to user- or application-
1693        defined element id; elem_id_map is ordered by the element
1694        *INDEX* ordering, a 1-based system going from 1 to
1695        exo.num_elems(), used by exodus for storage and input/output
1696        of array data stored on the elements; a user or application
1697        can optionally use a separate element *ID* numbering system,
1698        so the elem_id_map points to the element *ID* for each
1699        element *INDEX*
1700
1701        >>> elem_id_map = exo.get_elem_id_map()
1702
1703        Returns
1704        -------
1705
1706            if array_type == 'ctype':
1707              <list<int>>  elem_id_map
1708
1709            if array_type == 'numpy':
1710              <np_array<int>>  elem_id_map
1711        """
1712        return self.__ex_get_id_map('EX_ELEM_MAP')
1713
1714    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1715
1716    def put_elem_id_map(self, id_map):
1717        """
1718        store mapping of exodus element index to user- or application-
1719        defined element id; elem_id_map is ordered by the element
1720        *INDEX* ordering, a 1-based system going from 1 to
1721        exo.num_elems(), used by exodus for storage and input/output
1722        of array data stored on the elements; a user or application
1723        can optionally use a separate element *ID* numbering system,
1724        so the elem_id_map points to the element *ID* for each
1725        element *INDEX*
1726
1727        >>> status = exo.put_elem_id_map(elem_id_map)
1728
1729        Parameters
1730        ----------
1731            <list<int>>  elem_id_map
1732
1733        Returns
1734        -------
1735        status : bool
1736            True = successful execution
1737        """
1738        return self.__ex_put_id_map('EX_ELEM_MAP', id_map)
1739
1740    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1741
1742    def put_id_map(self, map_type, id_map):
1743        """
1744        store mapping of exodus entity index to user- or application-
1745        defined entity id; id_map is ordered by the entity
1746        *INDEX* ordering, a 1-based system going from 1 to
1747        exo.num_XXX(), used by exodus for storage and input/output
1748        of array data stored on the entities; a user or application
1749        can optionally use a separate entity *ID* numbering system,
1750        so the elem_id_map points to the entity *ID* for each
1751        entity *INDEX*
1752
1753        >>> status = exo.put_id_map('EX_ELEM_MAP', elem_id_map)
1754
1755        Parameters
1756        ----------
1757            ex_entity_type   map_type
1758                        type of map being queried ('EX_ELEM_MAP', 'EX_NODE_MAP', 'EX_FACE_MAP', 'EX_EDGE_MAP')
1759            <list<int>>  elem_id_map
1760
1761        Returns
1762        -------
1763        status : bool
1764            True = successful execution
1765        """
1766        return self.__ex_put_id_map(map_type, id_map)
1767
1768    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1769
1770    def get_block_id_map(self, obj_type, entity_id):
1771        """
1772        Gets the map of elements found in the given entity_id of an object
1773        of obj_type.
1774
1775        *INDEX* ordering, a 1-based system going from 1 to
1776        number of elements in the elem_block, used by exodus for
1777        storage and input/output of array data stored on the elements;
1778        a user or application can optionally use a separate element *ID* numbering system,
1779        so the elem_id_map points to the element *ID* for each
1780        element *INDEX*
1781
1782        >>> elem_block_id_map = exo.get_block_id_map("EX_ELEM_BLOCK", 100)
1783
1784        Returns
1785        -------
1786
1787            if array_type == 'ctype':
1788              <list<int>>  elem_id_map
1789
1790            if array_type == 'numpy':
1791              <np_array<int>>  elem_id_map
1792        """
1793        return self.__ex_get_block_id_map(obj_type, entity_id)
1794
1795    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1796
1797    def get_elem_num_map(self):
1798        """
1799        **DEPRECATED** use: `get_elem_id_map()`
1800
1801        get mapping of exodus element index to user- or application-
1802        defined element id; elem_id_map is ordered by the element
1803        *INDEX* ordering, a 1-based system going from 1 to
1804        exo.num_elems(), used by exodus for storage and input/output
1805        of array data stored on the elements; a user or application
1806        can optionally use a separate element *ID* numbering system,
1807        so the elem_id_map points to the element *ID* for each
1808        element *INDEX*
1809
1810        >>> elem_id_map = exo.get_elem_num_map()
1811
1812        Returns
1813        -------
1814            <list<ctypes.c_int>>  elem_id_map
1815        """
1816        return self.__ex_get_elem_num_map()
1817
1818    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1819
1820    def get_elem_order_map(self):
1821        """
1822        get mapping of exodus element index to application-defined
1823        optimal ordering; elem_order_map is ordered by the element
1824        index ordering used by exodus for storage and input/output
1825        of array data stored on the elements; a user or application
1826        can optionally use a separate element ordering, e.g. for
1827        optimal solver performance, so the elem_order_map points to
1828        the index used by the application for each exodus element
1829        index
1830
1831        >>> elem_order_map = exo.get_elem_order_map()
1832
1833        Returns
1834        -------
1835
1836            if array_type == 'ctype':
1837              <list<int>>  elem_order_map
1838
1839            if array_type == 'numpy':
1840              <np_array<int>>  elem_order_map
1841        """
1842
1843        elemOrderMap = self.__ex_get_elem_order_map()
1844        if self.use_numpy:
1845            elemOrderMap = ctype_to_numpy(self, elemOrderMap)
1846        return elemOrderMap
1847
1848    # Generic (objType) get/put/query...
1849    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1850
1851    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1852
1853    def get_node_id_map(self):
1854        """
1855        get mapping of exodus node index to user- or application-
1856        defined node id; node_id_map is ordered the same as the nodal
1857        coordinate arrays returned by exo.get_coords() -- this ordering
1858        follows the exodus node *INDEX* order, a 1-based system going
1859        from 1 to exo.num_nodes(); a user or application can optionally
1860        use a separate node *ID* numbering system, so the node_id_map
1861        points to the node *ID* for each node *INDEX*
1862
1863        >>> node_id_map = exo.get_node_id_map()
1864
1865        Returns
1866        -------
1867
1868            if array_type == 'ctype':
1869              <list<int>>  node_id_map
1870
1871            if array_type == 'numpy':
1872              <np_array<int>>  node_id_map
1873        """
1874        return self.__ex_get_id_map('EX_NODE_MAP')
1875
1876    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1877
1878    def get_name(self, object_type, object_id):
1879        """
1880        get the name of the specified entity_type and entity
1881
1882        >>> elem_blk_name = exo.get_name('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', elem_blk_id)
1883
1884        Parameters
1885        ----------
1886        object_type : int
1887            block/set type
1888        object_id : int
1889            block/set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
1890
1891        Returns
1892        -------
1893        name : string
1894        """
1895        return self.__ex_get_name(object_type, object_id)
1896
1897    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1898
1899    def put_name(self, object_type, object_id, name):
1900        """
1901        put the name of the specified entity_type and entity
1902
1903        >>> exo.put_name('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', elem_blk_id, block_name)
1904
1905        Parameters
1906        ----------
1907        object_type : int
1908            block/set type
1909        object_id : int
1910            block/set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
1911        name : string
1912            block/set name
1913
1914        Returns
1915        -------
1916        elem_blk_name : string
1917        """
1918        self.__ex_put_name(object_type, object_id, name)
1919
1920    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1921
1922    def get_names(self, object_type):
1923        """
1924        get a list of all block/set names ordered by block/set *INDEX*;
1925        (see `exodus.get_ids` for explanation of the
1926        difference between *ID* and *INDEX*)
1927
1928        >>> blk_names = exo.get_names('EX_ELEM_BLOCK')
1929
1930        Parameters
1931        ----------
1932        object_type : int
1933            block/set type
1934
1935        Returns
1936        -------
1937            <list<string>>  names
1938        """
1939        return self.__ex_get_names(object_type)
1940
1941    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1942
1943    def put_names(self, object_type, names):
1944        """
1945        store a list of all block/set names of the specified
1946        `object_type` ordered by *INDEX*;
1947        (see `exodus.get_ids` for explanation of the
1948        difference between *ID* and *INDEX*)
1949
1950        >>> exo.put_names('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', elem_blk_names)
1951
1952        Parameters
1953        ----------
1954        object_type : int
1955        names : <list<string>>
1956        """
1957
1958        self.__ex_put_names(object_type, names)
1959
1960    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1961
1962    def get_reduction_variable_values(self, objType, id, step):
1963        """
1964        get list of reduction variable values for a specified entity type and
1965        id, and time step
1966
1967        >>> evar_vals = exo.get_reduction_variable_values('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', elem_blk_id, time_step)
1968
1969        Parameters
1970        ----------
1971        objType   : ex_entity_type
1972            type of object being queried
1973        id        : int
1974            entity *ID* (not *INDEX*)
1975        time_step : int
1976            1-based index of time step
1977
1978        Returns
1979        -------
1980
1981            if array_type == 'ctype':
1982              <list<ctypes.c_double>>  evar_vals
1983
1984            if array_type == 'numpy':
1985              <np_array<double>>  evar_vals
1986
1987        """
1988        numVals = self.get_reduction_variable_number(objType)
1989        values = self.__ex_get_reduction_vars(step, objType, id, numVals)
1990        if self.use_numpy:
1991            values = ctype_to_numpy(self, values)
1992        return values
1993
1994    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
1995
1996    def put_reduction_variable_values(self, objType, id, step, values):
1997        """
1998        store a list of 'objType' variable values for a specified entity,
1999        and time step
2000
2001        >>> status = exo.put_redcution_variable_values('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', elem_blk_id,
2002        ...             time_step, evar_vals)
2003
2004        Parameters
2005        ----------
2006        objType : ex_entity_type
2007            type of object begin queried
2008        id : int
2009            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2010            <int>          time_step    1-based index of time step
2011            <list<float>>  evar_vals
2012
2013        Returns
2014        -------
2015        status : bool
2016            True = successful execution
2017        """
2018        numVals = self.get_reduction_variable_number(objType)
2019        self.__ex_put_reduction_vars(step, objType, id, numVals, values)
2020        return True
2021
2022    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
2023
2024    def get_ids(self, objType):
2025        """
2026        get mapping of exodus block/set index to user- or application-
2027        defined block/set id; ids is ordered
2028        by the *INDEX* ordering, a 1-based system going from
2029        1 to number_set_or_block, used by exodus for storage
2030        and input/output of array data stored on the blocks/sets; a
2031        user or application can optionally use a separate block/set
2032        *ID* numbering system, so the ids array points to the
2033        block/set *ID* for each set *INDEX*
2034
2035        >>> node_set_ids = exo.get_ids('EX_NODE_SET')
2036
2037        Returns
2038        -------
2039
2040            if array_type == 'ctype':
2041              <list<int>>  ids
2042
2043            if array_type == 'numpy':
2044              <np_array<int>>  ids
2045        """
2046        ids = self.__ex_get_ids(objType)
2047        if self.use_numpy:
2048            ids = self.np.array(ids)
2049        return ids
2050
2051    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
2052    def get_variable_truth_table(self, objType, entId=None):
2053        """
2054        gets a truth table indicating which variables are defined for
2055        specified entity type; if entId is not passed, then a concatenated
2056        truth table for all entities is returned with variable index
2057        cycling faster than entity index
2058
2059        >>> ssvar_truth_tab = exo.get_variable_truth_table('EX_SIDE_SET', sideSetID=side_set_id)
2060
2061        Parameters
2062        ----------
2063        entId : int, optional
2064            entity *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2065
2066        Returns
2067        -------
2068        truth_tab : <list<bool>>
2069            True for variable defined in an entity, False otherwise
2070        """
2071        if entId is None:
2072            return self.__ex_get_truth_table(objType)
2073        else:
2074            return self.__ex_get_object_truth_vector(objType, entId)
2075
2076    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
2077
2078    def set_variable_truth_table(self, objType, table):
2079        """
2080        stores a truth table indicating which variables are defined for
2081        all sets/blocks of the specified `objType` and all variables; variable index cycles
2082        faster than entity index
2083
2084        >>> status = exo.set_variable_truth_table('EX_NODE_SET', nsvar_truth_tab)
2085
2086        Parameters
2087        ----------
2088        table : <list<bool>>
2089            True for variable defined in a node set, False otherwise
2090
2091        Returns
2092        -------
2093        status : bool
2094            True = successful execution
2095        """
2096        return self.__ex_put_truth_table(objType, table)
2097
2098    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
2099
2100    def get_variable_names(self, objType):
2101        """
2102        get the list of variable names in the model for the specified object type.
2103
2104        >>> nar_names = exo.get_variable_names('EX_NODAL')
2105
2106        Returns
2107        -------
2108              <list<string>>  nvar_names
2109        """
2110        if self.__ex_get_variable_param(objType).value == 0:
2111            return []
2112        return self.__ex_get_variable_names(objType)
2113
2114    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
2115
2116    def get_reduction_variable_names(self, objType):
2117        """
2118        get the list of reduction variable names in the model for the specified object type.
2119
2120        >>> nar_names = exo.get_reduction_variable_names('EX_ASSEMBL"Y')
2121
2122        Returns
2123        -------
2124              <list<string>>  nvar_names
2125        """
2126        if self.__ex_get_reduction_variable_param(objType).value == 0:
2127            return []
2128        return self.__ex_get_reduction_variable_names(objType)
2129
2130    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
2131
2132    def get_reduction_variable_name(self, objType, varId):
2133        """
2134        get a single reduction variable name in the model for the specified object type and index.
2135
2136        >>> nar_name = exo.get_reduction_variable_name('EX_ASSEMBL"Y', 100)
2137
2138        Returns
2139        -------
2140              string  nvar_name
2141        """
2142        if self.__ex_get_reduction_variable_param(objType).value == 0:
2143            return ""
2144        return self.__ex_get_reduction_variable_name(objType, varId)
2145
2146    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
2147
2148    def get_variable_number(self, objType):
2149        """
2150        get the number of variables of the specified type in the model
2151
2152        >>> num_nvars = exo.get_variable_number('EX_NODAL')
2153
2154        Returns
2155        -------
2156        num_nvars :               <int>
2157        """
2158        return self.__ex_get_variable_param(objType).value
2159
2160    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
2161
2162    def get_reduction_variable_number(self, objType):
2163        """
2164        get the number of reduction variables of the specified type in the model
2165
2166        >>> num_nvars = exo.get_reduction_variable_number('EX_ASSEMBLY')
2167
2168        Returns
2169        -------
2170        num_nvars :               <int>
2171        """
2172        return self.__ex_get_reduction_variable_param(objType).value
2173
2174    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
2175
2176    def set_variable_number(self, objType, number):
2177        """
2178        update the number of variables in the model
2179
2180        >>> status = exo.set_variable_number('EX_NODAL', num_nvars)
2181
2182        Parameters
2183        ----------
2184        num_nvars :               <int>
2185
2186        Returns
2187        -------
2188        status : bool
2189            True = successful execution
2190        """
2191        self.__ex_put_variable_param(objType, number)
2192        return True
2193
2194    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
2195
2196    def set_reduction_variable_number(self, objType, number):
2197        """
2198        update the number of reduction variables in the model
2199
2200        >>> status = exo.set_reduction_variable_number('EX_ASSEMBLY', num_nvars)
2201
2202        Parameters
2203        ----------
2204        num_nvars :               <int>
2205
2206        Returns
2207        -------
2208        status : bool
2209            True = successful execution
2210        """
2211        self.__ex_put_reduction_variable_param(objType, number)
2212        return True
2213
2214    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
2215
2216    def put_variable_name(self, objType, name, index):
2217        """
2218        add the name and index of a new variable to the model;
2219        variable indexing goes from 1 to exo.get_variable_number()
2220
2221        >>> status = exo.put_variable_name('EX_NODAL', nvar_name, nvar_index)
2222
2223        Parameters
2224        ----------
2225        objType : string
2226            object type
2227        var_name : string
2228            name of new variable
2229        nvar_index : int
2230            1-based index of new nodal variable
2231
2232        Returns
2233        -------
2234        status : bool
2235            True = successful execution
2236
2237        Note:
2238        ----
2239        this method is often called within the following sequence:
2240
2241        >>> num_nvars = exo.get_variable_number('EX_NODAL')
2242        >>> new_nvar_index = num_nvars + 1
2243        >>> num_nvars += 1
2244        >>> exo.set_variable_number('EX_NODAL', num_nvars)
2245        >>> exo.put_variable_name('EX_NODAL', "new_nvar_name", new_nvar_index)
2246        """
2247        varNames = self.get_variable_names(objType)
2248        if name in varNames:
2249            print(f'WARNING: variable \"{name}\" already exists.')
2250        if index > len(varNames):
2251            raise Exception("ERROR: variable index out of range.")
2252        self.__ex_put_variable_name(objType, index, name)
2253        return True
2254
2255    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
2256
2257    def put_reduction_variable_name(self, objType, name, index):
2258        """
2259        add the name and index of a new reduction variable to the model;
2260        variable indexing goes from 1 to exo.get_reductino_variable_number()
2261
2262        >>> status = exo.put_reduction_variable_name('EX_ASSEMBLY', assemvar_name, assemvar_index)
2263
2264        Parameters
2265        ----------
2266        objType : string
2267            object type
2268        var_name : string
2269            name of new variable
2270        nvar_index : int
2271            1-based index of new nodal variable
2272
2273        Returns
2274        -------
2275        status : bool
2276            True = successful execution
2277
2278        Note:
2279        ----
2280        this method is often called within the following sequence:
2281
2282        >>> num_assem_vars = exo.get_reduction_variable_number('EX_ASSEMBLY')
2283        >>> new_assem_var_index = num_assem_vars + 1
2284        >>> num_assem_vars += 1
2285        >>> exo.set_reduction_variable_number('EX_ASSEMBLY', num_assem_vars)
2286        >>> exo.put_reduction_variable_name('EX_ASSEMBLY', "new_assem_var_name", new_assem_var_index)
2287        """
2288        varNames = self.get_reduction_variable_names(objType)
2289        if name in varNames:
2290            print(f'WARNING: variable \"{name}\" already exists.')
2291        if index > len(varNames):
2292            raise Exception("ERROR: variable index out of range.")
2293        self.__ex_put_reduction_variable_name(objType, index, name)
2294        return True
2295
2296    def get_entity_count(self, objType, entityId):
2297        """
2298        get number of nodes/elements in the specified set/block. Typically used internally
2299        by other user-callable functions.
2300
2301        Parameters
2302        ----------
2303        objType   : ex_entity_type
2304            type of object being queried
2305        entityId : int
2306            id of the entity (block, set) *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2307        """
2308
2309        numVals = 0
2310        if objType == "EX_NODAL":
2311            numVals = self.num_nodes()
2312        elif objType in ['EX_ELEM_BLOCK', 'EX_FACE_BLOCK', 'EX_EDGE_BLOCK']:
2313            (_elemType, numVals, _nodesPerElem, _numAttr) = self.__ex_get_block(objType, entityId)
2314        elif objType in ['EX_NODE_SET', 'EX_EDGE_SET', 'EX_FACE_SET', 'EX_SIDE_SET']:
2315            (numVals, _numDistFactInSet) = self.__ex_get_set_param(objType, entityId)
2316
2317        return numVals
2318
2319    def get_variable_values(self, objType, entityId, name, step):
2320        """
2321        get list of `objType` variable values for a specified object id
2322        block, variable name, and time step
2323
2324        >>> evar_vals = exo.get_variable_values('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', elem_blk_id,
2325        ...                                            evar_name, time_step)
2326
2327        Parameters
2328        ----------
2329        objType   : ex_entity_type
2330            type of object being queried
2331        entityId : int
2332            id of the entity (block, set) *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2333        name : string
2334            name of variable
2335        time_step : int
2336            1-based index of time step
2337
2338        Returns
2339        -------
2340
2341            if array_type == 'ctype':
2342              <list<ctypes.c_double>>  evar_vals
2343
2344            if array_type == 'numpy':
2345              <np_array<double>>  evar_vals
2346        """
2347        names = self.get_variable_names(objType)
2348        var_id = names.index(name) + 1
2349        numVals = self.get_entity_count(objType, entityId)
2350
2351        values = self.__ex_get_var(step, objType, var_id, entityId, numVals)
2352        if self.use_numpy:
2353            values = ctype_to_numpy(self, values)
2354        return values
2355
2356    def put_variable_values(self, objType, entityId, name, step, values):
2357        """
2358        store a list of element variable values for a specified element
2359        block, element variable name, and time step
2360
2361        >>> status = exo.put_variable_values('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', elem_blk_id,
2362        ...             evar_name, time_step, evar_vals)
2363
2364        Parameters
2365        ----------
2366        entityId : int  entity *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2367            <string>    name    name of variable
2368            <int>          time_step    1-based index of time step
2369            <list<float>>  values the variable values to be output
2370
2371        Returns
2372        -------
2373        status : bool
2374            True = successful execution
2375        """
2376        names = self.get_variable_names(objType)
2377        var_id = names.index(name) + 1
2378        numVals = self.get_entity_count(objType, entityId)
2379
2380        self.__ex_put_var(step, objType, var_id, entityId, numVals, values)
2381        return True
2382
2383    def get_attribute_count(self, objType, objId):
2384        """
2385        IS THIS NEEDED, PYTHONIC WAY MAY BE TO JUST GET THEM...
2386
2387        get the number of attributes on the specified entity
2388
2389        >>> num_attribute = exo.get_attribute_count('EX_ASSEMBLY', 100)
2390
2391        Parameters
2392        ----------
2393        objType   : ex_entity_type
2394            type of object being queried
2395        id        : int
2396            entity *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2397
2398        Returns
2399        -------
2400            <int>  num_attribute
2401        """
2402        return self.__ex_get_attribute_count(objType, objId)
2403
2404    def get_attributes(self, objType, objId):
2405        """
2406        >>> attributes = exo.get_attributes('EX_ASSEMBLY', 100)
2407
2408        Returns
2409        -------
2410            <ex_attribute list> attributes
2411        """
2412
2413        return self.__ex_get_attributes(objType, objId)
2414
2415    def put_attribute(self, attribute):
2416        """
2417        >>> attribute = exodus.attribute('Scale', 'EX_ASSEMBLY', 100)
2418        >>> attribute.values = [1.1, 1.0, 1.2]
2419        >>> attributes = exo.put_attribute(attribute)
2420
2421        Returns
2422        -------
2423            <ex_attribute list> attributes
2424        """
2425
2426        return self.__ex_put_attribute(attribute)
2427
2428    def num_assembly(self):
2429        """
2430        get the number of assemblies in the model
2431
2432        >>> num_assembly = exo.num_assembly()
2433
2434        Returns
2435        -------
2436            <int>  num_assembly
2437        """
2438        return self.inquire('EX_INQ_ASSEMBLY')
2439
2440    def get_assembly(self, object_id):
2441        """
2442        reads the assembly parameters and assembly data for one assembly
2443        """
2444        assem = ex_assembly(id=object_id)
2445        self.__ex_get_assembly(assem)
2446        assmbly = assembly(assem.name.decode('utf8'), assem.id, assem.type)
2447        for j in range(assem.entity_count):
2448            assmbly.entity_list.append(assem.entity_list[j])
2449        return assmbly
2450
2451    def get_assemblies(self, object_ids):
2452        """
2453        reads the assembly parameters and assembly data for all assemblies
2454        with ids in object_ids
2455        """
2456        assemblies = [ex_assembly(id=object_id) for object_id in object_ids]
2457        assems = (ex_assembly * len(assemblies))(*assemblies)
2458        self.__ex_get_assemblies(assems)
2459        assembs = [assembly(assem.name.decode('utf8'), assem.id, assem.type) for assem in
2460                   assems]
2461        for i, a in enumerate(assems):
2462            for j in range(a.entity_count):
2463                assembs[i].entity_list.append(a.entity_list[j])
2464        return assembs
2465
2466    def put_assembly(self, assembly):
2467        """
2468        writes the assembly parameters and assembly data for one assembly
2469        """
2470        self.__ex_put_assembly(assembly)
2471
2472    def put_assemblies(self, assemblies):
2473        """
2474        writes the assembly parameters and assembly data for multiple assemblies
2475        """
2476        self.__ex_put_assemblies(assemblies)
2477
2478    def num_blob(self):
2479        """
2480        get the number of blobs in the model
2481
2482        >>> num_assembly = exo.num_blob()
2483
2484        Returns
2485        -------
2486            <int>  num_blob
2487        """
2488        return self.numBlob.value
2489
2490    def get_blob(self, object_id):
2491        """
2492        reads the blob parameters and blob data for one blob
2493        """
2494        blob = ex_blob(id=object_id)
2495        self.__ex_get_blob(blob)
2496        return blob
2497
2498    def num_blks(self):
2499        """
2500        get the number of element blocks in the model
2501
2502        >>> num_elem_blks = exo.num_blks()
2503
2504        Returns
2505        -------
2506        num_elem_blks : int
2507        """
2508        return self.numElemBlk.value
2509
2510    def get_elem_blk_ids(self):
2511        """
2512        get mapping of exodus element block index to user- or
2513        application-defined element block id; elem_blk_ids is ordered
2514        by the element block *INDEX* ordering, a 1-based system going
2515        from 1 to exo.num_blks(), used by exodus for storage
2516        and input/output of array data stored on the element blocks; a
2517        user or application can optionally use a separate element block
2518        *ID* numbering system, so the elem_blk_ids array points to the
2519        element block *ID* for each element block *INDEX*
2520
2521        >>> elem_blk_ids = exo.get_elem_blk_ids()
2522
2523        Returns
2524        -------
2525
2526            if array_type == 'ctype':
2527              <list<int>>  elem_blk_ids
2528
2529            if array_type == 'numpy':
2530              <np_array<int>>  elem_blk_ids
2531        """
2532        return self.get_ids('EX_ELEM_BLOCK')
2533
2534    def get_elem_blk_name(self, object_id):
2535        """
2536        get the element block name
2537
2538        >>> elem_blk_name = exo.get_elem_blk_name(elem_blk_id)
2539
2540        Parameters
2541        ----------
2542        elem_blk_id : int
2543            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2544
2545        Returns
2546        -------
2547        elem_blk_name : string
2548        """
2549        return self.__ex_get_name('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', object_id)
2550
2551    def put_elem_blk_name(self, object_id, name):
2552        """
2553        store the element block name
2554
2555        >>> exo.put_elem_blk_name(elem_blk_id, elem_blk_name)
2556
2557        Parameters
2558        ----------
2559        elem_blk_id : int
2560            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2561        elem_blk_name : string
2562        """
2563        self.__ex_put_name('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', object_id, name)
2564
2565    def get_elem_blk_names(self):
2566        """
2567        get a list of all element block names ordered by block *INDEX*;
2568        (see `exodus.get_ids` for explanation of the
2569        difference between block *ID* and block *INDEX*)
2570
2571        >>> elem_blk_names = exo.get_elem_blk_names()
2572
2573        Returns
2574        -------
2575        elem_blk_names : <list<string>>
2576        """
2577        return self.__ex_get_names('EX_ELEM_BLOCK')
2578
2579    def put_elem_blk_names(self, names):
2580        """
2581        store a list of all element block names ordered by block *INDEX*;
2582        (see `exodus.get_ids` for explanation of the
2583        difference between block *ID* and block *INDEX*)
2584
2585        >>> exo.put_elem_blk_names(elem_blk_names)
2586
2587        Parameters
2588        ----------
2589        elem_blk_names : <list<string>>
2590        """
2591        self.__ex_put_names('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', names)
2592
2593    def elem_blk_info(self, object_id):
2594        """
2595        get the element block info
2596
2597        >>> elem_type, num_blk_elems, num_elem_nodes, num_elem_attrs
2598        ...       = exo.elem_blk_info(elem_blk_id)
2599
2600        Parameters
2601        ----------
2602        elem_blk_id : int
2603            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2604
2605        Returns
2606        -------
2607            <string>  elem_type       element type, e.g. 'HEX8'
2608            <int>     num_blk_elems   number of elements in the block
2609            <int>     num_elem_nodes  number of nodes per element
2610            <int>     num_elem_attrs  number of attributes per element
2611        """
2612        (elemType, numElem, nodesPerElem, numAttr) = self.__ex_get_block('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', object_id)
2613        return elemType, numElem, nodesPerElem, numAttr
2614
2615    def put_elem_blk_info(self, elem_blk_id, elem_type, num_blk_elems,
2616                          num_elem_nodes, num_elem_attrs):
2617        """
2618        store the element block *ID* and element block info
2619
2620        >>> exo.put_elem_blk_info(elem_blk_id, elem_type, num_blk_elems,
2621        ...                      num_elem_nodes, num_elem_attrs)
2622
2623        Parameters
2624        ----------
2625        elem_blk_id : int
2626            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2627        elem_type : string
2628            element type (all caps), e.g. 'HEX8'
2629        num_blk_elems : int
2630            number of elements in the block
2631        num_elem_nodes : int
2632            number of nodes per element
2633        num_elem_attrs : int
2634            number of attributes per element
2635        """
2636        self.__ex_put_block('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', elem_blk_id, elem_type, num_blk_elems,
2637                            num_elem_nodes, num_elem_attrs)
2638
2639    def put_concat_elem_blk(self, elem_blk_ids, elem_type, num_blk_elems,
2640                            num_elem_nodes, num_elem_attrs, defineMaps):
2641        """
2642        same as exo.put_elem_blk_info() but for all blocks at once
2643
2644        >>> status = exo.put_concat_elem_blk(elem_blk_ids, elem_types,
2645        ...                                 num_blk_elems, num_elem_nodes, num_elem_attrs)
2646
2647        Parameters
2648        ----------
2649            <list<int>>     elem_blk_ids     element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2650              for each block
2651            <list<string>>  elem_types       element type for each block
2652            <list<int>>     num_blk_elems    number of elements for each
2653              block
2654            <list<int>>     num_elem_nodes   number of nodes per element
2655              for each block
2656            <list<int>>     num_elem_attrs   number of attributes per
2657              element for each block
2658
2659        Returns
2660        -------
2661        status : bool
2662            True = successful execution
2663        """
2664        self.__ex_put_concat_elem_blk(
2665            elem_blk_ids,
2666            elem_type,
2667            num_blk_elems,
2668            num_elem_nodes,
2669            num_elem_attrs,
2670            defineMaps)
2671        return True
2672
2673    def get_elem_connectivity(self, object_id):
2674        """
2675        get the nodal connectivity, number of elements, and
2676        number of nodes per element for a single block
2677
2678        >>> elem_conn, num_blk_elems, num_elem_nodes
2679        ...        = exo.get_elem_connectivity(elem_blk_id)
2680
2681        Parameters
2682        ----------
2683        elem_blk_id : int
2684            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2685
2686        Returns
2687        -------
2688
2689            if array_type == 'ctype':
2690              <list<int>>  elem_conn  ordered list of node *INDICES* that
2691                define the connectivity of each element
2692                in the block; the list cycles through
2693                all nodes of the first element, then
2694                all nodes of the second element, etc.
2695                (see `exodus.get_id_map` for explanation
2696                of node *INDEX* versus node *ID*)
2697
2698            if array_type == 'numpy':
2699              <np_array<int>>  elem_conn  (same description)
2700
2701            <int>  num_blk_elems    number of elements in the block
2702            <int>  num_elem_nodes   number of nodes per element
2703        """
2704        (elem_block_connectivity, num_elem_this_blk,
2705         num_nodes_per_elem) = self.__ex_get_elem_conn(object_id)
2706        if self.use_numpy:
2707            elem_block_connectivity = ctype_to_numpy(
2708                self, elem_block_connectivity)
2709        return elem_block_connectivity, num_elem_this_blk, num_nodes_per_elem
2710
2711    def put_elem_connectivity(self, object_id, connectivity):
2712        """
2713        store the nodal connectivity, number of elements, and
2714        number of nodes per element for a single block
2715
2716        >>> exo.put_elem_connectivity(elem_blk_id, elem_conn)
2717
2718        Parameters
2719        ----------
2720        elem_blk_id : int
2721            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2722            <list<int>>  elem_conn    ordered list of node *INDICES* that
2723              define the connectivity of each
2724              element in the block; the list cycles
2725              through all nodes of the first element,
2726              then all nodes of the second element,
2727              etc.
2728              (see `exodus.get_id_map` for explanation
2729              of node *INDEX* versus node *ID*)
2730        """
2731        _d1, numBlkElems, numNodesPerElem, _d2 = self.elem_blk_info(object_id)
2732        assert len(connectivity) == (numBlkElems * numNodesPerElem)
2733        self.__ex_put_elem_conn(object_id, connectivity)
2734
2735    def get_elem_attr(self, elem_blk_id):
2736        """
2737        get all attributes for each element in a block
2738
2739        >>> elem_attrs = exo.get_elem_attr(elem_blk_id)
2740
2741        Parameters
2742        ----------
2743        elem_blk_id : int
2744            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2745
2746        Returns
2747        -------
2748            if array_type == 'ctype' : <list<float>> elem_attrs
2749            if array_type == 'numpy' : <np_array<float>> elem_attrs
2750                list of attribute values for all
2751                elements in the block; the list cycles
2752                through all attributes of the first
2753                element, then all attributes of the
2754                second element, etc. Attributes are
2755                ordered by the ordering of the names
2756                returned by exo.get_attribute_names()
2757        """
2758        elem_attrs = self.__ex_get_elem_attr(elem_blk_id)
2759        if self.use_numpy:
2760            elem_attrs = ctype_to_numpy(self, elem_attrs)
2761        return elem_attrs
2762
2763    def get_elem_attr_values(self, elem_blk_id, elem_attr_name):
2764        """
2765        get an attribute for each element in a block
2766
2767        >>> elem_attrs = exo.get_elem_attr(elem_blk_id)
2768
2769        Parameters
2770        ----------
2771            <int>    elem_blk_id     element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2772            <string> elem_attr_name  element attribute name
2773
2774        Returns
2775        -------
2776            if array_type == 'ctype': <list<float>>  values
2777            if array_type == 'numpy': <np_array<float>>  values
2778                array of values for the requested
2779                attribute.  Array has dimensions of
2780                1 x num_elem, where num_elem is the
2781                number of elements on the element block.
2782        """
2783        # Determine index of requested attribute in attribute list
2784        elem_attr_names = self.get_attribute_names('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', elem_blk_id)
2785        a_ndx = elem_attr_names.index(elem_attr_name)
2786
2787        values = self.__ex_get_one_attr('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', elem_blk_id, a_ndx + 1)
2788        if self.use_numpy:
2789            values = ctype_to_numpy(self, values)
2790        return values
2791
2792    def get_attr_values(self, objType, elem_blk_id, elem_attr_name):
2793        """
2794        get an attribute for each element in a block
2795
2796        >>> elem_attrs = exo.get_elem_attr(elem_blk_id)
2797
2798        Parameters
2799        ----------
2800            <int>    elem_blk_id     element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2801            <string> elem_attr_name  element attribute name
2802
2803        Returns
2804        -------
2805            if array_type == 'ctype': <list<float>>  values
2806            if array_type == 'numpy': <np_array<float>>  values
2807                array of values for the requested
2808                attribute.  Array has dimensions of
2809                1 x num_elem, where num_elem is the
2810                number of elements on the element block.
2811        """
2812        # Determine index of requested attribute in attribute list
2813        elem_attr_names = self.get_attribute_names('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', elem_blk_id)
2814        a_ndx = elem_attr_names.index(elem_attr_name)
2815
2816        values = self.__ex_get_one_attr('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', elem_blk_id, a_ndx + 1)
2817        if self.use_numpy:
2818            values = ctype_to_numpy(self, values)
2819        return values
2820
2821    def put_elem_attr(self, elem_blk_id, elem_attrs):
2822        """
2823        store all attributes for each element in a block
2824
2825        >>> exo.put_elem_attr(elem_blk_id, elem_attrs)
2826
2827        Parameters
2828        ----------
2829        elem_blk_id : int
2830            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2831        <list<float>>  elem_attrs     list of all attribute values for all
2832            elements in the block; the list
2833            cycles through all attributes of
2834            the first element, then all attributes
2835            of the second element, etc. Attributes
2836            are ordered by the ordering of the
2837            names returned by
2838            exo.get_attribute_names()
2839        """
2840        self.__ex_put_elem_attr(elem_blk_id, elem_attrs)
2841
2842    def put_elem_attr_values(self, elem_blk_id, elem_attr_name, values):
2843        """
2844        store an attribute for each element in a block
2845
2846        >>> exo.put_elem_attr_values(elem_blk_id, elem_attr_name, values)
2847
2848        Parameters
2849        ----------
2850        elem_blk_id : int
2851            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2852        <string>       elem_attr_name element attribute name
2853        <list<float>>  values         list of values for a single attribute
2854                                        on a element block.  List dimensions
2855                                        should be 1 x N_elem, where N_elem is
2856                                        the number of elements on the element
2857                                        block.
2858        """
2859        # Determine index of requested attribute in attribute list
2860        elem_attr_names = self.get_attribute_names('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', elem_blk_id)
2861        a_ndx = elem_attr_names.index(elem_attr_name)
2862        self.__ex_put_one_attr('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', elem_blk_id, a_ndx + 1, values)
2863
2864    def elem_type(self, object_id):
2865        """
2866        get the element type, e.g. "HEX8", for an element block
2867
2868        >>> elem_type = exo.elem_type(elem_blk_id)
2869
2870        Parameters
2871        ----------
2872        elem_blk_id : int
2873            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2874
2875        Returns
2876        -------
2877            <string>  elem_type
2878        """
2879        (elemType, _numElem, _nodesPerElem, _numAttr) = self.__ex_get_block('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', object_id)
2880        return elemType
2881
2882    def num_attr(self, object_id):
2883        """
2884        get the number of attributes per element for an element block
2885
2886        >>> num_elem_attrs = exo.num_attr(elem_blk_id)
2887
2888        Parameters
2889        ----------
2890        elem_blk_id : int
2891            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2892
2893        Returns
2894        -------
2895            <int>  num_elem_attrs
2896        """
2897        (_elemType, _numElem, _nodesPerElem, numAttr) = self.__ex_get_block('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', object_id)
2898        return numAttr
2899
2900    def num_elems_in_blk(self, object_id):
2901        """
2902        get the number of elements in an element block
2903
2904        >>> num_blk_elems = exo.num_elems_in_blk(elem_blk_id)
2905
2906        Parameters
2907        ----------
2908        elem_blk_id : int
2909            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2910
2911        Returns
2912        -------
2913            <int>  num_blk_elems
2914        """
2915        vals = self.get_entity_count('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', object_id)
2916        return vals
2917
2918    def num_nodes_per_elem(self, object_id):
2919        """
2920        get the number of nodes per element for an element block
2921
2922        >>> num_elem_nodes = exo.num_nodes_per_elem(elem_blk_id)
2923
2924        Parameters
2925        ----------
2926        elem_blk_id : int
2927            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2928
2929        Returns
2930        -------
2931            <int>  num_elem_nodes
2932        """
2933        (_elemType, _numElem, nodesPerElem, _numAttr) = self.__ex_get_block('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', object_id)
2934        return nodesPerElem
2935
2936    def get_element_variable_truth_table(self, entId=None):
2937        """
2938        See `exodus.get_variable_truth_table`
2939        """
2940        return self.get_variable_truth_table('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', entId)
2941
2942    def set_element_variable_truth_table(self, table):
2943        """
2944        See `exodus.set_variable_truth_table`
2945        """
2946        return self.set_variable_truth_table('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', table)
2947
2948    def get_element_variable_values(self, blockId, name, step):
2949        """
2950        get list of element variable values for a specified element
2951        block, element variable name, and time step
2952
2953        >>> evar_vals = exo.get_element_variable_values(elem_blk_id,
2954        ...                                            evar_name, time_step)
2955
2956        Parameters
2957        ----------
2958        elem_blk_id : int
2959            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2960        evar_name : string
2961            name of element variable
2962        time_step : int
2963            1-based index of time step
2964
2965        Returns
2966        -------
2967
2968            if array_type == 'ctype':
2969              <list<ctypes.c_double>>  evar_vals
2970
2971            if array_type == 'numpy':
2972              <np_array<double>>  evar_vals
2973        """
2974        return self.get_variable_values('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', blockId, name, step)
2975
2976    def get_partial_element_variable_values(self, blockId, name, step, start_index, num_elements):
2977        """
2978        get list of element variable values for a specified element
2979        block, element variable name, and time step
2980
2981        >>> evar_vals = exo.get_element_variable_values(elem_blk_id,
2982        ...                                            evar_name, time_step)
2983
2984        Parameters
2985        ----------
2986        elem_blk_id : int
2987            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
2988        evar_name : string
2989            name of element variable
2990        time_step : int
2991            1-based index of time step
2992        start_index: int
2993            1-based index of element in block to start returning data
2994        num_elements: int
2995            number of elements to return data for.
2996
2997        Returns
2998        -------
2999
3000            if array_type == 'ctype':
3001              <list<ctypes.c_double>>  evar_vals
3002
3003            if array_type == 'numpy':
3004              <np_array<double>>  evar_vals
3005        """
3006        names = self.get_variable_names('EX_ELEM_BLOCK')
3007        var_id = names.index(name) + 1
3008        values = self.__ex_get_partial_var(step, 'EX_ELEM_BLOCK', var_id, blockId, start_index, num_elements)
3009        if self.use_numpy:
3010            values = ctype_to_numpy(self, values)
3011        return values
3012
3013    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3014
3015    def put_element_variable_values(self, blockId, name, step, values):
3016        """
3017        store a list of element variable values for a specified element
3018        block, element variable name, and time step
3019
3020        >>> status = exo.put_element_variable_values(elem_blk_id,
3021        ...             evar_name, time_step, evar_vals)
3022
3023        Parameters
3024        ----------
3025        elem_blk_id : int
3026            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3027            <string>       evar_name    name of element variable
3028            <int>          time_step    1-based index of time step
3029            <list<float>>  evar_vals
3030
3031        Returns
3032        -------
3033        status : bool
3034            True = successful execution
3035        """
3036        self.put_variable_values('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', blockId, name, step, values)
3037        return True
3038
3039    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3040
3041    def get_element_variable_number(self):
3042        """
3043        get the number of element variables in the model
3044
3045        >>> num_evars = exo.get_element_variable_number()
3046
3047        Returns
3048        -------
3049              <int>  num_evars
3050        """
3051        return self.__ex_get_variable_param('EX_ELEM_BLOCK').value
3052
3053    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3054
3055    def set_element_variable_number(self, number):
3056        """
3057        update the number of element variables in the model
3058
3059        >>> status = exo.set_element_variable_number(num_evars)
3060
3061        Parameters
3062        ----------
3063              <int>  num_evars
3064
3065        Returns
3066        -------
3067        status : bool
3068            True = successful execution
3069        """
3070        self.__ex_put_variable_param('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', number)
3071        return True
3072
3073    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3074
3075    def get_element_variable_names(self):
3076        """
3077        get the list of element variable names in the model
3078
3079        >>> evar_names = exo.get_element_variable_names()
3080
3081        Returns
3082        -------
3083              <list<string>>  evar_names
3084        """
3085        if self.__ex_get_variable_param('EX_ELEM_BLOCK').value == 0:
3086            return []
3087        return self.__ex_get_variable_names('EX_ELEM_BLOCK')
3088
3089    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3090
3091    def put_element_variable_name(self, name, index):
3092        """
3093        add the name and index of a new element variable to the model;
3094        element variable indexing goes from 1 to
3095        exo.get_element_variable_number()
3096
3097        >>> status = exo.put_element_variable_name(evar_name, evar_index)
3098
3099        Parameters
3100        ----------
3101            <string>  evar_name   name of new element variable
3102            <int>     evar_index  1-based index of new element variable
3103
3104        Returns
3105        -------
3106        status : bool
3107            True = successful execution
3108
3109        Note:
3110        ----
3111        this method is often called within the following sequence:
3112
3113        >>> num_evars = exo.get_element_variable_number()
3114        >>> new_evar_index = num_evars + 1
3115        >>> num_evars += 1
3116        >>> exo.set_element_variable_number(num_evars)
3117        >>> exo.put_element_variable_name("new_evar", new_evar_index)
3118        """
3119        EBvarNames = self.get_variable_names('EX_ELEM_BLOCK')
3120        if name in EBvarNames:
3121            print(f'WARNING: element variable \"{name}\" already exists.')
3122        if index > len(EBvarNames):
3123            print(("index", index, "len", len(EBvarNames)))
3124            raise Exception("ERROR: variable index out of range.")
3125        self.__ex_put_variable_name('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', index, name)
3126        return True
3127
3128    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3129
3130    def get_attribute_names(self, objType, blkId):
3131        """
3132        get the list of attribute names for the specified block/set
3133
3134        >>> attr_names = exo.get_attribute_names('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', elem_blk_id)
3135
3136        Parameters
3137        ----------
3138        objType:
3139            entity type
3140        blkId : int
3141            block/set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3142
3143        Returns
3144        -------
3145            <list<string>>  attr_names
3146        """
3147        names = self.__ex_get_attr_names(objType, blkId)
3148        return list(names)
3149
3150    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3151
3152    def get_element_attribute_names(self, blkId):
3153        """
3154        get the list of element attribute names for a block
3155
3156        >>> attr_names = exo.get_element_attribute_names(elem_blk_id)
3157
3158        Parameters
3159        ----------
3160        blkId : int
3161            block/set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3162
3163        Returns
3164        -------
3165            <list<string>>  attr_names
3166        """
3167        names = self.__ex_get_attr_names('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', blkId)
3168        return list(names)
3169
3170    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3171
3172    def put_attribute_names(self, objType, blkId, names):
3173        """
3174        store the list of element attribute names for a block
3175
3176        >>> status = exo.put_attribute_names('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', elem_blk_id, attr_names)
3177
3178        Parameters
3179        ----------
3180        objType:
3181            entity type
3182        blkId : int
3183            block/set  *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3184        <list<string>>  attr_names
3185
3186        Returns
3187        -------
3188        status : bool
3189            True = successful execution
3190        """
3191        return self.__ex_put_attr_names(objType, blkId, names)
3192
3193    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3194
3195    def put_element_attribute_names(self, blkId, names):
3196        """
3197        store the list of element attribute names for a block
3198
3199        >>> status = exo.put_attribute_names(elem_blk_id, attr_names)
3200
3201        Parameters
3202        ----------
3203        blkId : int
3204            block/set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3205        <list<string>>  attr_names
3206
3207        Returns
3208        -------
3209        status : bool
3210            True = successful execution
3211        """
3212        return self.__ex_put_attr_names('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', blkId, names)
3213
3214    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3215
3216    def get_element_property_names(self):
3217        """
3218        get the list of element property names for all element blocks
3219        in the model
3220
3221        >>> eprop_names = exo.get_element_property_names()
3222
3223        Returns
3224        -------
3225            <list<string>>  eprop_names
3226        """
3227        names = self.__ex_get_prop_names('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', 'EX_INQ_EB_PROP')
3228        return list(names)
3229
3230    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3231
3232    def get_element_property_value(self, object_id, name):
3233        """
3234        get element property value (an integer) for a specified element
3235        block and element property name
3236
3237        >>> eprop_val = exo.get_element_property_value(elem_blk_id, eprop_name)
3238
3239        Parameters
3240        ----------
3241        elem_blk_id : int
3242            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3243            <string>  eprop_name
3244
3245        Returns
3246        -------
3247            <int>  eprop_val
3248        """
3249        propVal = self.__ex_get_prop('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', object_id, name)
3250        return int(propVal)
3251
3252    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3253
3254    def put_element_property_value(self, object_id, name, value):
3255        """
3256        store an element property name and its integer value for an
3257        element block
3258
3259        >>> status = exo.put_element_property_value(elem_blk_id,
3260        ...                                         eprop_name, eprop_val)
3261
3262
3263        Parameters
3264        ----------
3265        elem_blk_id : int
3266            element block *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3267            <string>  eprop_name
3268            <int>     eprop_val
3269
3270        Returns
3271        -------
3272        status : bool
3273            True = successful execution
3274        """
3275        return self.__ex_put_prop('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', object_id, name, value)
3276
3277    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3278
3279    #
3280    # nodesets
3281    #
3282    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3283
3284    def num_node_sets(self):
3285        """
3286        get the number of node sets in the model
3287
3288        >>> num_node_sets = exo.num_node_sets()
3289
3290        Returns
3291        -------
3292            <int>  num_node_sets
3293        """
3294        return self.numNodeSets.value
3295
3296    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3297
3298    def get_node_set_ids(self):
3299        """
3300        get mapping of exodus node set index to user- or application-
3301        defined node set id; node_set_ids is ordered
3302        by the *INDEX* ordering, a 1-based system going from
3303        1 to exo.num_node_sets(), used by exodus for storage
3304        and input/output of array data stored on the node sets; a
3305        user or application can optionally use a separate node set
3306        *ID* numbering system, so the node_set_ids array points to the
3307        node set *ID* for each node set *INDEX*
3308
3309        >>> node_set_ids = exo.get_ids('EX_NODE_SET')
3310
3311        Returns
3312        -------
3313
3314            if array_type == 'ctype':
3315              <list<int>>  node_set_ids
3316
3317            if array_type == 'numpy':
3318              <np_array<int>>  node_set_ids
3319        """
3320        return self.get_ids('EX_NODE_SET')
3321
3322    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3323
3324    def get_node_set_name(self, object_id):
3325        """
3326        get the name of a node set
3327
3328        >>> node_set_name = exo.get_node_set_name(node_set_id)
3329
3330        Parameters
3331        ----------
3332            <int>  node_set_id  node set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3333
3334        Returns
3335        -------
3336            <string>  node_set_name
3337        """
3338        return self.__ex_get_name('EX_NODE_SET', object_id)
3339
3340    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3341
3342    def put_node_set_name(self, object_id, name):
3343        """
3344        store the name of a node set
3345
3346        >>> exo.put_node_set_name(node_set_id, node_set_name)
3347
3348        Parameters
3349        ----------
3350            <int>     node_set_id    node set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3351            <string>  node_set_name
3352        """
3353        self.__ex_put_name('EX_NODE_SET', object_id, name)
3354
3355    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3356
3357    def get_node_set_names(self):
3358        """
3359        get a list of all node set names ordered by node set *INDEX*;
3360        (see `exodus.get_ids` for explanation of the
3361        difference between node set *ID* and node set *INDEX*)
3362
3363        >>> node_set_names = exo.get_node_set_names()
3364
3365        Returns
3366        -------
3367            <list<string>>  node_set_names
3368        """
3369        return self.__ex_get_names('EX_NODE_SET')
3370
3371    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3372
3373    def put_node_set_names(self, names):
3374        """
3375        store a list of all node set names ordered by node set *INDEX*;
3376        (see `exodus.get_ids` for explanation of the
3377        difference between node set *ID* and node set *INDEX*)
3378
3379        >>> exo.put_node_set_names(node_set_names)
3380
3381        Parameters
3382        ----------
3383            <list<string>>  node_set_names
3384        """
3385        self.__ex_put_names('EX_NODE_SET', names)
3386
3387    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3388
3389    def num_nodes_in_node_set(self, object_id):
3390        """
3391        get the number of nodes in a node set
3392
3393        >>> num_ns_nodes = exo.num_nodes_in_node_set(node_set_id)
3394
3395        Parameters
3396        ----------
3397            <int>  node_set_id  node set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3398
3399        Returns
3400        -------
3401            <int>  num_ns_nodes
3402        """
3403        node_set_nodes = self.get_node_set_nodes(object_id)
3404        return len(node_set_nodes)
3405
3406    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3407
3408    def get_node_set_nodes(self, object_id):
3409        """
3410        get the list of node *INDICES* in a node set
3411        (see `exodus.get_id_map` for explanation of node *INDEX*
3412        versus node *ID*)
3413
3414        >>> ns_nodes = exo.get_node_set_nodes(node_set_id)
3415
3416        Parameters
3417        ----------
3418            <int>  node_set_id  node set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3419
3420        Returns
3421        -------
3422
3423            if array_type == 'ctype':
3424              <list<int>>  ns_nodes
3425
3426            if array_type == 'numpy':
3427              <np_array<int>>  ns_nodes
3428        """
3429        node_set_ids = self.get_ids('EX_NODE_SET')
3430        assert object_id in node_set_ids
3431        node_set_nodes = self.__ex_get_node_set(object_id)
3432        node_set_nodes = list(node_set_nodes)
3433        if self.use_numpy:
3434            node_set_nodes = self.np.array(node_set_nodes)
3435        return node_set_nodes
3436
3437    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3438
3439    def put_node_set(self, object_id, nodeSetNodes):
3440        """
3441        store a node set by its id and the list of node *INDICES* in
3442        the node set (see `exodus.get_id_map` for explanation of node
3443        *INDEX* versus node *ID*)
3444
3445        >>> exo.put_node_set(node_set_id, ns_nodes)
3446
3447        Parameters
3448        ----------
3449            <int>        node_set_id  node set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3450            <list<int>>  ns_nodes
3451        """
3452        self.__ex_put_node_set(object_id, nodeSetNodes)
3453
3454    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3455
3456    def get_node_set_dist_facts(self, object_id):
3457        """
3458        get the list of distribution factors for nodes in a node set
3459
3460        >>> ns_dist_facts = exo.get_node_set_dist_facts(node_set_id)
3461
3462        Parameters
3463        ----------
3464            <int>        node_set_id  node set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3465
3466        Returns
3467        -------
3468
3469            if array_type == 'ctype':
3470              <list<float>>  ns_dist_facts  a list of distribution factors,
3471                e.g. nodal 'weights'
3472
3473            if array_type == 'numpy':
3474              <np_array<double>>  ns_dist_facts  a list of distribution
3475                factors, e.g. nodal
3476                'weights'
3477        """
3478        node_set_dfs = self.__ex_get_node_set_dist_fact(object_id)
3479        node_set_dfs = list(node_set_dfs)
3480        if self.use_numpy:
3481            node_set_dfs = self.np.array(node_set_dfs)
3482        return node_set_dfs
3483
3484    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3485
3486    def put_node_set_dist_fact(self, object_id, nodeSetDistFact):
3487        """
3488        store the list of distribution factors for nodes in a node set
3489
3490        >>> exo.put_node_set_dist_fact(node_set_id, ns_dist_facts)
3491
3492        Parameters
3493        ----------
3494            <int>          node_set_id    node set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3495            <list<float>>  ns_dist_facts  a list of distribution factors,
3496              e.g. nodal 'weights'
3497        """
3498        self.__ex_put_node_set_dist_fact(object_id, nodeSetDistFact)
3499
3500    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3501
3502    def get_node_set_variable_number(self):
3503        """
3504        get the number of node set variables in the model
3505
3506        >>> num_nsvars = exo.get_node_set_variable_number()
3507
3508        Returns
3509        -------
3510              <int>  num_nsvars
3511        """
3512        return self.__ex_get_variable_param('EX_NODE_SET').value
3513
3514    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3515
3516    def set_node_set_variable_number(self, number):
3517        """
3518        update the number of node set variables in the model
3519
3520        >>> status = exo.set_node_set_variable_number(num_nsvars)
3521
3522        Parameters
3523        ----------
3524              <int>  num_nsvars
3525
3526        Returns
3527        -------
3528        status : bool
3529            True = successful execution
3530        """
