3531        self.__ex_put_variable_param('EX_NODE_SET', number)
3532        return True
3533
3534    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3535
3536    def get_node_set_variable_truth_table(self, entId=None):
3537        """
3538        See `exodus.get_variable_truth_table`
3539        """
3540        return self.get_variable_truth_table('EX_NODE_SET', entId)
3541
3542    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3543
3544    def set_node_set_variable_truth_table(self, table):
3545        """
3546        See `exodus.set_variable_truth_table`
3547        """
3548        return self.set_variable_truth_table('EX_NODE_SET', table)
3549
3550    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3551
3552    def get_node_set_variable_names(self):
3553        """
3554        get the list of node set variable names in the model
3555
3556        >>> nsvar_names = exo.get_node_set_variable_names()
3557
3558        Returns
3559        -------
3560              <list<string>>  nsvar_names
3561        """
3562        if self.__ex_get_variable_param('EX_NODE_SET').value == 0:
3563            return []
3564        return self.__ex_get_variable_names('EX_NODE_SET')
3565
3566    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3567
3568    def put_node_set_variable_name(self, name, index):
3569        """
3570        add the name and index of a new node set variable to the model;
3571        node set variable indexing goes from 1 to
3572        exo.get_node_set_variable_number()
3573
3574        >>> status = exo.put_node_set_variable_name(nsvar_name, nsvar_index)
3575
3576        Parameters
3577        ----------
3578            <string>  nsvar_name   name of new node set variable
3579            <int>     nsvar_index  1-based index of new node set variable
3580
3581        Returns
3582        -------
3583        status : bool
3584            True = successful execution
3585
3586        Note:
3587        -----
3588        this method is often called within the following sequence:
3589
3590        >>> num_nsvars = exo.get_node_set_variable_number()
3591        >>> new_nsvar_index = num_nsvars + 1
3592        >>> num_nsvars += 1
3593        >>> exo.set_node_set_variable_number(num_nsvars)
3594        >>> exo.put_node_set_variable_name("new_nsvar", new_nsvar_index)
3595        """
3596        NSvarNames = self.get_variable_names('EX_NODE_SET')
3597        if name in NSvarNames:
3598            print(f'WARNING: Node set variable \"{name}\" already exists.')
3599        if index > len(NSvarNames):
3600            raise Exception("ERROR: variable index out of range.")
3601        self.__ex_put_variable_name('EX_NODE_SET', index, name)
3602        return True
3603
3604    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3605
3606    def get_node_set_variable_values(self, object_id, name, step):
3607        """
3608        get list of node set variable values for a specified node
3609        set, node set variable name, and time step; the list has
3610        one variable value per node in the set
3611
3612        >>> nsvar_vals =
3613        ...   exo.get_node_set_variable_values(node_set_id,
3614        ...    nsvar_name, time_step)
3615
3616        Parameters
3617        ----------
3618            <int>     node_set_id  node set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3619            <string>  nsvar_name   name of node set variable
3620            <int>     time_step    1-based index of time step
3621
3622        Returns
3623        -------
3624
3625            if array_type == 'ctype':
3626              <list<ctypes.c_double>>  nsvar_vals
3627
3628            if array_type == 'numpy':
3629              <np_array<double>>  nsvar_vals
3630        """
3631        return self.get_variable_values('EX_NODE_SET', object_id, name, step)
3632
3633    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3634
3635    def get_partial_node_set_variable_values(self, object_id, name, step, start_index, num_nodes):
3636        """
3637        get list of node set variable values for a specified node
3638        set, node set variable name, and time step; the list has
3639        one variable value per node in the set
3640
3641        >>> nsvar_vals =
3642        ...   exo.get_node_set_variable_values(node_set_id,
3643        ...    nsvar_name, time_step)
3644
3645        Parameters
3646        ----------
3647            <int>     node_set_id  node set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3648            <string>  nsvar_name   name of node set variable
3649            <int>     time_step    1-based index of time step
3650            <int>     start_index 1-based index of node to start returning data
3651            <int>     num_nodes   number of nodes to return data for.
3652
3653        Returns
3654        -------
3655
3656            if array_type == 'ctype':
3657              <list<ctypes.c_double>>  nsvar_vals
3658
3659            if array_type == 'numpy':
3660              <np_array<double>>  nsvar_vals
3661        """
3662        names = self.get_variable_names('EX_NODE_SET')
3663        var_id = names.index(name) + 1
3664        values = self.__ex_get_partial_var(step, 'EX_NODE_SET', var_id, object_id, start_index, num_nodes)
3665        if self.use_numpy:
3666            values = ctype_to_numpy(self, values)
3667        return values
3668
3669    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3670
3671    def put_node_set_variable_values(self, object_id, name, step, values):
3672        """
3673        store a list of node set variable values for a specified node
3674        set, node set variable name, and time step; the list has one
3675        variable value per node in the set
3676
3677        >>> status =
3678        ... exo.put_node_set_variable_values(node_set_id,
3679        ...     nsvar_name, time_step, nsvar_vals)
3680
3681        Parameters
3682        ----------
3683            <int>          node_set_id  node set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3684            <string>       nsvar_name   name of node set variable
3685            <int>          time_step    1-based index of time step
3686            <list<float>>  nsvar_vals
3687
3688        Returns
3689        -------
3690        status : bool
3691            True = successful execution
3692        """
3693        self.put_variable_values('EX_NODE_SET', object_id, name, step, values)
3694        return True
3695
3696    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3697
3698    def get_all_node_set_params(self):
3699        """
3700        get total number of nodes and distribution factors (e.g. nodal
3701        'weights') combined among all node sets
3702
3703        >>> tot_num_ns_nodes,
3704        ... tot_num_ns_dist_facts = exo.get_all_node_set_params()
3705
3706        Returns
3707        -------
3708            <int>  tot_num_ns_nodes
3709            <int>  tot_num_ns_dist_facts
3710        """
3711        nodeSetIds = self.__ex_get_ids('EX_NODE_SET')
3712        totNumSetNodes, totNumSetDistFacts = 0, 0
3713        for nodeSetId in nodeSetIds:
3714            (numSetNodes, numSetDistFacts) = self.__ex_get_set_param('EX_NODE_SET', nodeSetId)
3715            totNumSetNodes += numSetNodes
3716            totNumSetDistFacts += numSetDistFacts
3717        return totNumSetNodes, totNumSetDistFacts
3718
3719    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3720
3721    def get_set_params(self, object_type, object_id):
3722        """
3723        get number of entities and distribution factors (e.g. nodal
3724        'weights') in the specified set
3725
3726        >>> num_ns_nodes, num_ns_dist_facts =
3727        ...     exo.get_set_params('EX_NODE_SET', node_set_id)
3728
3729        Parameters
3730        ----------
3731        set_id : int
3732            set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3733
3734        Returns
3735        -------
3736        num_set_entities : int
3737        num_set_dist_facts : int
3738        """
3739        (numSetEntities, numSetDistFacts) = self.__ex_get_set_param(object_type, object_id)
3740        return numSetEntities, numSetDistFacts
3741
3742    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3743
3744    def put_set_params(self, object_type, object_id, numSetEntity, numSetDistFacts=None):
3745        """
3746        initialize a new set of the specified type
3747
3748        >>> exo.put_set_params('EX_NODE_SET', node_set_id,
3749        ...                 num_ns_nodes, num_ns_dist_facts)
3750
3751        Parameters
3752        ----------
3753        set_id : int
3754            set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3755        num_set_entity : int
3756            number of nodes/edges/faces/elements to be added to set
3757        num_dist_facts : int, optional
3758            number of distribution factors (e.g. nodal 'weights') --
3759            must be equal to zero or num_set_entity
3760        """
3761        if numSetDistFacts is None:
3762            numSetDistFacts = numSetEntity
3763        assert numSetDistFacts in (0, numSetEntity)
3764        self.__ex_put_set_param(object_type, object_id, numSetEntity, numSetDistFacts)
3765
3766    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3767
3768    def get_node_set_params(self, object_id):
3769        """ See `exodus.put_set_params` """
3770
3771        (numSetNodes, numSetDistFacts) = self.__ex_get_set_param('EX_NODE_SET', object_id)
3772        return numSetNodes, numSetDistFacts
3773
3774    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3775
3776    def put_node_set_params(self, object_id, numSetNodes, numSetDistFacts=None):
3777        """ See `exodus.put_set_params` """
3778        if numSetDistFacts is None:
3779            numSetDistFacts = numSetNodes
3780        assert numSetDistFacts in (0, numSetNodes)
3781        self.__ex_put_set_param('EX_NODE_SET', object_id, numSetNodes, numSetDistFacts)
3782
3783    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3784
3785    def get_node_set_property_names(self):
3786        """
3787        get the list of node set property names for all node sets in
3788        the model
3789
3790        >>> nsprop_names = exo.get_node_set_property_names()
3791
3792        Returns
3793        -------
3794            <list<string>>  nsprop_names
3795        """
3796        names = self.__ex_get_prop_names('EX_NODE_SET', 'EX_INQ_NS_PROP')
3797        return list(names)
3798
3799    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3800
3801    def get_node_set_property_value(self, object_id, name):
3802        """
3803        get node set property value (an integer) for a specified node
3804        set and node set property name
3805
3806        >>> nsprop_val = exo.get_node_set_property_value(node_set_id, nsprop_name)
3807
3808        Parameters
3809        ----------
3810            <int>     node_set_id  node set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3811            <string>  nsprop_name
3812
3813        Returns
3814        -------
3815            <int>  nsprop_val
3816        """
3817        propVal = self.__ex_get_prop('EX_NODE_SET', object_id, name)
3818        return int(propVal)
3819
3820    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3821
3822    def put_node_set_property_value(self, object_id, name, value):
3823        """
3824        store a node set property name and its integer value for a
3825        node set
3826
3827        >>> status = exo.put_node_set_property_value(node_set_id,
3828        ...                   nsprop_name, nsprop_val)
3829
3830        Parameters
3831        ----------
3832            <int>     node_set_id  node set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3833            <string>  nsprop_name
3834            <int>     nsprop_val
3835
3836        Returns
3837        -------
3838        status : bool
3839            True = successful execution
3840        """
3841        return self.__ex_put_prop('EX_NODE_SET', object_id, name, value)
3842
3843    #
3844    # sidesets
3845    #
3846    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3847
3848    def num_side_sets(self):
3849        """
3850        get the number of side sets in the model
3851
3852        >>> num_side_sets = exo.num_side_sets()
3853
3854        Returns
3855        -------
3856            <int>  num_side_sets
3857        """
3858        return self.numSideSets.value
3859
3860    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3861
3862    def get_side_set_ids(self):
3863        """
3864        get mapping of exodus side set index to user- or application-
3865        defined side set id; side_set_ids is ordered
3866        by the *INDEX* ordering, a 1-based system going from
3867        1 to exo.num_side_sets(), used by exodus for storage
3868        and input/output of array data stored on the side sets; a
3869        user or application can optionally use a separate side set
3870        *ID* numbering system, so the side_set_ids array points to the
3871        side set *ID* for each side set *INDEX*
3872
3873        >>> side_set_ids = exo.get_ids('EX_SIDE_SET')
3874
3875        Returns
3876        -------
3877
3878            if array_type == 'ctype':
3879              <list<int>>  side_set_ids
3880
3881            if array_type == 'numpy':
3882              <np_array<int>>  side_set_ids
3883        """
3884        return self.get_ids('EX_SIDE_SET')
3885
3886    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3887
3888    def get_side_set_name(self, object_id):
3889        """
3890        get the name of a side set
3891
3892        >>> side_set_name = exo.get_side_set_name(side_set_id)
3893
3894        Parameters
3895        ----------
3896            <int>  side_set_id  side set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3897
3898        Returns
3899        -------
3900            <string>  side_set_name
3901        """
3902        return self.__ex_get_name('EX_SIDE_SET', object_id)
3903
3904    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3905
3906    def put_side_set_name(self, object_id, name):
3907        """
3908        store the name of a side set
3909
3910        >>> exo.put_side_set_name(side_set_id, side_set_name)
3911
3912        Parameters
3913        ----------
3914            <int>     side_set_id    side set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3915            <string>  side_set_name
3916        """
3917        self.__ex_put_name('EX_SIDE_SET', object_id, name)
3918
3919    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3920
3921    def get_side_set_names(self):
3922        """
3923        get a list of all side set names ordered by side set *INDEX*;
3924        (see `exodus.get_ids` for explanation of the
3925        difference between side set *ID* and side set *INDEX*)
3926
3927        >>> side_set_names = exo.get_side_set_names()
3928
3929        Returns
3930        -------
3931            <list<string>>  side_set_names
3932        """
3933        return self.__ex_get_names('EX_SIDE_SET')
3934
3935    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3936
3937    def put_side_set_names(self, names):
3938        """
3939        store a list of all side set names ordered by side set *INDEX*;
3940        (see `exodus.get_ids` for explanation of the
3941        difference between side set *ID* and side set *INDEX*)
3942
3943        >>> exo.put_side_set_names(side_set_names)
3944
3945        Parameters
3946        ----------
3947            <list<string>>  side_set_names
3948        """
3949        self.__ex_put_names('EX_SIDE_SET', names)
3950
3951    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3952
3953    def num_faces_in_side_set(self, object_id):
3954        """
3955        get the number of faces in a side set
3956
3957        >>> num_ss_faces = exo.num_faces_in_side_set(side_set_id)
3958
3959        Parameters
3960        ----------
3961            <int>  side_set_id  side set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
3962
3963        Returns
3964        -------
3965            <int>  num_ss_faces
3966        """
3967        ssids = self.get_ids('EX_SIDE_SET')
3968        if object_id not in ssids:
3969            print("WARNING: queried side set ID does not exist in database")
3970            return 0
3971        (num_side_in_set, _num_dist_fact_in_set) = self.__ex_get_set_param('EX_SIDE_SET', object_id)
3972        return num_side_in_set
3973
3974    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
3975
3976    def get_all_side_set_params(self):
3977        """
3978        get total number of sides, nodes, and distribution factors
3979        (e.g. nodal 'weights') combined among all side sets
3980
3981        >>> tot_num_ss_sides, tot_num_ss_nodes, tot_num_ss_dist_facts =
3982        ...          exo.get_all_side_set_params()
3983
3984        Returns
3985        -------
3986            <int>  tot_num_ss_sides
3987            <int>  tot_num_ss_nodes
3988            <int>  tot_num_ss_dist_facts
3989
3990        Note:
3991        -----
3992        The number of nodes (and distribution factors) in a side set is
3993        the sum of all face nodes.  A single node can be counted more
3994        than once, i.e. once for each face it belongs to in the side set.
3995        """
3996        ids = self.__ex_get_ids('EX_SIDE_SET')
3997        totNumSetSides, totNumSetDistFacts = 0, 0  # totNumSetDistFacts = totNumSetNodes
3998        for sideSetId in ids:
3999            (numSetSides, numSetDistFacts) = self.__ex_get_set_param('EX_SIDE_SET', sideSetId)
4000            totNumSetSides += numSetSides
4001            totNumSetDistFacts += numSetDistFacts
4002        totNumSetNodes = totNumSetDistFacts
4003        return totNumSetSides, totNumSetNodes, totNumSetDistFacts
4004
4005    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4006
4007    def get_side_set_params(self, object_id):
4008        """
4009        get number of sides and nodal distribution factors (e.g. nodal
4010        'weights') in a side set
4011
4012        >>> num_ss_sides, num_ss_dist_facts = exo.get_side_set_params(side_set_id)
4013
4014        Parameters
4015        ----------
4016            <int>  side_set_id  side set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
4017
4018        Returns
4019        -------
4020            <int>  num_ss_sides
4021            <int>  num_ss_dist_facts
4022
4023        Note:
4024        -----
4025        The number of nodes (and distribution factors) in a side set is
4026        the sum of all face nodes.  A single node can be counted more
4027        than once, i.e. once for each face it belongs to in the side set.
4028        """
4029        (numSetSides, numSetDistFacts) = self.__ex_get_set_param('EX_SIDE_SET', object_id)
4030        return numSetSides, numSetDistFacts
4031
4032    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4033
4034    def put_side_set_params(self, object_id, numSetSides, numSetDistFacts):
4035        """
4036        initialize a new side set
4037
4038        >>> exo.put_side_set_params(side_set_id, num_ss_sides, num_ss_dist_facts)
4039
4040        Parameters
4041        ----------
4042            <int>  side_set_id        side set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
4043            <int>  num_ss_sides       number of sides to be added to set
4044            <int>  num_ss_dist_facts  number of nodal distribution factors
4045              (e.g. nodal 'weights')
4046
4047        Note:
4048        -----
4049        The number of nodes (and distribution factors) in a side set is
4050        the sum of all face nodes.  A single node can be counted more
4051        than once, i.e. once for each face it belongs to in the side set.
4052        """
4053        self.__ex_put_set_param('EX_SIDE_SET', object_id, numSetSides, numSetDistFacts)
4054
4055    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4056
4057    def get_side_set(self, object_id):
4058        """
4059        get the lists of element and side indices in a side set; the
4060        two lists correspond: together, ss_elems[i] and ss_sides[i]
4061        define the face of an element
4062
4063        >>> ss_elems, ss_sides = exo.get_side_set(side_set_id)
4064
4065        Parameters
4066        ----------
4067            <int>  side_set_id  side set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
4068
4069        Returns
4070        -------
4071
4072            if array_type == 'ctype':
4073              <list<int>>  ss_elems
4074              <list<int>>  ss_sides
4075
4076            if array_type == 'numpy':
4077              <np_array<int>>  ss_elems
4078              <np_array<int>>  ss_sides
4079        """
4080        (side_set_elem_list, side_set_side_list) = self.__ex_get_side_set(object_id)
4081        if self.use_numpy:
4082            side_set_elem_list = ctype_to_numpy(self, side_set_elem_list)
4083            side_set_side_list = ctype_to_numpy(self, side_set_side_list)
4084        return side_set_elem_list, side_set_side_list
4085
4086    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4087
4088    def put_side_set(self, object_id, sideSetElements, sideSetSides):
4089        """
4090        store a side set by its id and the lists of element and side
4091        indices in the side set; the two lists correspond: together,
4092        ss_elems[i] and ss_sides[i] define the face of an element
4093
4094        >>> exo.put_side_set(side_set_id, ss_elems, ss_sides)
4095
4096        Parameters
4097        ----------
4098            <int>        side_set_id  side set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
4099            <list<int>>  ss_elems
4100            <list<int>>  ss_sides
4101        """
4102        self.__ex_put_side_set(object_id, sideSetElements, sideSetSides)
4103
4104    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4105
4106    def get_side_set_dist_fact(self, object_id):
4107        """
4108        get the list of distribution factors for nodes in a side set
4109
4110        >>> ss_dist_facts = exo.get_side_set_dist_fact(side_set_id)
4111
4112        Parameters
4113        ----------
4114            <int>        side_set_id  side set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
4115
4116        Returns
4117        -------
4118
4119            if array_type == 'ctype':
4120              <list<float>>  ss_dist_facts  a list of distribution factors,
4121                e.g. nodal 'weights'
4122
4123            if array_type == 'numpy':
4124              <np_array<double>>  ss_dist_facts  a list of distribution
4125                factors, e.g. nodal
4126                'weights'
4127
4128        Note:
4129        -----
4130        The number of nodes (and distribution factors) in a side set is
4131        the sum of all face nodes.  A single node can be counted more
4132        than once, i.e. once for each face it belongs to in the side set.
4133        """
4134        side_set_dfs = list(self.__ex_get_side_set_dist_fact(object_id))
4135        if self.use_numpy:
4136            side_set_dfs = self.np.array(side_set_dfs)
4137        return side_set_dfs
4138
4139    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4140
4141    def put_side_set_dist_fact(self, object_id, sideSetDistFact):
4142        """
4143        store the list of distribution factors for nodes in a side set
4144
4145        >>> exo.put_side_set_dist_fact(side_set_id, ss_dist_facts)
4146
4147        Parameters
4148        ----------
4149            <int>          node_set_id    node set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
4150            <list<float>>  ns_dist_facts  a list of distribution factors,
4151              e.g. nodal 'weights'
4152
4153        Note:
4154        -----
4155        The number of nodes (and distribution factors) in a side set is
4156        the sum of all face nodes.  A single node can be counted more
4157        than once, i.e. once for each face it belongs to in the side set.
4158        """
4159        self.__ex_put_side_set_dist_fact(object_id, sideSetDistFact)
4160
4161    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4162
4163    def get_side_set_node_list(self, object_id):
4164        """
4165        get two lists:
4166         1. number of nodes for each side in the set
4167         2. concatenation of the nodes for each side in the set
4168
4169        >>> ss_num_nodes_per_side, ss_nodes = exo.get_side_set_node_list(side_set_id)
4170
4171        Parameters
4172        ----------
4173            <int>        side_set_id  side set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
4174
4175        Returns
4176        -------
4177
4178            if array_type == 'ctype':
4179              <list<int>>  ss_num_side_nodes
4180              <list<int>>  ss_nodes
4181
4182            if array_type == 'numpy':
4183              <np_array<int>>  ss_num_side_nodes
4184              <np_array<int>>  ss_nodes
4185
4186        Note:
4187        -----
4188        The number of nodes (and distribution factors) in a side set is
4189        the sum of all face nodes.  A single node can be counted more
4190        than once, i.e. once for each face it belongs to in the side set.
4191        """
4192        (side_set_node_cnt_list,
4193         side_set_node_list) = self.__ex_get_side_set_node_list(object_id)
4194        if self.use_numpy:
4195            side_set_node_cnt_list = ctype_to_numpy(
4196                self, side_set_node_cnt_list)
4197            side_set_node_list = ctype_to_numpy(self, side_set_node_list)
4198        return side_set_node_cnt_list, side_set_node_list
4199
4200    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4201
4202    def get_side_set_variable_truth_table(self, entId=None):
4203        """
4204        See `exodus.get_variable_truth_table`
4205        """
4206        return self.get_variable_truth_table('EX_SIDE_SET', entId)
4207
4208    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4209
4210    def set_side_set_variable_truth_table(self, table):
4211        """
4212        See `exodus.set_variable_truth_table`
4213        """
4214        return self.set_variable_truth_table('EX_SIDE_SET', table)
4215
4216    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4217
4218    def get_side_set_variable_number(self):
4219        """
4220        get the number of side set variables in the model
4221
4222        >>> num_ssvars = exo.get_side_set_variable_number()
4223
4224        Returns
4225        -------
4226              <int>  num_ssvars
4227        """
4228        return self.__ex_get_variable_param('EX_SIDE_SET').value
4229
4230    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4231
4232    def set_side_set_variable_number(self, number):
4233        """
4234        update the number of side set variables in the model
4235
4236        >>> status = exo.set_side_set_variable_number(num_ssvars)
4237
4238        Parameters
4239        ----------
4240              <int>  num_ssvars
4241
4242        Returns
4243        -------
4244        status : bool
4245            True = successful execution
4246        """
4247        self.__ex_put_variable_param('EX_SIDE_SET', number)
4248        return True
4249
4250    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4251
4252    def get_side_set_variable_names(self):
4253        """
4254        get the list of side set variable names in the model
4255
4256        >>> ssvar_names = exo.get_side_set_variable_names()
4257
4258        Returns
4259        -------
4260              <list<string>>  ssvar_names
4261        """
4262        if self.__ex_get_variable_param('EX_SIDE_SET').value == 0:
4263            return []
4264        return self.__ex_get_variable_names('EX_SIDE_SET')
4265
4266    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4267
4268    def put_side_set_variable_name(self, name, index):
4269        """
4270        add the name and index of a new side set variable to the model;
4271        side set variable indexing goes from 1 to
4272        exo.get_side_set_variable_number()
4273
4274        >>> status = exo.put_side_set_variable_name(ssvar_name, ssvar_index)
4275
4276        Parameters
4277        ----------
4278            <string>  ssvar_name   name of new side set variable
4279            <int>     ssvar_index  1-based index of new side set variable
4280
4281        Returns
4282        -------
4283        status : bool
4284            True = successful execution
4285
4286        Note:
4287        -----
4288        this method is often called within the following sequence:
4289
4290        >>> num_ssvars = exo.get_side_set_variable_number()
4291        >>> new_ssvar_index = num_ssvars + 1
4292        >>> num_ssvars += 1
4293        >>> exo.set_side_set_variable_number(num_ssvars)
4294        >>> exo.put_side_set_variable_name("new_ssvar", new_ssvar_index)
4295
4296        """
4297        SSvarNames = self.get_variable_names('EX_SIDE_SET')
4298        if name in SSvarNames:
4299            print(f'WARNING: Side set variable \"{name}\" already exists.')
4300        if index > len(SSvarNames):
4301            raise Exception("ERROR: variable index out of range.")
4302        self.__ex_put_variable_name('EX_SIDE_SET', index, name)
4303        return True
4304
4305    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4306
4307    def get_side_set_variable_values(self, object_id, name, step):
4308        """
4309        get list of side set variable values for a specified side
4310        set, side set variable name, and time step; the list has
4311        one variable value per side in the set
4312
4313        >>> ssvar_vals = exo.get_side_set_variable_values(side_set_id,
4314        ...    ssvar_name, time_step)
4315
4316        Parameters
4317        ----------
4318            <int>     side_set_id  side set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
4319            <string>  ssvar_name   name of side set variable
4320            <int>     time_step    1-based index of time step
4321
4322        Returns
4323        -------
4324
4325            if array_type == 'ctype':
4326              <list<ctypes.c_double>>  ssvar_vals
4327
4328            if array_type == 'numpy':
4329              <np_array<double>>  ssvar_vals
4330        """
4331        return self.get_variable_values('EX_SIDE_SET', object_id, name, step)
4332
4333    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4334
4335    def get_partial_side_set_variable_values(self, object_id, name, step, start_index, num_sides):
4336        """
4337        get list of side set variable values for a specified side
4338        set, side set variable name, and time step; the list has
4339        one variable value per side in the set
4340
4341        >>> ssvar_vals = exo.get_side_set_variable_values(side_set_id,
4342        ...    ssvar_name, time_step)
4343
4344        Parameters
4345        ----------
4346            <int>     side_set_id  side set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
4347            <string>  ssvar_name   name of side set variable
4348            <int>     time_step    1-based index of time step
4349            <int>     start_index 1-based index of side to start returning data
4350            <int>     num_nodes   number of sides to return data for.
4351
4352        Returns
4353        -------
4354
4355            if array_type == 'ctype':
4356              <list<ctypes.c_double>>  ssvar_vals
4357
4358            if array_type == 'numpy':
4359              <np_array<double>>  ssvar_vals
4360        """
4361        names = self.get_variable_names('EX_SIDE_SET')
4362        var_id = names.index(name) + 1
4363        values = self.__ex_get_partial_var(step, 'EX_SIDE_SET', var_id, object_id, start_index, num_sides)
4364        if self.use_numpy:
4365            values = ctype_to_numpy(self, values)
4366        return values
4367
4368    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4369
4370    def put_side_set_variable_values(self, object_id, name, step, values):
4371        """
4372        store a list of side set variable values for a specified side
4373        set, side set variable name, and time step; the list has one
4374        variable value per side in the set
4375
4376        >>> status = exo.put_side_set_variable_values(side_set_id,
4377        ...              ssvar_name, time_step, ssvar_vals)
4378
4379        Parameters
4380        ----------
4381            <int>          side_set_id  side set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
4382            <string>       ssvar_name   name of side set variable
4383            <int>          time_step    1-based index of time step
4384            <list<float>>  ssvar_vals
4385
4386        Returns
4387        -------
4388        status : bool
4389            True = successful execution
4390        """
4391        self.put_variable_values('EX_SIDE_SET', object_id, name, step, values)
4392        return True
4393
4394    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4395
4396    def get_side_set_property_names(self):
4397        """
4398        get the list of side set property names for all side sets in
4399        the model
4400
4401        >>> ssprop_names = exo.get_side_set_property_names()
4402
4403        Returns
4404        -------
4405            <list<string>>  ssprop_names
4406        """
4407        names = self.__ex_get_prop_names('EX_SIDE_SET', 'EX_INQ_SS_PROP')
4408        return list(names)
4409
4410    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4411
4412    def get_side_set_property_value(self, object_id, name):
4413        """
4414        get side set property value (an integer) for a specified side
4415        set and side set property name
4416
4417        >>> ssprop_val = exo.get_side_set_property_value(side_set_id, ssprop_name)
4418
4419        Parameters
4420        ----------
4421            <int>     side_set_id  side set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
4422            <string>  ssprop_name
4423
4424        Returns
4425        -------
4426            <int>  ssprop_val
4427        """
4428        propVal = self.__ex_get_prop('EX_SIDE_SET', object_id, name)
4429        return int(propVal)
4430
4431    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4432
4433    def put_side_set_property_value(self, object_id, name, value):
4434        """
4435        store a side set property name and its integer value for a
4436        side set
4437
4438        >>> status = exo.put_side_set_property_value(side_set_id,
4439        ...               ssprop_name, ssprop_val)
4440
4441        Parameters
4442        ----------
4443            <int>     side_set_id  side set *ID* (not *INDEX*)
4444            <string>  ssprop_name
4445            <int>     ssprop_val
4446
4447        Returns
4448        -------
4449        status : bool
4450            True = successful execution
4451        """
4452        return self.__ex_put_prop('EX_SIDE_SET', object_id, name, value)
4453
4454    #
4455    # global variables
4456    #
4457    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4458
4459    def get_global_variable_number(self):
4460        """
4461        get the number of global variables in the model
4462
4463        >>> num_gvars = exo.get_global_variable_number()
4464
4465        Returns
4466        -------
4467              <int>  num_gvars
4468        """
4469        return self.__ex_get_variable_param('EX_GLOBAL').value
4470
4471    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4472
4473    def set_global_variable_number(self, number):
4474        """
4475        update the number of global variables in the model
4476
4477        >>> status = exo.set_global_variable_number(num_gvars)
4478
4479        Parameters
4480        ----------
4481              <int>  num_gvars
4482
4483        Returns
4484        -------
4485        status : bool
4486            True = successful execution
4487        """
4488        self.__ex_put_variable_param('EX_GLOBAL', number)
4489        return True
4490
4491    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4492
4493    def get_global_variable_names(self):
4494        """
4495        get the list of global variable names in the model
4496
4497        >>> gvar_names = exo.get_global_variable_names()
4498
4499        Returns
4500        -------
4501              <list<string>>  gvar_names
4502        """
4503        if self.get_variable_number('EX_GLOBAL') == 0:
4504            return []
4505        return self.__ex_get_variable_names('EX_GLOBAL')
4506
4507    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4508
4509    def put_global_variable_name(self, name, index):
4510        """
4511        add the name and index of a new global variable to the model;
4512        global variable indexing goes from 1 to
4513        exo.get_global_variable_number()
4514
4515        >>> status = exo.put_global_variable_name(gvar_name, gvar_index)
4516
4517        Parameters
4518        ----------
4519            <string>  gvar_name   name of new global variable
4520            <int>     gvar_index  1-based index of new global variable
4521
4522        Returns
4523        -------
4524        status : bool
4525            True = successful execution
4526
4527        Note:
4528        -----
4529        this method is often called within the following sequence:
4530
4531        >>> num_gvars = exo.get_global_variable_number()
4532        >>> new_gvar_index = num_gvars + 1
4533        >>> num_gvars += 1
4534        >>> exo.set_global_variable_number(num_gvars)
4535        >>> exo.put_global_variable_name("new_gvar", new_gvar_index)
4536        """
4537        GlobVarNames = self.get_variable_names('EX_GLOBAL')
4538        if name in GlobVarNames:
4539            print(f'WARNING: Global variable \"{name}\" already exists.')
4540        if index > len(GlobVarNames):
4541            print(("index", index, "len", len(GlobVarNames)))
4542            raise Exception("ERROR: variable index out of range.")
4543        self.__ex_put_variable_name('EX_GLOBAL', index, name)
4544        return True
4545
4546    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4547
4548    def get_global_variable_value(self, name, step):
4549        """
4550        get a global variable value for a specified global variable
4551        name and time step
4552
4553        >>> gvar_val = exo.get_global_variable_value(gvar_name, time_step)
4554
4555        Parameters
4556        ----------
4557            <string>  gvar_name  name of global variable
4558            <int>     time_step  1-based index of time step
4559
4560        Returns
4561        -------
4562            <float>  gvar_val
4563        """
4564        names = self.get_variable_names('EX_GLOBAL')
4565        var_id = names.index(name)
4566        num = self.__ex_get_variable_param('EX_GLOBAL')
4567        gvalues = self.__ex_get_var(step, 'EX_GLOBAL', 0, 1, num.value)
4568        return gvalues[var_id]
4569
4570    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4571
4572    def get_all_global_variable_values(self, step):
4573        """
4574        get all global variable values (one for each global variable
4575        name, and in the order given by exo.get_global_variable_names())
4576        at a specified time step
4577
4578        >>> gvar_vals = exo.get_all_global_variable_values(time_step)
4579
4580        Parameters
4581        ----------
4582            <int>     time_step  1-based index of time step
4583
4584        Returns
4585        -------
4586
4587            if array_type == 'ctype':
4588              <list<float>>  gvar_vals
4589
4590            if array_type == 'numpy':
4591              <np_array<double>>  gvar_vals
4592        """
4593        num = self.__ex_get_variable_param('EX_GLOBAL')
4594        gvalues = self.__ex_get_var(step, 'EX_GLOBAL', 0, 1, num.value)
4595        values = [gvalues[i] for i in range(num.value)]
4596        if self.use_numpy:
4597            values = self.np.array(values)
4598        return values
4599
4600    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4601
4602    def put_global_variable_value(self, name, step, value):
4603        """
4604        store a global variable value for a specified global variable
4605        name and time step
4606
4607        >>> status = exo.put_global_variable_value(gvar_name, time_step, gvar_val)
4608
4609        Parameters
4610        ----------
4611            <string>  gvar_name  name of global variable
4612            <int>     time_step  1-based index of time step
4613            <float>   gvar_val
4614
4615        Returns
4616        -------
4617        status : bool
4618            True = successful execution
4619        """
4620        # we must write all values at once, not individually
4621        names = self.get_variable_names('EX_GLOBAL')
4622        # get all values
4623        numVals = self.get_variable_number('EX_GLOBAL')
4624        values = (ctypes.c_double * numVals)()
4625        for i in range(numVals):
4626            values[i] = ctypes.c_double(
4627                self.get_global_variable_value(
4628                    names[i], step))
4629        # adjust one of them
4630        values[names.index(name)] = ctypes.c_double(value)
4631        # write them all
4632        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_var(self.fileId,
4633                              ctypes.c_int(step),
4634                              ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type('EX_GLOBAL')),
4635                              ctypes.c_int(1),
4636                              ctypes.c_int(0),
4637                              ctypes.c_int(numVals),
4638                              values)
4639        return True
4640
4641    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4642
4643    def put_all_global_variable_values(self, step, values):
4644        """
4645        store all global variable values (one for each global variable
4646        name, and in the order given by exo.get_global_variable_names())
4647        at a specified time step
4648
4649        >>> status = exo.put_all_global_variable_values(time_step, gvar_vals)
4650
4651        Parameters
4652        ----------
4653            <int>          time_step  1-based index of time step
4654            <list<float>>  gvar_vals
4655
4656        Returns
4657        -------
4658        status : bool
4659            True = successful execution
4660        """
4661        numVals = self.get_variable_number('EX_GLOBAL')
4662        gvalues = (ctypes.c_double * numVals)()
4663        for i in range(numVals):
4664            gvalues[i] = ctypes.c_double(values[i])
4665        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_var(self.fileId,
4666                              ctypes.c_int(step),
4667                              ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type('EX_GLOBAL')),
4668                              ctypes.c_int(1),
4669                              ctypes.c_int(0),
4670                              ctypes.c_int(numVals),
4671                              gvalues)
4672        return True
4673
4674    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4675
4676    def get_global_variable_values(self, name):
4677        """
4678        get global variable values over all time steps for one global
4679        variable name
4680
4681        >>> gvar_vals = exo.get_global_variable_values(gvar_name)
4682
4683        Parameters
4684        ----------
4685            <string>  gvar_name  name of global variable
4686
4687        Returns
4688        -------
4689
4690            if array_type == 'ctype':
4691              <list<float>>  gvar_vals
4692
4693            if array_type == 'numpy':
4694              <np_array<double>>  gvar_vals
4695        """
4696        names = self.get_variable_names('EX_GLOBAL')
4697        var_id = names.index(name)
4698        num = self.__ex_get_variable_param('EX_GLOBAL')
4699        values = []
4700        for i in range(self.numTimes.value):
4701            gvalues = self.__ex_get_var(i + 1, 'EX_GLOBAL', 0, 1, num.value)
4702            values.append(gvalues[var_id])
4703        if self.use_numpy:
4704            values = self.np.array(values)
4705        return values
4706
4707    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4708
4709    def put_polyhedra_elem_blk(self, blkID,
4710                               num_elems_this_blk,
4711                               num_faces,
4712                               num_attr_per_elem):
4713        """
4714        put in an element block with polyhedral elements
4715
4716        >>> status = exo.put_polyhedra_elem_blk(blkID, num_elems_this_blk,
4717        ...                                     num_faces, num_attr_per_elem)
4718
4719        Parameters
4720        ----------
4721            <int>     blkID               id of the block to be added
4722            <int>     num_elems_this_blk
4723            <int>     num_faces  total number of faces in this block
4724            <int>     num_attr_per_elem
4725
4726        Returns
4727        -------
4728        status : bool
4729            True = successful execution
4730        """
4731
4732        ebType = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type('EX_ELEM_BLOCK'))
4733        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_block(self.fileId, ebType, ctypes.c_longlong(blkID),
4734                                ctypes.create_string_buffer(b"NFACED"),
4735                                ctypes.c_longlong(num_elems_this_blk),
4736                                ctypes.c_longlong(0),
4737                                ctypes.c_longlong(0),
4738                                ctypes.c_longlong(num_faces),
4739                                ctypes.c_longlong(num_attr_per_elem))
4740        return True
4741
4742    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4743
4744    def put_polyhedra_face_blk(self, blkID,
4745                               num_faces_this_blk,
4746                               num_nodes,
4747                               num_attr_per_face):
4748        """
4749        put in a block of faces
4750
4751        >>> status = exo.put_polyhedra_face_blk(blkID, num_faces_this_blk,
4752        ...                                     num_nodes, num_attr_per_face)
4753
4754        Parameters
4755        ----------
4756            <int>     blkID               id of the block to be added
4757            <int>     num_faces_this_blk
4758            <int>     num_nodes           total number of nodes in this block
4759            <int>     num_attr_per_face
4760
4761        Returns
4762        -------
4763        status : bool
4764            True = successful execution
4765        """
4766        fbType = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type('EX_FACE_BLOCK'))
4767        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_block(self.fileId, fbType, ctypes.c_longlong(blkID),
4768                                ctypes.create_string_buffer(b"NSIDED"),
4769                                ctypes.c_longlong(num_faces_this_blk),
4770                                ctypes.c_longlong(num_nodes),
4771                                ctypes.c_longlong(0),
4772                                ctypes.c_longlong(0),
4773                                ctypes.c_longlong(num_attr_per_face))
4774        return True
4775
4776    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4777
4778    def put_face_count_per_polyhedra(self, blkID, entityCounts):
4779        """
4780        put in a count of faces in for each polyhedra in an elem block
4781
4782        >>> status = exo.put_face_count_per_polyhedra(blkID, entityCounts)
4783
4784        Parameters
4785        ----------
4786            <int>     blkID               id of the block to be added
4787
4788            if array_type == 'ctype':
4789              <list<float>>  entityCounts
4790
4791            if array_type == 'numpy':
4792              <np_array<double>>  entityCounts
4793
4794        Returns
4795        -------
4796        status : bool
4797            True = successful execution
4798        """
4799        ebType = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type('EX_ELEM_BLOCK'))
4800        entity_counts = (ctypes.c_int * len(entityCounts))()
4801        entity_counts[:] = entityCounts
4802        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_entity_count_per_polyhedra(
4803            self.fileId, ebType, ctypes.c_longlong(blkID), entity_counts)
4804        return True
4805
4806    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4807
4808    def put_node_count_per_face(self, blkID, entityCounts):
4809        """
4810        put in a count of nodes in for each face in a polygonal face block
4811
4812        >>> status = exo.put_node_count_per_face(blkID, entityCounts)
4813
4814        Parameters
4815        ----------
4816            <int>     blkID               id of the block to be added
4817
4818            if array_type == 'ctype':
4819              <list<float>>  entityCounts
4820
4821            if array_type == 'numpy':
4822              <np_array<double>>  entityCounts
4823
4824        Returns
4825        -------
4826        status : bool
4827            True = successful execution
4828        """
4829        ebType = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type('EX_FACE_BLOCK'))
4830        entity_counts = (ctypes.c_int * len(entityCounts))()
4831        entity_counts[:] = entityCounts
4832        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_entity_count_per_polyhedra(
4833            self.fileId, ebType, ctypes.c_longlong(blkID), entity_counts)
4834        return True
4835
4836    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4837
4838    def put_elem_face_conn(self, blkId, elemFaceConn):
4839        """
4840        put in connectivity information from elems to faces
4841
4842        >>> status = exo.put_elem_face_conn(blkID, elemFaceConn)
4843
4844        Parameters
4845        ----------
4846            <int>     blkID               id of the elem block to be added
4847
4848            if array_type == 'ctype':
4849              <list<float>>  elemFaceConn  (raveled/flat list)
4850
4851            if array_type == 'numpy':
4852              <np_array<double>>  elemFaceConn  (raveled/flat array)
4853
4854        Returns
4855        -------
4856        status : bool
4857            True = successful execution
4858        """
4859        ebType = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type('EX_ELEM_BLOCK'))
4860        elem_face_conn = (ctypes.c_int * len(elemFaceConn))()
4861        elem_face_conn[:] = elemFaceConn
4862        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_conn(self.fileId, ebType, ctypes.c_longlong(blkId),
4863                               None, None, elem_face_conn)
4864        return True
4865
4866    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4867
4868    def put_face_node_conn(self, blkId, faceNodeConn):
4869        """
4870        put in connectivity information from faces to nodes
4871
4872        >>> status = exo.put_face_node_conn(blkID, faceNodeConn)
4873
4874        Parameters
4875        ----------
4876            <int>     blkID               id of the face block to be added
4877
4878            if array_type == 'ctype':
4879              <list<float>>  faceNodeConn  (raveled/flat list)
4880
4881            if array_type == 'numpy':
4882              <np_array<double>>  faceNodeConn  (raveled/flat array)
4883
4884        Returns
4885        -------
4886        status : bool
4887            True = successful execution
4888        """
4889        ebType = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type('EX_FACE_BLOCK'))
4890        node_conn = (ctypes.c_int * len(faceNodeConn))()
4891        node_conn[:] = faceNodeConn
4892        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_conn(self.fileId, ebType, ctypes.c_longlong(blkId),
4893                               node_conn, None, None)
4894        return True
4895
4896    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4897
4898    def close(self):
4899        """
4900        close the exodus file
4901
4902        >>> exo.close()
4903
4904        Note:
4905        -----
4906        Can only be called once for an exodus object, and once called
4907        all methods for that object become inoperable
4908        """
4909        print(f"Closing exodus file: {self.fileName}")
4910        errorInt = EXODUS_LIB.ex_close(self.fileId)
4911        if errorInt != 0:
4912            raise Exception(
4913                "ERROR: Closing file " + self.fileName + " had problems.")
4914
4915    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4916    #
4917    # Private Exodus API calls
4918    #
4919    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4920
4921    def __open(self, io_size=0):
4922        print(f"Opening exodus file: {self.fileName}")
4923        self.mode = EX_READ
4924        if self.modeChar.lower() == "a":
4925            self.mode = EX_WRITE
4926        if self.modeChar.lower() == "w+":
4927            self.mode = EX_CLOBBER
4928
4929        if self.modeChar.lower() in [
4930                "a", "r"] and not os.path.isfile(self.fileName):
4931            raise Exception(
4932                "ERROR: Cannot open " + self.fileName + " for read. Does not exist.")
4933        elif self.modeChar.lower() == "w" and os.path.isfile(self.fileName):
4934            raise Exception(f"ERROR: Cowardly not opening {self.fileName} for write. File already exists.")
4935
4936        elif self.modeChar.lower() not in ["a", "r", "w", "w+"]:
4937            raise Exception(
4938                "ERROR: File open mode " + self.modeChar + " unrecognized.")
4939
4940        self.comp_ws = ctypes.c_int(8)
4941        self.io_ws = ctypes.c_int(io_size)
4942        self.version = ctypes.c_float(0.0)
4943        if self.modeChar.lower() in ["a", "r"]:  # open existing file
4944            self.fileId = EXODUS_LIB.ex_open_int(self.fileName.encode('ascii'), self.mode,
4945                                                 ctypes.byref(self.comp_ws),
4946                                                 ctypes.byref(self.io_ws),
4947                                                 ctypes.byref(self.version),
4948                                                 EX_API_VERSION_NODOT)
4949        else:  # create file
4950            if io_size == 0:
4951                io_size = 8
4952                self.io_ws = ctypes.c_int(io_size)
4953            self.__create()
4954
4955    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4956
4957    def __create(self):
4958        self.fileId = EXODUS_LIB.ex_create_int(self.fileName.encode('ascii'), self.mode,
4959                                               ctypes.byref(self.comp_ws),
4960                                               ctypes.byref(self.io_ws),
4961                                               EX_API_VERSION_NODOT)
4962
4963    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4964
4965    def __ex_get_info(self):
4966        self.Title = ctypes.create_string_buffer(MAX_LINE_LENGTH + 1)
4967        if EXODUS_LIB.ex_int64_status(self.fileId) & EX_BULK_INT64_API:
4968            self.numDim = ctypes.c_longlong(0)
4969            self.numNodes = ctypes.c_longlong(0)
4970            self.numElem = ctypes.c_longlong(0)
4971            self.numElemBlk = ctypes.c_longlong(0)
4972            self.numNodeSets = ctypes.c_longlong(0)
4973            self.numSideSets = ctypes.c_longlong(0)
4974            self.numAssembly = ctypes.c_longlong(0)
4975            self.numBlob = ctypes.c_longlong(0)
4976        else:
4977            self.numDim = ctypes.c_int(0)
4978            self.numNodes = ctypes.c_int(0)
4979            self.numElem = ctypes.c_int(0)
4980            self.numElemBlk = ctypes.c_int(0)
4981            self.numNodeSets = ctypes.c_int(0)
4982            self.numSideSets = ctypes.c_int(0)
4983            self.numAssembly = ctypes.c_int(0)
4984            self.numBlob = ctypes.c_int(0)
4985        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_init(
4986            self.fileId, self.Title,
4987            ctypes.byref(self.numDim),
4988            ctypes.byref(self.numNodes),
4989            ctypes.byref(self.numElem),
4990            ctypes.byref(self.numElemBlk),
4991            ctypes.byref(self.numNodeSets),
4992            ctypes.byref(self.numSideSets))
4993
4994    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
4995
4996    def __ex_put_info(self, info):
4997        self.Title = ctypes.create_string_buffer(info[0].encode('ascii'), MAX_LINE_LENGTH + 1)
4998        self.numDim = ctypes.c_longlong(info[1])
4999        self.numNodes = ctypes.c_longlong(info[2])
5000        self.numElem = ctypes.c_longlong(info[3])
5001        self.numElemBlk = ctypes.c_longlong(info[4])
5002        self.numNodeSets = ctypes.c_longlong(info[5])
5003        self.numSideSets = ctypes.c_longlong(info[6])
5004        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_init(
5005            self.fileId,
5006            self.Title,
5007            self.numDim,
5008            self.numNodes,
5009            self.numElem,
5010            self.numElemBlk,
5011            self.numNodeSets,
5012            self.numSideSets)
5013        self.version = self.__ex_inquire_float(ex_inquiry_map('EX_INQ_DB_VERS'))
5014
5015    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
5016
5017    def __ex_put_concat_elem_blk(self, elemBlkIDs, elemType, numElemThisBlk,
5018                                 numNodesPerElem, numAttr, defineMaps):
5019        if EXODUS_LIB.ex_int64_status(self.fileId) & EX_IDS_INT64_API:
5020            elem_blk_ids = (ctypes.c_longlong * len(elemBlkIDs))()
5021            elem_blk_ids[:] = elemBlkIDs
5022            num_elem_this_blk = (ctypes.c_longlong * len(elemBlkIDs))()
5023            num_elem_this_blk[:] = numElemThisBlk
5024            num_nodes_per_elem = (ctypes.c_longlong * len(elemBlkIDs))()
5025            num_nodes_per_elem[:] = numNodesPerElem
5026            num_attr = (ctypes.c_longlong * len(elemBlkIDs))()
5027        else:
5028            elem_blk_ids = (ctypes.c_int * len(elemBlkIDs))()
5029            elem_blk_ids[:] = elemBlkIDs
5030            num_elem_this_blk = (ctypes.c_int * len(elemBlkIDs))()
5031            num_elem_this_blk[:] = numElemThisBlk
5032            num_nodes_per_elem = (ctypes.c_int * len(elemBlkIDs))()
5033            num_nodes_per_elem[:] = numNodesPerElem
5034            num_attr = (ctypes.c_int * len(elemBlkIDs))()
5035        num_attr[:] = numAttr
5036        elem_type = (ctypes.c_char_p * len(elemBlkIDs))()
5037        elem_type[:] = elemType
5038        define_maps = ctypes.c_int(defineMaps)
5039        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_concat_elem_block(
5040            self.fileId,
5041            elem_blk_ids,
5042            elem_type,
5043            num_elem_this_blk,
5044            num_nodes_per_elem,
5045            num_attr,
5046            define_maps)
5047
5048    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
5049
5050    def __ex_get_qa(self):
5051        num_qa_recs = ctypes.c_int(self.__ex_inquire_int(ex_inquiry_map('EX_INQ_QA')))
5052        qa_rec_ptrs = ((ctypes.POINTER(ctypes.c_char * (MAX_STR_LENGTH + 1)) * 4) * num_qa_recs.value)()
5053        for i in range(num_qa_recs.value):
5054            for j in range(4):
5055                qa_rec_ptrs[i][j] = ctypes.pointer(
5056                    ctypes.create_string_buffer(MAX_STR_LENGTH + 1))
5057        if num_qa_recs.value:
5058            EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_qa(self.fileId, ctypes.byref(qa_rec_ptrs))
5059        qa_recs = []
5060        for qara in qa_rec_ptrs:
5061            qa_rec_list = [ptr.contents.value.decode("utf8") for ptr in qara]
5062            qa_rec_tuple = tuple(qa_rec_list)
5063            assert len(qa_rec_tuple) == 4
5064            qa_recs.append(qa_rec_tuple)
5065        return qa_recs
5066
5067    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
5068
5069    def __ex_put_qa(self, qaRecs):
5070        num_qa_recs = ctypes.c_int(len(qaRecs))
5071        qa_rec_ptrs = ((ctypes.POINTER(ctypes.c_char * (MAX_STR_LENGTH + 1)) * 4) * num_qa_recs.value)()
5072        for i in range(num_qa_recs.value):
5073            for j in range(4):
5074                qa_rec_ptrs[i][j] = ctypes.pointer(ctypes.create_string_buffer(
5075                    str(qaRecs[i][j]).encode('ascii'), MAX_STR_LENGTH + 1))
5076        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_qa(self.fileId, num_qa_recs, ctypes.byref(qa_rec_ptrs))
5077        return True
5078
5079    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
5080
5081    def _ex_get_info_recs_quietly(self):
5082        num_infos = ctypes.c_int(self.__ex_inquire_int(ex_inquiry_map('EX_INQ_INFO')))
5083        info_ptrs = (ctypes.POINTER(ctypes.c_char * (MAX_LINE_LENGTH + 1)) * num_infos.value)()
5084        for i in range(num_infos.value):
5085            info_ptrs[i] = ctypes.pointer(ctypes.create_string_buffer(MAX_LINE_LENGTH + 1))
5086        if num_infos.value:
5087            EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_info(self.fileId, ctypes.byref(info_ptrs))
5088        return [irp.contents.value.decode("utf8") for irp in info_ptrs]
5089
5090    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
5091
5092    def __ex_get_info_recs(self):
5093        num_infos = ctypes.c_int(self.__ex_inquire_int(ex_inquiry_map('EX_INQ_INFO')))
5094        info_ptrs = (ctypes.POINTER(ctypes.c_char * (MAX_LINE_LENGTH + 1)) * num_infos.value)()
5095        for i in range(num_infos.value):
5096            info_ptrs[i] = ctypes.pointer(ctypes.create_string_buffer(MAX_LINE_LENGTH + 1))
5097        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_info(self.fileId, ctypes.byref(info_ptrs))
5098        info_recs = [irp.contents.value.decode("utf8") for irp in info_ptrs]
5099        for rec in info_recs:
5100            if len(rec) > MAX_LINE_LENGTH:
5101                print("WARNING: max line length reached for one or more info records;")
5102                print("         info might be incomplete for these records")
5103                break
5104        return info_recs
5105
5106    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
5107
5108    def __ex_put_info_recs(self, infoRecs):
5109        num_infos = ctypes.c_int(len(infoRecs))
5110        info_ptrs = (ctypes.POINTER(ctypes.c_char * (MAX_LINE_LENGTH + 1)) * num_infos.value)()
5111        for i in range(num_infos.value):
5112            info_ptrs[i] = ctypes.pointer(ctypes.create_string_buffer(
5113                str(infoRecs[i]).encode('ascii'), MAX_LINE_LENGTH + 1))
5114        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_info(self.fileId, num_infos, ctypes.byref(info_ptrs))
5115        return True
5116
5117    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
5118
5119    def __ex_inquire_float(self, inq_id):
5120        dummy_char = ctypes.create_string_buffer(MAX_LINE_LENGTH + 1)
5121        ret_float = ctypes.c_float(0.0)
5122        if EXODUS_LIB.ex_int64_status(self.fileId) & EX_INQ_INT64_API:
5123            dummy_int = ctypes.c_longlong(0)
5124        else:
5125            dummy_int = ctypes.c_int(0)
5126        val = EXODUS_LIB.ex_inquire(
5127            self.fileId,
5128            inq_id,
5129            ctypes.byref(dummy_int),
5130            ctypes.byref(ret_float),
5131            dummy_char)
5132        if val < 0:
5133            raise Exception(
5134                "ERROR: ex_inquire(" + str(inq_id) + ") failed on " + self.fileName)
5135        return ret_float
5136
5137    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
5138
5139    def __ex_inquire_int(self, inq_id):
5140        val = EXODUS_LIB.ex_inquire_int(self.fileId, inq_id)
5141        if val < 0:
5142            raise Exception(
5143                "ERROR: ex_inquire_int(" + str(inq_id) + ") failed on " + self.fileName)
5144        return val
5145
5146    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
5147
5148    def __ex_get_coord_names(self):
5149        coord_name_ptrs = (
5150            ctypes.POINTER(ctypes.c_char * (MAX_NAME_LENGTH + 1)) * self.numDim.value)()
5151        for i in range(self.numDim.value):
5152            coord_name_ptrs[i] = ctypes.pointer(
5153                ctypes.create_string_buffer(
5154                    MAX_NAME_LENGTH + 1))
5155        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_coord_names(self.fileId, ctypes.byref(coord_name_ptrs))
5156        return [cnp.contents.value.decode('utf8') for cnp in coord_name_ptrs]
5157
5158    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
5159
5160    def __ex_put_coord_names(self, names):
5161        coord_name_ptrs = (
5162            ctypes.POINTER(ctypes.c_char * (MAX_NAME_LENGTH + 1)) * self.numDim.value)()
5163        assert len(names) == self.numDim.value
5164        for i in range(self.numDim.value):
5165            coord_name_ptrs[i] = ctypes.pointer(
5166                ctypes.create_string_buffer(
5167                    names[i].encode('ascii'), MAX_NAME_LENGTH + 1))
5168        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_coord_names(self.fileId, ctypes.byref(coord_name_ptrs))
5169
5170    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
5171
5172    def __ex_get_all_times(self):
5173        self.times = (ctypes.c_double * self.numTimes.value)()
5174        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_all_times(self.fileId, ctypes.byref(self.times))
5175
5176    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
5177
5178    def __ex_get_time(self, timeStep):
5179        time_step = ctypes.c_int(timeStep)
5180        time_val = ctypes.c_double(0.0)
5181        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_time(self.fileId, time_step, ctypes.byref(time_val))
5182        return time_val.value()
5183
5184    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
5185
5186    def __ex_put_time(self, timeStep, timeVal):
5187        time_step = ctypes.c_int(timeStep)
5188        time_val = ctypes.c_double(timeVal)
5189        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_time(self.fileId, time_step, ctypes.byref(time_val))
5190        return True
5191
5192    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
5193
5194    def __ex_get_name(self, objType, objId):
5195        obj_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(objType))
5196        obj_id = ctypes.c_longlong(objId)
5197        obj_name = ctypes.create_string_buffer(MAX_NAME_LENGTH + 1)
5198        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_name(self.fileId, obj_type, obj_id, ctypes.byref(obj_name))
5199        return obj_name.value.decode('utf8')
5200
5201    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
5202
5203    def __ex_put_name(self, objType, objId, objName):
5204        obj_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(objType))
5205        obj_id = ctypes.c_longlong(objId)
5206        obj_name = ctypes.create_string_buffer(objName.encode('ascii'), MAX_NAME_LENGTH + 1)
5207        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_name(self.fileId, obj_type, obj_id, obj_name)
5208
5209    # --------------------------------------------------------------------
5210
5211    def __ex_get_names(self, objType):
5212        inqType = ex_inquiry_map(ex_obj_to_inq(objType))
5213        num_objs = ctypes.c_int(self.__ex_inquire_int(inqType)).value
5214        obj_name_ptrs = (ctypes.POINTER(ctypes.c_char * (MAX_NAME_LENGTH + 1)) * num_objs)()
5215        for i in range(num_objs):
5216            obj_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(objType))
5217            obj_name_ptrs[i] = ctypes.pointer(
5218                ctypes.create_string_buffer(
5219                    MAX_NAME_LENGTH + 1))
5220
5221        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_names(self.fileId, obj_type, ctypes.byref(obj_name_ptrs))
5222        return [onp.contents.value.decode('utf8') for onp in obj_name_ptrs]
5223
5224    def __ex_put_names(self, objType, objNames):
5225        inqType = ex_inquiry_map(ex_obj_to_inq(objType))
5226        numObjs = ctypes.c_int(self.__ex_inquire_int(inqType)).value
5227        assert numObjs == len(objNames)
5228        obj_name_ptrs = (ctypes.POINTER(ctypes.c_char * (MAX_NAME_LENGTH + 1)) * numObjs)()
5229        obj_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(objType))
5230        for i in range(numObjs):
5231            obj_name_ptrs[i] = ctypes.pointer(
5232                ctypes.create_string_buffer(
5233                    objNames[i].encode('ascii'), MAX_NAME_LENGTH + 1))
5234        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_names(self.fileId, obj_type, ctypes.byref(obj_name_ptrs))
5235
5236    def __ex_get_ids(self, objType):
5237        inqType = ex_inquiry_map(ex_obj_to_inq(objType))
5238        numObjs = ctypes.c_int(self.__ex_inquire_int(inqType)).value
5239        if EXODUS_LIB.ex_int64_status(self.fileId) & EX_IDS_INT64_API:
5240            ids = (ctypes.c_longlong * numObjs)()
5241        else:
5242            ids = (ctypes.c_int * numObjs)()
5243        if numObjs > 0:
5244            obj_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(objType))
5245            EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_ids(self.fileId, obj_type, ctypes.byref(ids))
5246        return ids
5247
5248    def __ex_get_assembly(self, assem_struct):
5249        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_assembly(self.fileId, ctypes.byref(assem_struct))
5250        ptr = ctypes.create_string_buffer(MAX_NAME_LENGTH + 1)
5251        assem_struct.name = ctypes.cast(ptr, ctypes.c_char_p)
5252        eptr = (ctypes.c_longlong * assem_struct.entity_count)()
5253        assem_struct.entity_list = eptr
5254        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_assembly(self.fileId, ctypes.byref(assem_struct))
5255
5256    def __ex_get_assemblies(self, assem_list):
5257        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_assemblies(self.fileId, assem_list)
5258        for assem_struct in assem_list:
5259            ptr = ctypes.create_string_buffer(MAX_NAME_LENGTH + 1)
5260            assem_struct.name = ctypes.cast(ptr, ctypes.c_char_p)
5261            eptr = (ctypes.c_longlong * assem_struct.entity_count)()
5262            assem_struct.entity_list = eptr
5263        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_assemblies(self.fileId, assem_list)
5264
5265    def __ex_get_blob(self, blob_struct):
5266        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_blob(self.fileId, ctypes.byref(blob_struct))
5267        ptr = ctypes.create_string_buffer(MAX_NAME_LENGTH + 1)
5268        blob_struct.name = ctypes.cast(ptr, ctypes.c_char_p)
5269        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_blob(self.fileId, ctypes.byref(blob_struct))
5270
5271    def __ex_put_assembly(self, assembly):
5272        assem = setup_ex_assembly(assembly)
5273        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_assembly(self.fileId, assem)
5274
5275    def __ex_put_assemblies(self, assemblies):
5276        assembly_list = []
5277        for assembly in assemblies:
5278            assem = setup_ex_assembly(assembly)
5279            assembly_list.append(assem)
5280        assems = (ex_assembly * len(assemblies))(*assembly_list)
5281
5282        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_assemblies(self.fileId, len(assembly_list), assems)
5283
5284    def __ex_get_attribute_count(self, objType, objId):
5285        # Get attribute count...
5286        obj_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(objType))
5287        obj_id = ctypes.c_longlong(objId)
5288        return EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_attribute_count(self.fileId, obj_type, obj_id)
5289
5290    def __ex_get_attributes(self, objType, objId):
5291        # Get attribute count...
5292        obj_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(objType))
5293        obj_id = ctypes.c_longlong(objId)
5294        att_count = EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_attribute_count(self.fileId, obj_type, obj_id)
5295
5296        attributes = {}
5297        if att_count > 0:
5298            att = (ex_attribute * att_count)()
5299            EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_attribute_param(self.fileId, obj_type, obj_id, ctypes.byref(att))
5300            for i in range(att_count):
5301                EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_attribute(self.fileId, ctypes.byref(att[i]))
5302                tmp_att = attribute(att[i].name.decode('utf8'), att[i].entity_type, att[i].entity_id)
5303
5304                if (att[i].type == 2):
5305                    vals = ctypes.cast(att[i].values, ctypes.POINTER(ctypes.c_char))
5306                    tmp = [vals[j] for j in range(att[i].value_count - 1)]
5307                    tmp_att.values = b''.join(tmp).decode('utf8')
5308
5309                if (att[i].type == 4):
5310                    vals = ctypes.cast(att[i].values, ctypes.POINTER(ctypes.c_int))
5311                    for j in range(att[i].value_count):
5312                        tmp_att.values.append(vals[j])
5313
5314                if (att[i].type == 6):
5315                    vals = ctypes.cast(att[i].values, ctypes.POINTER(ctypes.c_double))
5316                    for j in range(att[i].value_count):
5317                        tmp_att.values.append(vals[j])
5318
5319                attributes[att[i].name.decode('utf8')] = tmp_att
5320
5321        return attributes
5322
5323    def __ex_put_attribute(self, attribute):
5324        att_id = ctypes.c_longlong(attribute.entity_id)
5325        att = ex_attribute(entity_id=att_id)
5326        att.name = attribute.name.encode('ascii')
5327        att.entity_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(attribute.entity_type))
5328        att.value_count = len(attribute.values)
5329
5330        if (isinstance(attribute.values[0], int)):
5331            eptr = (ctypes.c_int * len(attribute.values))()
5332            for i in range(len(attribute.values)):
5333                eptr[i] = ctypes.c_int(attribute.values[i])
5334            att.values = ctypes.cast(eptr, ctypes.c_void_p)
5335            att.type = 4
5336
5337        elif (isinstance(attribute.values[0], float)):
5338            eptr = (ctypes.c_double * len(attribute.values))()
5339            for i in range(len(attribute.values)):
5340                eptr[i] = ctypes.c_double(attribute.values[i])
5341            att.values = ctypes.cast(eptr, ctypes.c_void_p)
5342            att.type = 6
5343
5344        elif (isinstance(attribute.values[0], str)):
5345            eptr = (ctypes.c_char * (len(attribute.values) + 1))()
5346            eptr = attribute.values[0].encode('ascii')
5347            att.values = ctypes.cast(eptr, ctypes.c_void_p)
5348            att.type = 2
5349
5350        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_attribute(self.fileId, att)
5351
5352    def __ex_get_node_set(self, nodeSetId):
5353        node_set_id = ctypes.c_longlong(nodeSetId)
5354        num_node_set_nodes = self.__ex_get_set_param('EX_NODE_SET', nodeSetId)[0]
5355        if num_node_set_nodes == 0:
5356            return []
5357        if EXODUS_LIB.ex_int64_status(self.fileId) & EX_BULK_INT64_API:
5358            set_nodes = (ctypes.c_longlong * num_node_set_nodes)()
5359        else:
5360            set_nodes = (ctypes.c_int * num_node_set_nodes)()
5361        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_set(self.fileId, ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type('EX_NODE_SET')), node_set_id, ctypes.byref(set_nodes), None)
5362        return set_nodes
5363
5364    def __ex_put_node_set(self, nodeSetId, nodeSetNodes):
5365        node_set_id = ctypes.c_longlong(nodeSetId)
5366        if EXODUS_LIB.ex_int64_status(self.fileId) & EX_BULK_INT64_API:
5367            node_set_nodes = (ctypes.c_longlong * len(nodeSetNodes))()
5368            for i, node_set_node in enumerate(nodeSetNodes):
5369                node_set_nodes[i] = ctypes.c_longlong(node_set_node)
5370        else:
5371            node_set_nodes = (ctypes.c_int * len(nodeSetNodes))()
5372            for i, node_set_node in enumerate(nodeSetNodes):
5373                node_set_nodes[i] = ctypes.c_int(node_set_node)
5374        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_set(self.fileId, ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type('EX_NODE_SET')), node_set_id, node_set_nodes, None)
5375
5376    def __ex_get_node_set_dist_fact(self, nodeSetId):
5377        node_set_id = ctypes.c_longlong(nodeSetId)
5378        num_node_set_nodes = self.__ex_get_set_param('EX_NODE_SET', nodeSetId)[0]
5379        set_dfs = (ctypes.c_double * num_node_set_nodes)()
5380        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_node_set_dist_fact(
5381            self.fileId, node_set_id, ctypes.byref(set_dfs))
5382        return set_dfs
5383
5384    def __ex_put_node_set_dist_fact(self, nodeSetId, nodeSetDistFact):
5385        node_set_id = ctypes.c_longlong(nodeSetId)
5386        node_set_dist_fact = (ctypes.c_double * len(nodeSetDistFact))()
5387        for i, dist_fact in enumerate(nodeSetDistFact):
5388            node_set_dist_fact[i] = ctypes.c_double(dist_fact)
5389        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_node_set_dist_fact(
5390            self.fileId, node_set_id, node_set_dist_fact)
5391
5392    def __ex_get_object_truth_vector(self, objType, entId):
5393        obj_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(objType))
5394        entity_id = ctypes.c_longlong(entId)
5395        variable_count = self.__ex_get_variable_param(objType)
5396        truth_table = (ctypes.c_int * (variable_count.value))()
5397
5398        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_object_truth_vector(self.fileId, obj_type,
5399                                              entity_id, variable_count,
5400                                              ctypes.byref(truth_table))
5401        truthTab = []
5402        for val in truth_table:
5403            if val:
5404                truthTab.append(True)
5405            else:
5406                truthTab.append(False)
5407        return truthTab
5408
5409    def __ex_get_truth_table(self, objType):
5410        inqType = ex_inquiry_map(ex_obj_to_inq(objType))
5411        num_objs = ctypes.c_int(self.__ex_inquire_int(inqType)).value
5412
5413        obj_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(objType))
5414        variable_count = self.__ex_get_variable_param(objType)
5415
5416        truth_table = (ctypes.c_int * (num_objs * variable_count.value))()
5417        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_truth_table(self.fileId, obj_type,
5418                                      num_objs, variable_count,
5419                                      ctypes.byref(truth_table))
5420        truthTab = []
5421        for val in truth_table:
5422            if val:
5423                truthTab.append(True)
5424            else:
5425                truthTab.append(False)
5426        return truthTab
5427
5428    def __ex_put_truth_table(self, objType, truthTab):
5429        inqType = ex_inquiry_map(ex_obj_to_inq(objType))
5430        num_objs = ctypes.c_int(self.__ex_inquire_int(inqType)).value
5431
5432        obj_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(objType))
5433        num_vars = self.__ex_get_variable_param(objType).value
5434
5435        assert len(truthTab) == (num_objs * num_vars)
5436
5437        truth_tab = (ctypes.c_int * (num_objs * num_vars))()
5438        for i, boolVal in enumerate(truthTab):
5439            truth_tab[i] = ctypes.c_int(1) if boolVal else ctypes.c_int(0)
5440        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_truth_table(
5441            self.fileId, obj_type, num_objs, num_vars, truth_tab)
5442        return True
5443
5444    def __ex_get_coord(self):
5445        self.coordsX = (ctypes.c_double * self.numNodes.value)()
5446        self.coordsY = (ctypes.c_double * self.numNodes.value)()
5447        self.coordsZ = (ctypes.c_double * self.numNodes.value)()
5448        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_coord(
5449            self.fileId,
5450            ctypes.byref(self.coordsX),
5451            ctypes.byref(self.coordsY),
5452            ctypes.byref(self.coordsZ))
5453
5454    def __ex_put_coord(self, xCoords, yCoords, zCoords):
5455        self.coordsX = (ctypes.c_double * self.numNodes.value)()
5456        self.coordsY = (ctypes.c_double * self.numNodes.value)()
5457        self.coordsZ = (ctypes.c_double * self.numNodes.value)()
5458        for i in range(self.numNodes.value):
5459            self.coordsX[i] = float(xCoords[i])
5460            self.coordsY[i] = float(yCoords[i])
5461            self.coordsZ[i] = float(zCoords[i])
5462        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_coord(
5463            self.fileId,
