5464            ctypes.byref(self.coordsX),
5465            ctypes.byref(self.coordsY),
5466            ctypes.byref(self.coordsZ))
5467
5468    def __ex_get_partial_coord(self, startNodeId, numNodes):
5469        start_node_num = ctypes.c_longlong(startNodeId)
5470        num_nodes = ctypes.c_longlong(numNodes)
5471        coordsX = (ctypes.c_double * numNodes)()
5472        coordsY = (ctypes.c_double * numNodes)()
5473        coordsZ = (ctypes.c_double * numNodes)()
5474        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_partial_coord(
5475            self.fileId,
5476            start_node_num,
5477            num_nodes,
5478            ctypes.byref(coordsX),
5479            ctypes.byref(coordsY),
5480            ctypes.byref(coordsZ))
5481        return list(coordsX), list(coordsY), list(coordsZ)
5482
5483    def __ex_get_id_map(self, objType):
5484        inqType = ex_obj_to_inq(objType)
5485        obj_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(objType))
5486        inq_type = ctypes.c_int(ex_inquiry_map(inqType))
5487        num_objs = ctypes.c_int(self.__ex_inquire_int(inq_type))
5488        numObjs = num_objs.value
5489        if EXODUS_LIB.ex_int64_status(self.fileId) & EX_IDS_INT64_API:
5490            id_map = (ctypes.c_longlong * numObjs)()
5491        else:
5492            id_map = (ctypes.c_int * numObjs)()
5493        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_id_map(self.fileId, obj_type, ctypes.byref(id_map))
5494        idMap = [id_map[i] for i in range(numObjs)]
5495        if self.use_numpy:
5496            idMap = self.np.array(idMap)
5497        return idMap
5498
5499    def __ex_get_num_map(self, objType, idx):
5500        inqType = ex_obj_to_inq(objType)
5501        map_id = ctypes.c_longlong(idx)
5502        obj_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(objType))
5503        inq_type = ctypes.c_int(ex_inquiry_map(inqType))
5504        num_objs = ctypes.c_int(self.__ex_inquire_int(inq_type))
5505        numObjs = num_objs.value
5506        if EXODUS_LIB.ex_int64_status(self.fileId) & EX_IDS_INT64_API:
5507            id_map = (ctypes.c_longlong * numObjs)()
5508        else:
5509            id_map = (ctypes.c_int * numObjs)()
5510        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_num_map(self.fileId, obj_type, map_id, ctypes.byref(id_map))
5511        idMap = [id_map[i] for i in range(numObjs)]
5512        if self.use_numpy:
5513            idMap = self.np.array(idMap)
5514        return idMap
5515
5516    def __ex_put_map_param(self, nodeMapCnt, elemMapCnt):
5517        node_map_cnt = ctypes.c_int(nodeMapCnt)
5518        elem_map_cnt = ctypes.c_int(elemMapCnt)
5519        errorInt = EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_map_param(
5520            self.fileId, node_map_cnt, elem_map_cnt)
5521        if errorInt != 0:
5522            print(("ERROR code =", errorInt))
5523            raise Exception(
5524                "ERROR: ex_put_map_param had problems.")
5525        return True
5526
5527    def __ex_put_num_map(self, objType, idx, numMap):
5528        inqType = ex_obj_to_inq(objType)
5529        map_id = ctypes.c_longlong(idx)
5530        obj_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(objType))
5531        inq_type = ctypes.c_int(ex_inquiry_map(inqType))
5532        num_objs = ctypes.c_int(self.__ex_inquire_int(inq_type))
5533        numObjs = num_objs.value
5534        assert numObjs == len(numMap)
5535        if EXODUS_LIB.ex_int64_status(self.fileId) & EX_IDS_INT64_API:
5536            num_map = (ctypes.c_longlong * numObjs)()
5537            for i in range(numObjs):
5538                num_map[i] = ctypes.c_longlong(numMap[i])
5539        else:
5540            num_map = (ctypes.c_int * numObjs)()
5541            for i in range(numObjs):
5542                num_map[i] = ctypes.c_int(numMap[i])
5543        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_num_map(self.fileId, obj_type, map_id, ctypes.byref(num_map))
5544        return True
5545
5546    def __ex_get_block_id_map(self, obj_type, id):
5547        obj_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(obj_type))
5548        entity_id = ctypes.c_longlong(id)
5549        _, numObjs, _, _ = self.__ex_get_block('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', id)
5550        if EXODUS_LIB.ex_int64_status(self.fileId) & EX_IDS_INT64_API:
5551            id_map = (ctypes.c_longlong * numObjs)()
5552        else:
5553            id_map = (ctypes.c_int * numObjs)()
5554        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_block_id_map(self.fileId, obj_type, entity_id, id_map)
5555        if self.use_numpy:
5556            id_map = ctype_to_numpy(self, id_map)
5557            return id_map
5558        else:
5559            idMap = [id_map[i] for i in range(numObjs)]
5560            return idMap
5561
5562    def __ex_put_id_map(self, objType, idMap):
5563        inqType = ex_obj_to_inq(objType)
5564        obj_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(objType))
5565        inq_type = ctypes.c_int(ex_inquiry_map(inqType))
5566        num_objs = ctypes.c_int(self.__ex_inquire_int(inq_type))
5567        numObjs = num_objs.value
5568        assert numObjs == len(idMap)
5569        if EXODUS_LIB.ex_int64_status(self.fileId) & EX_IDS_INT64_API:
5570            id_map = (ctypes.c_longlong * numObjs)()
5571            for i in range(numObjs):
5572                id_map[i] = ctypes.c_longlong(idMap[i])
5573        else:
5574            id_map = (ctypes.c_int * numObjs)()
5575            for i in range(numObjs):
5576                id_map[i] = ctypes.c_int(idMap[i])
5577        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_id_map(self.fileId, obj_type, ctypes.byref(id_map))
5578        return True
5579
5580    def __ex_get_elem_num_map(self):
5581        if EXODUS_LIB.ex_int64_status(self.fileId) & EX_MAPS_INT64_API:
5582            elemNumMap = (ctypes.c_longlong * self.numElem.value)()
5583        else:
5584            elemNumMap = (ctypes.c_int * self.numElem.value)()
5585        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_elem_num_map(self.fileId, ctypes.byref(elemNumMap))
5586        return elemNumMap
5587
5588    def __ex_get_node_num_map(self):
5589        if EXODUS_LIB.ex_int64_status(self.fileId) & EX_MAPS_INT64_API:
5590            nodeNumMap = (ctypes.c_longlong * self.numNodes.value)()
5591        else:
5592            nodeNumMap = (ctypes.c_int * self.numNodes.value)()
5593        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_node_num_map(self.fileId, ctypes.byref(nodeNumMap))
5594        return nodeNumMap
5595
5596    def __ex_get_elem_order_map(self):
5597        if EXODUS_LIB.ex_int64_status(self.fileId) & EX_MAPS_INT64_API:
5598            elemOrderMap = (ctypes.c_longlong * self.numElem.value)()
5599        else:
5600            elemOrderMap = (ctypes.c_int * self.numElem.value)()
5601        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_map(self.fileId, ctypes.byref(elemOrderMap))
5602        return elemOrderMap
5603
5604    def __ex_get_block(self, object_type, object_id):
5605        obj_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(object_type))
5606        block_id = ctypes.c_longlong(object_id)
5607        blk_type = ctypes.create_string_buffer(MAX_STR_LENGTH + 1)
5608        if EXODUS_LIB.ex_int64_status(self.fileId) & EX_BULK_INT64_API:
5609            num_elem_this_blk = ctypes.c_longlong(0)
5610            num_nodes_per_elem = ctypes.c_longlong(0)
5611            num_edges_per_elem = ctypes.c_longlong(0)
5612            num_faces_per_elem = ctypes.c_longlong(0)
5613            num_attr = ctypes.c_longlong(0)
5614        else:
5615            num_elem_this_blk = ctypes.c_int(0)
5616            num_nodes_per_elem = ctypes.c_int(0)
5617            num_edges_per_elem = ctypes.c_int(0)
5618            num_faces_per_elem = ctypes.c_int(0)
5619            num_attr = ctypes.c_int(0)
5620        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_block(
5621            self.fileId,
5622            obj_type,
5623            block_id,
5624            blk_type,
5625            ctypes.byref(num_elem_this_blk),
5626            ctypes.byref(num_nodes_per_elem),
5627            ctypes.byref(num_edges_per_elem),
5628            ctypes.byref(num_faces_per_elem),
5629            ctypes.byref(num_attr))
5630        return blk_type.value, int(num_elem_this_blk.value), int(num_nodes_per_elem.value), int(num_attr.value)
5631
5632    def __ex_put_block(
5633            self,
5634            object_type,
5635            object_id,
5636            eType,
5637            numElems,
5638            numNodesPerElem,
5639            numAttrsPerElem):
5640        obj_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(object_type))
5641        block_id = ctypes.c_longlong(object_id)
5642        if type(eType) == str:
5643            eType = eType.encode('ascii')
5644        elem_type = ctypes.create_string_buffer(eType.upper(), MAX_NAME_LENGTH + 1)
5645        num_elem_this_blk = ctypes.c_longlong(numElems)
5646        num_nodes_per_elem = ctypes.c_longlong(numNodesPerElem)
5647        num_edges_per_elem = ctypes.c_longlong(0)
5648        num_faces_per_elem = ctypes.c_longlong(0)
5649        num_attr = ctypes.c_longlong(numAttrsPerElem)
5650        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_block(self.fileId, obj_type, block_id, elem_type,
5651                                num_elem_this_blk, num_nodes_per_elem,
5652                                num_edges_per_elem, num_faces_per_elem, num_attr)
5653
5654    def __ex_get_elem_conn(self, object_id):
5655        (_elem_type, num_elem_this_blk, num_nodes_per_elem,
5656         _num_attr) = self.__ex_get_block('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', object_id)
5657        elem_block_id = ctypes.c_longlong(object_id)
5658        if EXODUS_LIB.ex_int64_status(self.fileId) & EX_BULK_INT64_API:
5659            elem_block_connectivity = (
5660                ctypes.c_longlong * (num_elem_this_blk * num_nodes_per_elem))()
5661        else:
5662            elem_block_connectivity = (
5663                ctypes.c_int * (num_elem_this_blk * num_nodes_per_elem))()
5664        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_conn(
5665            self.fileId,
5666            ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type('EX_ELEM_BLOCK')),
5667            elem_block_id,
5668            ctypes.byref(elem_block_connectivity), None, None)
5669        return elem_block_connectivity, num_elem_this_blk, num_nodes_per_elem
5670
5671    def __ex_put_elem_conn(self, object_id, connectivity):
5672        (_elem_type, num_elem_this_blk, num_nodes_per_elem,
5673         _num_attr) = self.__ex_get_block('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', object_id)
5674        elem_block_id = ctypes.c_longlong(object_id)
5675        if EXODUS_LIB.ex_int64_status(self.fileId) & EX_BULK_INT64_API:
5676            elem_block_connectivity = (
5677                ctypes.c_longlong * (num_elem_this_blk * num_nodes_per_elem))()
5678            for i in range(num_elem_this_blk * num_nodes_per_elem):
5679                elem_block_connectivity[i] = ctypes.c_longlong(connectivity[i])
5680        else:
5681            elem_block_connectivity = (
5682                ctypes.c_int * (num_elem_this_blk * num_nodes_per_elem))()
5683            for i in range(num_elem_this_blk * num_nodes_per_elem):
5684                elem_block_connectivity[i] = ctypes.c_int(connectivity[i])
5685        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_conn(
5686            self.fileId,
5687            ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type('EX_ELEM_BLOCK')),
5688            elem_block_id,
5689            elem_block_connectivity, None, None)
5690
5691    def __ex_put_one_attr(self, objType, elemBlkID, attrIndx, Attr):
5692        elem_blk_id = ctypes.c_longlong(elemBlkID)
5693        obj_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(objType))
5694        attr_index = ctypes.c_longlong(attrIndx)
5695        attrib = (ctypes.c_double * len(Attr))()
5696        for i, attr in enumerate(Attr):
5697            attrib[i] = float(attr)
5698        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_one_attr(
5699            self.fileId,
5700            obj_type,
5701            elem_blk_id,
5702            attr_index,
5703            attrib)
5704
5705    def __ex_get_one_attr(self, objType, entityId, attrIndx):
5706        entity_id = ctypes.c_longlong(entityId)
5707        obj_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(objType))
5708        attr_index = ctypes.c_longlong(attrIndx)
5709
5710        numVals = self.get_entity_count(objType, entityId)
5711        attrib = (ctypes.c_double * numVals)()
5712
5713        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_one_attr(
5714            self.fileId,
5715            obj_type,
5716            entity_id,
5717            attr_index,
5718            ctypes.byref(attrib))
5719        return attrib
5720
5721    def __ex_put_elem_attr(self, elemBlkID, Attr):
5722        elem_blk_id = ctypes.c_longlong(elemBlkID)
5723        attrib = (ctypes.c_double * len(Attr))()
5724        for i, attr in enumerate(Attr):
5725            attrib[i] = ctypes.c_double(attr)
5726        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_attr(
5727            self.fileId,
5728            ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type('EX_ELEM_BLOCK')),
5729            elem_blk_id,
5730            attrib)
5731
5732    def __ex_get_elem_attr(self, elemBlkID):
5733        elem_blk_id = ctypes.c_longlong(elemBlkID)
5734        numAttrThisBlk = self.num_attr(elemBlkID)
5735        numElemsThisBlk = self.get_entity_count('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', elemBlkID)
5736        totalAttr = numAttrThisBlk * numElemsThisBlk
5737        attrib = (ctypes.c_double * totalAttr)()
5738        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_attr(
5739            self.fileId,
5740            ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type('EX_ELEM_BLOCK')),
5741            elem_blk_id,
5742            ctypes.byref(attrib))
5743        return attrib
5744
5745    def __ex_get_variable_param(self, varType):
5746        var_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(varType))
5747        num_vars = ctypes.c_int()
5748        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_variable_param(
5749            self.fileId, var_type, ctypes.byref(num_vars))
5750        return num_vars
5751
5752    def __ex_get_variable_names(self, varType):
5753        num_vars = self.__ex_get_variable_param(varType)
5754        var_name_ptrs = (
5755            ctypes.POINTER(ctypes.c_char * (MAX_NAME_LENGTH + 1)) * num_vars.value)()
5756
5757        for i in range(num_vars.value):
5758            var_name_ptrs[i] = ctypes.pointer(
5759                ctypes.create_string_buffer(
5760                    MAX_NAME_LENGTH + 1))
5761
5762        var_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(varType))
5763        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_variable_names(
5764            self.fileId,
5765            var_type,
5766            num_vars,
5767            ctypes.byref(var_name_ptrs))
5768        return [vnp.contents.value.decode('utf8') for vnp in var_name_ptrs]
5769
5770    def __ex_get_var(self, timeStep, varType, varId, blkId, numValues):
5771        step = ctypes.c_int(timeStep)
5772        var_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(varType))
5773        var_id = ctypes.c_int(varId)
5774        block_id = ctypes.c_longlong(blkId)
5775        num_values = ctypes.c_longlong(numValues)
5776        var_vals = (ctypes.c_double * num_values.value)()
5777        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_var(
5778            self.fileId,
5779            step,
5780            var_type,
5781            var_id,
5782            block_id,
5783            num_values,
5784            var_vals)
5785        return var_vals
5786
5787    def __ex_get_partial_var(self, timeStep, varType, varId, blkId, startIndex, numValues):
5788        step = ctypes.c_int(timeStep)
5789        var_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(varType))
5790        var_id = ctypes.c_int(varId)
5791        block_id = ctypes.c_longlong(blkId)
5792        start_index = ctypes.c_longlong(startIndex)
5793        num_values = ctypes.c_longlong(numValues)
5794        var_vals = (ctypes.c_double * num_values.value)()
5795        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_partial_var(
5796            self.fileId,
5797            step,
5798            var_type,
5799            var_id,
5800            block_id,
5801            start_index,
5802            num_values,
5803            var_vals)
5804        return var_vals
5805
5806    def __ex_put_var(self, timeStep, varType, varId, blkId, numValues, values):
5807        step = ctypes.c_int(timeStep)
5808        var_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(varType))
5809        var_id = ctypes.c_int(varId)
5810        block_id = ctypes.c_longlong(blkId)
5811        num_values = ctypes.c_longlong(numValues)
5812        var_vals = (ctypes.c_double * num_values.value)()
5813        for i in range(num_values.value):
5814            var_vals[i] = float(values[i])
5815        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_var(
5816            self.fileId,
5817            step,
5818            var_type,
5819            var_id,
5820            block_id,
5821            num_values,
5822            var_vals)
5823        return True
5824
5825    def __ex_put_reduction_variable_param(self, varType, numVars):
5826        num_vars = ctypes.c_int(numVars)
5827        current_num = self.__ex_get_reduction_variable_param(varType)
5828        if current_num.value == num_vars.value:
5829            # print "value already set"
5830            return True
5831
5832        var_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(varType))
5833        errorInt = EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_reduction_variable_param(
5834            self.fileId, var_type, num_vars)
5835        if errorInt != 0:
5836            print(("ERROR code =", errorInt))
5837            raise Exception(
5838                "ERROR: ex_put_reduction_variable_param had problems."
5839                " This can only be called once per varType.")
5840        return True
5841
5842    def __ex_get_reduction_variable_param(self, varType):
5843        var_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(varType))
5844        num_vars = ctypes.c_int()
5845        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_reduction_variable_param(
5846            self.fileId, var_type, ctypes.byref(num_vars))
5847        return num_vars
5848
5849    def __ex_get_reduction_variable_name(self, varType, varId):
5850        var_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(varType))
5851        var_id = ctypes.c_int(varId)
5852        name = ctypes.create_string_buffer(MAX_NAME_LENGTH + 1)
5853        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_reduction_variable_name(self.fileId, var_type, var_id, name)
5854        return name.value.decode("utf8")
5855
5856    def __ex_put_reduction_variable_name(self, varType, varId, varName):
5857        var_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(varType))
5858        var_id = ctypes.c_int(varId)
5859        name = ctypes.create_string_buffer(varName.encode('ascii'), MAX_NAME_LENGTH + 1)
5860        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_reduction_variable_name(self.fileId, var_type, var_id, name)
5861        return True
5862
5863    def __ex_get_reduction_variable_names(self, varType):
5864        num_vars = self.__ex_get_reduction_variable_param(varType)
5865        var_name_ptrs = (
5866            ctypes.POINTER(ctypes.c_char * (MAX_NAME_LENGTH + 1)) * num_vars.value)()
5867
5868        for i in range(num_vars.value):
5869            var_name_ptrs[i] = ctypes.pointer(
5870                ctypes.create_string_buffer(
5871                    MAX_NAME_LENGTH + 1))
5872
5873        var_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(varType))
5874        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_reduction_variable_names(
5875            self.fileId,
5876            var_type,
5877            num_vars,
5878            ctypes.byref(var_name_ptrs))
5879        return [vnp.contents.value.decode('utf8') for vnp in var_name_ptrs]
5880
5881    def __ex_get_reduction_vars(self, timeStep, varType, blkId, numValues):
5882        step = ctypes.c_int(timeStep)
5883        var_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(varType))
5884        block_id = ctypes.c_longlong(blkId)
5885        num_values = ctypes.c_longlong(numValues)
5886        var_vals = (ctypes.c_double * num_values.value)()
5887        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_reduction_vars(
5888            self.fileId,
5889            step,
5890            var_type,
5891            block_id,
5892            num_values,
5893            var_vals)
5894        return var_vals
5895
5896    def __ex_put_reduction_vars(self, timeStep, varType, blkId, numValues, values):
5897        step = ctypes.c_int(timeStep)
5898        var_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(varType))
5899        block_id = ctypes.c_longlong(blkId)
5900        num_values = ctypes.c_longlong(numValues)
5901        var_vals = (ctypes.c_double * num_values.value)()
5902        for i in range(num_values.value):
5903            var_vals[i] = float(values[i])
5904        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_reduction_vars(
5905            self.fileId,
5906            step,
5907            var_type,
5908            block_id,
5909            num_values,
5910            var_vals)
5911        return True
5912
5913    def __ex_get_side_set_node_list_len(self, object_id):
5914        side_set_id = ctypes.c_longlong(object_id)
5915        if EXODUS_LIB.ex_int64_status(self.fileId) & EX_BULK_INT64_API:
5916            side_set_node_list_len = ctypes.c_longlong(0)
5917        else:
5918            side_set_node_list_len = ctypes.c_int(0)
5919        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_side_set_node_list_len(
5920            self.fileId, side_set_id, ctypes.byref(side_set_node_list_len))
5921        return side_set_node_list_len
5922
5923    def __ex_get_set_param(self, objType, object_id):
5924        object_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(objType))
5925        side_set_id = ctypes.c_longlong(object_id)
5926        if EXODUS_LIB.ex_int64_status(self.fileId) & EX_BULK_INT64_API:
5927            num_side_in_set = ctypes.c_longlong(0)
5928            num_dist_fact_in_set = ctypes.c_longlong(0)
5929        else:
5930            num_side_in_set = ctypes.c_int(0)
5931            num_dist_fact_in_set = ctypes.c_int(0)
5932        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_set_param(
5933            self.fileId,
5934            object_type,
5935            side_set_id,
5936            ctypes.byref(num_side_in_set),
5937            ctypes.byref(num_dist_fact_in_set))
5938        return int(num_side_in_set.value), int(num_dist_fact_in_set.value)
5939
5940    def __ex_put_set_param(self, objType, object_id, numSides, numDistFacts):
5941        object_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(objType))
5942        side_set_id = ctypes.c_longlong(object_id)
5943        num_side_in_set = ctypes.c_longlong(numSides)
5944        num_dist_fact_in_set = ctypes.c_longlong(numDistFacts)
5945        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_set_param(
5946            self.fileId,
5947            object_type,
5948            side_set_id,
5949            num_side_in_set,
5950            num_dist_fact_in_set)
5951        return True
5952
5953    def __ex_get_side_set(self, sideSetId):
5954        side_set_id = ctypes.c_longlong(sideSetId)
5955        (num_side_in_set, _num_dist_fact_in_set) = self.__ex_get_set_param('EX_SIDE_SET', sideSetId)
5956        if num_side_in_set == 0:
5957            return [], []
5958        if EXODUS_LIB.ex_int64_status(self.fileId) & EX_BULK_INT64_API:
5959            side_set_elem_list = (ctypes.c_longlong * num_side_in_set)()
5960            side_set_side_list = (ctypes.c_longlong * num_side_in_set)()
5961        else:
5962            side_set_elem_list = (ctypes.c_int * num_side_in_set)()
5963            side_set_side_list = (ctypes.c_int * num_side_in_set)()
5964        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_set(
5965            self.fileId,
5966            ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type('EX_SIDE_SET')),
5967            side_set_id,
5968            ctypes.byref(side_set_elem_list),
5969            ctypes.byref(side_set_side_list))
5970        return side_set_elem_list, side_set_side_list
5971
5972    def __ex_put_side_set(self, object_id, sideSetElements, sideSetSides):
5973        side_set_id = ctypes.c_longlong(object_id)
5974        if EXODUS_LIB.ex_int64_status(self.fileId) & EX_BULK_INT64_API:
5975            side_set_elem_list = (ctypes.c_longlong * len(sideSetElements))()
5976            side_set_side_list = (ctypes.c_longlong * len(sideSetSides))()
5977            for i, sse in enumerate(sideSetElements):
5978                side_set_elem_list[i] = ctypes.c_longlong(sse)
5979                side_set_side_list[i] = ctypes.c_longlong(sideSetSides[i])
5980        else:
5981            side_set_elem_list = (ctypes.c_int * len(sideSetElements))()
5982            side_set_side_list = (ctypes.c_int * len(sideSetSides))()
5983            for i, sse in enumerate(sideSetElements):
5984                side_set_elem_list[i] = ctypes.c_int(sse)
5985                side_set_side_list[i] = ctypes.c_int(sideSetSides[i])
5986        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_set(
5987            self.fileId,
5988            ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type('EX_SIDE_SET')),
5989            side_set_id,
5990            side_set_elem_list,
5991            side_set_side_list)
5992        return True
5993
5994    def __ex_get_side_set_dist_fact(self, sideSetId):
5995        side_set_id = ctypes.c_longlong(sideSetId)
5996        side_set_node_list_len = self.__ex_get_side_set_node_list_len(
5997            sideSetId)
5998        set_dfs = (ctypes.c_double * side_set_node_list_len.value)()
5999        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_side_set_dist_fact(
6000            self.fileId, side_set_id, ctypes.byref(set_dfs))
6001        return set_dfs
6002
6003    def __ex_put_side_set_dist_fact(self, sideSetId, sideSetDistFact):
6004        side_set_id = ctypes.c_longlong(sideSetId)
6005        side_set_dist_fact = (ctypes.c_double * len(sideSetDistFact))()
6006        for i, df in enumerate(sideSetDistFact):
6007            side_set_dist_fact[i] = ctypes.c_double(df)
6008        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_side_set_dist_fact(
6009            self.fileId, side_set_id, side_set_dist_fact)
6010
6011    def __ex_get_side_set_node_list(self, object_id):
6012        side_set_id = ctypes.c_longlong(object_id)
6013        side_set_node_list_len = self.__ex_get_side_set_node_list_len(object_id)
6014        (num_side_in_set, _num_dist_fact_in_set) = self.__ex_get_set_param('EX_SIDE_SET', object_id)
6015        if EXODUS_LIB.ex_int64_status(self.fileId) & EX_BULK_INT64_API:
6016            side_set_node_cnt_list = (ctypes.c_longlong * num_side_in_set)()
6017            side_set_node_list = (ctypes.c_longlong * side_set_node_list_len.value)()
6018        else:
6019            side_set_node_cnt_list = (ctypes.c_int * num_side_in_set)()
6020            side_set_node_list = (ctypes.c_int * side_set_node_list_len.value)()
6021        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_side_set_node_list(self.fileId, side_set_id,
6022                                             ctypes.byref(side_set_node_cnt_list),
6023                                             ctypes.byref(side_set_node_list))
6024        return side_set_node_cnt_list, side_set_node_list
6025
6026    def __ex_put_variable_param(self, varType, numVars):
6027        num_vars = ctypes.c_int(numVars)
6028        current_num = self.__ex_get_variable_param(varType)
6029        if current_num.value == num_vars.value:
6030            # print "value already set"
6031            return True
6032
6033        var_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(varType))
6034        errorInt = EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_variable_param(
6035            self.fileId, var_type, num_vars)
6036        if errorInt != 0:
6037            print(("ERROR code =", errorInt))
6038            raise Exception(
6039                "ERROR: ex_put_variable_param had problems."
6040                " This can only be called once per varType.")
6041        return True
6042
6043    def __ex_get_variable_name(self, varType, varId):
6044        var_type = ctypes.c_int(varType)
6045        var_id = ctypes.c_int(varId)
6046        name = ctypes.create_string_buffer(MAX_NAME_LENGTH + 1)
6047        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_variable_name(self.fileId, var_type, var_id, name)
6048        return name.decode('utf8')
6049
6050    def __ex_put_variable_name(self, varType, varId, varName):
6051        var_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(varType))
6052        var_id = ctypes.c_int(varId)
6053        name = ctypes.create_string_buffer(varName.encode('ascii'), MAX_NAME_LENGTH + 1)
6054        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_variable_name(self.fileId, var_type, var_id, name)
6055        return True
6056
6057    def __ex_get_attr_names(self, objType, blkId):
6058        obj_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(objType))
6059        object_id = ctypes.c_longlong(blkId)
6060        num_attr = ctypes.c_int(self.num_attr(blkId))
6061        len_name = self.__ex_inquire_int(ex_inquiry_map('EX_INQ_MAX_READ_NAME_LENGTH'))
6062        attr_name_ptrs = (ctypes.POINTER(ctypes.c_char * (len_name + 1)) * num_attr.value)()
6063        for i in range(num_attr.value):
6064            attr_name_ptrs[i] = ctypes.pointer(ctypes.create_string_buffer(len_name + 1))
6065        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_attr_names(
6066            self.fileId, obj_type, object_id, ctypes.byref(attr_name_ptrs))
6067        return [cnp.contents.value.decode('utf8') for cnp in attr_name_ptrs]
6068
6069    def __ex_put_attr_names(self, objType, blkId, varNames):
6070        obj_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(objType))
6071        object_id = ctypes.c_int(blkId)
6072        num_attr = ctypes.c_int(self.num_attr(blkId))
6073        len_name = self.__ex_inquire_int(ex_inquiry_map('EX_INQ_MAX_READ_NAME_LENGTH'))
6074        attr_name_ptrs = (ctypes.POINTER(ctypes.c_char * (len_name + 1)) * num_attr.value)()
6075        assert len(varNames) == num_attr.value
6076        for i in range(num_attr.value):
6077            attr_name_ptrs[i] = ctypes.pointer(
6078                ctypes.create_string_buffer(
6079                    varNames[i].encode('ascii'), len_name + 1))
6080        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_attr_names(
6081            self.fileId, obj_type, object_id, ctypes.byref(attr_name_ptrs))
6082        return True
6083
6084    def __ex_get_prop_names(self, varType, inqType):
6085        var_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(varType))
6086        num_props = ctypes.c_int(self.__ex_inquire_int(ex_inquiry_map(inqType)))
6087        prop_name_ptrs = (
6088            ctypes.POINTER(ctypes.c_char * (MAX_STR_LENGTH + 1)) * num_props.value)()
6089        for i in range(num_props.value):
6090            prop_name_ptrs[i] = ctypes.pointer(
6091                ctypes.create_string_buffer(
6092                    MAX_STR_LENGTH + 1))
6093        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_prop_names(
6094            self.fileId, var_type, ctypes.byref(prop_name_ptrs))
6095        return [cnp.contents.value.decode('utf8') for cnp in prop_name_ptrs]
6096
6097    def __ex_get_prop(self, objType, objId, propName):
6098        obj_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(objType))
6099        obj_id = ctypes.c_longlong(objId)
6100        prop_name = ctypes.create_string_buffer(propName.encode('ascii'), MAX_STR_LENGTH + 1)
6101        if EXODUS_LIB.ex_int64_status(self.fileId) & EX_IDS_INT64_API:
6102            prop_val = ctypes.c_longlong(0)
6103        else:
6104            prop_val = ctypes.c_int(0)
6105        EXODUS_LIB.ex_get_prop(
6106            self.fileId,
6107            obj_type,
6108            obj_id,
6109            ctypes.byref(prop_name),
6110            ctypes.byref(prop_val))
6111        return prop_val.value
6112
6113    def __ex_put_prop(self, objType, objId, propName, propVal):
6114        obj_type = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type(objType))
6115        obj_id = ctypes.c_longlong(objId)
6116        prop_name = ctypes.create_string_buffer(propName.encode('ascii'), MAX_STR_LENGTH + 1)
6117        prop_val = ctypes.c_longlong(propVal)
6118        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_prop(
6119            self.fileId,
6120            obj_type,
6121            obj_id,
6122            ctypes.byref(prop_name),
6123            prop_val)
6124        return True
6125
6126    def __ex_update(self):
6127        EXODUS_LIB.ex_update(self.fileId)
6128        return True

The exodus model abstraction

exodus( file, mode=None, array_type='ctype', title=None, numDims=None, numNodes=None, numElems=None, numBlocks=None, numNodeSets=None, numSideSets=None, numAssembly=None, numBlob=None, init_params=None, io_size=0) 
625    def __init__(self, file, mode=None, array_type='ctype', title=None,
626                 numDims=None, numNodes=None, numElems=None, numBlocks=None,
627                 numNodeSets=None, numSideSets=None, numAssembly=None,
628                 numBlob=None, init_params=None, io_size=0):
629        """
630        Open exodus database for data insertion/extraction.
631
632        Parameters
633        ----------
634        file_name : string
635           name of exodus file to open
636        mode : string
637          'r' for read, 'a' for append, 'w' for write, 'w+' for write+clobber existing file
638        title : string
639           database title
640        array_type : string
641           'ctype' for c-type arrays, 'numpy' for numpy arrays
642        num_dims : int
643           number of model dimensions ('w'/'w+' mode only)
644        num_nodes : int
645           number of model nodes ('w'/'w+' mode only)
646        num_elems : int
647           number of model elements ('w'/'w+' mode only)
648        num_blocks : int
649           number of model element blocks ('w'/'w+' mode only)
650        num_ns : int
651           number of model node sets ('w'/'w+' mode only)
652        num_ss : int
653           number of model side sets ('w'/'w+' mode only)
654
655        init_params : ex_init_params
656           see `exodus.ex_init_params` for more info.
657
658        Returns
659        -------
660        exo : exodus object
661            the open exodus database
662
663        Usage
664        -----
665
666        >>> ex_pars = ex_init_params(num_dim=numDims, num_nodes=numNodes,
667        ...                          num_elem=numElems, num_elem_blk=numElemBlocks, num_assembly=numAssembly)
668
669        >>> exo = exodus(file_name, mode=mode, title=title,
670        ...             array_type=array_type, init_params=ex_pars)
671        >>> with exodus(file_name, mode=mode, title=title,\
672        ...             array_type=array_type, init_params=ex_pars) as exo:
673        ...     pass
674        """
675        global SHOW_BANNER
676        if SHOW_BANNER:
677            print(EXODUS_PY_COPYRIGHT)
678            SHOW_BANNER = False
679
680        if mode is None:
681            mode = 'r'
682
683        if array_type == 'numpy':
684            # Import numpy to convert from c-type arrays to numpy arrays
685            # (Numpy is imported here rather than at the module level, so that
686            # the import only occurs if the user specifies a numpy array type.
687            # This way, platforms without numpy installed can still import the
688            # exodus.py module and just use ctype arrays.)
689            import numpy as np
690            self.np = np
691            self.use_numpy = True
692            # Warnings module is needed to suppress the invalid warning when
693            # converting from c-type arrays to numpy arrays
694            # http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4964101/pep-3118-warning-when-using-ctypes-array-as-numpy-array
695            import warnings
696            self.warnings = warnings
697        else:
698            self.use_numpy = False
699
700        self.EXODUS_LIB = EXODUS_LIB
701        self.fileName = str(file)
702        self.basename = basename(file)
703        self.modeChar = mode
704        self.fileId = None
705        self.__open(io_size=io_size)
706        EXODUS_LIB.ex_set_max_name_length(self.fileId, MAX_NAME_LENGTH)
707        if mode.lower() in ['w', 'w+']:
708            if init_params is not None:
709                self.init_params = init_params
710                if title is not None:
711                    self.init_params.title = title
712                self.put_info_ext(self.init_params)
713            else:
714                if numNodeSets is None:
715                    numNodeSets = 0
716                if numSideSets is None:
717                    numSideSets = 0
718                if numNodes is None:
719                    numNodes = 0
720                if numElems is None:
721                    numElems = 0
722                if numBlocks is None:
723                    numBlocks = 0
724
725                info = [title, numDims, numNodes, numElems, numBlocks,
726                        numNodeSets, numSideSets]
727                if None not in info:
728                    self.__ex_put_info(info)
729
730            self.numTimes = ctypes.c_int(0)
731        else:
732            self.__ex_get_info()
733            self.numTimes = ctypes.c_int(
734                self.__ex_inquire_int(
735                    ex_inquiry_map('EX_INQ_TIME')))
736
737        self.coordsX = None
738        self.coordsY = None
739        self.coordsZ = None
740        self.times = None

Open exodus database for data insertion/extraction.

Parameters

file_name : string name of exodus file to open mode : string 'r' for read, 'a' for append, 'w' for write, 'w+' for write+clobber existing file title : string database title array_type : string 'ctype' for c-type arrays, 'numpy' for numpy arrays num_dims : int number of model dimensions ('w'/'w+' mode only) num_nodes : int number of model nodes ('w'/'w+' mode only) num_elems : int number of model elements ('w'/'w+' mode only) num_blocks : int number of model element blocks ('w'/'w+' mode only) num_ns : int number of model node sets ('w'/'w+' mode only) num_ss : int number of model side sets ('w'/'w+' mode only)

init_params : ex_init_params see exodus.ex_init_params for more info.

Returns

exo : exodus object the open exodus database

Usage

>>> ex_pars = ex_init_params(num_dim=numDims, num_nodes=numNodes,
...                          num_elem=numElems, num_elem_blk=numElemBlocks, num_assembly=numAssembly)

>>> exo = exodus(file_name, mode=mode, title=title,
...             array_type=array_type, init_params=ex_pars)
>>> with exodus(file_name, mode=mode, title=title,        ...             array_type=array_type, init_params=ex_pars) as exo:
...     pass
def summarize(self): 
750    def summarize(self):
751        """
752        Outputs a summary of the exodus file data. Output is similar to:
753        ```
754        Database: base_ioshell_copy.e
755        Title:  This is the title
756
757        Number of spatial dimensions = 3                                                 Number of global variables     = 10
758        Number of node blocks        = 1         Number of nodes              = 1,331    Number of nodal variables      =  2
759        Number of element blocks     = 1         Number of elements           = 1,000    Number of element variables    =  5
760        Number of node sets          = 3         Length of node list          =   363    Number of nodeset variables    =  4
761        Number of element side sets  = 3         Length of element sides      =   300    Number of sideset variables    =  3
762        Number of assemblies         = 4                                                 Number of assembly variables   = 10
763        Number of blobs              = 0                                                 Number of blob     variables   =  0
764        Number of time steps         = 5
765        ```
766        """
767
768        sidesets = self.get_ids('EX_SIDE_SET')
769        total_sides = sum(self.num_faces_in_side_set(sideset) for sideset in sidesets)
770        nodesets = self.get_ids('EX_NODE_SET')
771        total_ns_nodes = sum(self.num_nodes_in_node_set(nodeset) for nodeset in nodesets)
772
773        num_glo_vars = self.get_variable_number('EX_GLOBAL')
774        num_nod_vars = self.get_variable_number('EX_NODAL')
775        num_ele_vars = self.get_variable_number('EX_ELEM_BLOCK')
776        num_ns_vars = self.get_variable_number('EX_NODE_SET')
777        num_ss_vars = self.get_variable_number('EX_SIDE_SET')
778        num_assem_vars = self.get_reduction_variable_number('EX_ASSEMBLY')
779        num_blob_vars = self.get_reduction_variable_number('EX_BLOB')
780
781        print("\n Database: {0}\n"
782              " Title:\t{17}\n\n"
783              " Number of spatial dimensions = {1:3d}\t"
784              "                                   {2:11s}\t"
785              " Number of global variables     = {11:6d}\n"
786              " Number of node blocks        = {5:3d}\t"
787              " Number of nodes              = {3:10n}\t"
788              " Number of nodal variables      = {12:6d}\n"
789              " Number of element blocks     = {6:3n}\t"
790              " Number of elements           = {4:10n}\t"
791              " Number of element variables    = {13:6d}\n"
792              " Number of node sets          = {7:3n}\t"
793              " Length of node list          = {9:10n}\t"
794              " Number of nodeset variables    = {14:6d}\n"
795              " Number of element side sets  = {8:3n}\t"
796              " Length of element sides      = {10:10n}\t"
797              " Number of sideset variables    = {15:6d}\n"
798              " Number of assemblies         = {18:3n}\t"
799              "                                   {2:11s}\t"
800              " Number of assembly red vars    = {19:6d}\n"
801              " Number of blobs              = {20:3n}\t"
802              "                                   {2:11s}\t"
803              " Number of blob red vars        = {21:6d}\n"
804              " Number of time steps         = {16:3n}\n"
805              .format(self.fileName,
806                      self.num_dimensions(), "",
807                      self.num_nodes(),
808                      self.num_elems(),
809                      1,
810                      self.num_blks(),
811                      self.num_node_sets(),
812                      self.num_side_sets(),
813                      total_ns_nodes, total_sides,
814                      num_glo_vars, num_nod_vars, num_ele_vars,
815                      num_ns_vars, num_ss_vars, self.num_times(), self.title(),
816                      self.num_assembly(), num_assem_vars,
817                      self.num_blob(), num_blob_vars))

Outputs a summary of the exodus file data. Output is similar to:

Database: base_ioshell_copy.e
Title:  This is the title

Number of spatial dimensions = 3                                                 Number of global variables     = 10
Number of node blocks        = 1         Number of nodes              = 1,331    Number of nodal variables      =  2
Number of element blocks     = 1         Number of elements           = 1,000    Number of element variables    =  5
Number of node sets          = 3         Length of node list          =   363    Number of nodeset variables    =  4
Number of element side sets  = 3         Length of element sides      =   300    Number of sideset variables    =  3
Number of assemblies         = 4                                                 Number of assembly variables   = 10
Number of blobs              = 0                                                 Number of blob     variables   =  0
Number of time steps         = 5
def put_info_ext(self, p): 
819    def put_info_ext(self, p):
820        """
821        put initialization information into exodus file
822
823        >>> e.put_info_ext(info_struct)
824        """
825        if len(p.title) > MAX_LINE_LENGTH:
826            print(f'WARNING: Exodus title \"{p.title}\" exceeds maximum line length ({MAX_LINE_LENGTH}). It will be truncated.')
827
828            p.title = p.title[-1 * MAX_LINE_LENGTH:]
829
830        self.Title = ctypes.create_string_buffer(p.title, MAX_LINE_LENGTH + 1)
831        self.numDim = ctypes.c_longlong(p.num_dim)
832        self.numNodes = ctypes.c_longlong(p.num_nodes)
833        self.numElem = ctypes.c_longlong(p.num_elem)
834        self.numElemBlk = ctypes.c_longlong(p.num_elem_blk)
835        self.numNodeSets = ctypes.c_longlong(p.num_node_sets)
836        self.numSideSets = ctypes.c_longlong(p.num_side_sets)
837        self.numAssembly = ctypes.c_longlong(p.num_assembly)
838
839        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_init_ext(self.fileId, ctypes.byref(p))
840        return True

put initialization information into exodus file

>>> e.put_info_ext(info_struct)
def copy(self, fileName, include_transient=False, mode='a'): 
842    def copy(self, fileName, include_transient=False, mode='a'):
843        """
844        Copies exodus database to file_name and returns an opened copy as a
845        new exodus object. This object will need to be closed when it is done
846        being used.
847
848        >>> exo_copy = exo.copy(file_name)
849        >>> exo_copy.close()
850
851        Parameters
852        ----------
853        file_name : str
854            name of exodus file to open
855
856        Returns
857        -------
858        exo_copy : exodus object opened in append mode by default
859        """
860        i64Status = EXODUS_LIB.ex_int64_status(self.fileId)
861        fileId = EXODUS_LIB.ex_create_int(fileName.encode('ascii'), EX_NOCLOBBER | i64Status,
862                                          ctypes.byref(self.comp_ws),
863                                          ctypes.byref(self.io_ws),
864                                          EX_API_VERSION_NODOT)
865
866        self.copy_file(fileId, include_transient)
867        EXODUS_LIB.ex_close(fileId)
868
869        return exodus(fileName, mode)

Copies exodus database to file_name and returns an opened copy as a new exodus object. This object will need to be closed when it is done being used.

>>> exo_copy = exo.copy(file_name)
>>> exo_copy.close()

Parameters

file_name : str name of exodus file to open

Returns

exo_copy : exodus object opened in append mode by default

def copy_file(self, file_id, include_transient=False): 
871    def copy_file(self, file_id, include_transient=False):
872        """
873        Copies exodus database to the database pointed to by `fileId`
874        Returns the passed in `file_id`.
875
876        >>> with exodus.exodus(file_name, mode='w') as exofile:
877        >>>     with exo.copy_file(exofile.fileId, include_transient=True) as exo_copy:
878        >>>         exo_copy.close()
879
880        Parameters
881        ----------
882        fileId : str
883            name of exodus file to open
884        include_transient: bool
885            should the transient data in the original file also be copied to the output file
886            or just the mesh (non-transient) portion.
887
888        Returns
889        -------
890        file_id: The file_id of the copied to file
891
892        """
893        EXODUS_LIB.ex_copy(self.fileId, file_id)
894        if include_transient:
895            EXODUS_LIB.ex_copy_transient(self.fileId, file_id)
896
897        return file_id

Copies exodus database to the database pointed to by fileId Returns the passed in file_id.

>>> with exodus.exodus(file_name, mode='w') as exofile:
>>>     with exo.copy_file(exofile.fileId, include_transient=True) as exo_copy:
>>>         exo_copy.close()

Parameters

fileId : str name of exodus file to open include_transient: bool should the transient data in the original file also be copied to the output file or just the mesh (non-transient) portion.

Returns

file_id: The file_id of the copied to file

def title(self): 
899    def title(self):
900        """
901        get the database title
902
903        >>> title = exo.title()
904
905        Returns
906        -------
907        title : string
908        """
909        return self.Title.value.decode('utf8')

get the database title

>>> title = exo.title()

Returns

title : string

def version_num(self): 
911    def version_num(self):
912        """
913        get exodus version number used to create the database
914
915        >>> version = exo.version_num()
916
917        Returns
918        -------
919        version : string
920            representation of version number
921        """
922        return "%1.2f" % self.version.value

get exodus version number used to create the database

>>> version = exo.version_num()

Returns

version : string representation of version number

def put_info( self, Title, numDim, numNodes, numElem, numElemBlk, numNodeSets, numSideSets): 
924    def put_info(self, Title, numDim, numNodes, numElem, numElemBlk,
925                 numNodeSets, numSideSets):
926        """
927        Initialize static metadata for the database.
928
929        >>> status = exo.put_info(title, num_dims, num_nodes, num_elems,
930        ...                      num_blocks, num_ns, num_ss)
931
932        Parameters
933        ----------
934        title : string
935            database title
936        num_dims : int
937            number of model dimensions
938        num_nodes : int
939            number of model nodes
940        num_elems : int
941            number of model elements
942        num_blocks : int
943            number of model element blocks
944        num_ns : int
945            number of model node sets
946        num_ss : int
947            number of model side sets
948
949        Returns
950        -------
951        status : bool
952            True = successful execution
953
954        """
955        self.__ex_put_info([Title, numDim, numNodes, numElem,
956                            numElemBlk, numNodeSets, numSideSets])
957        return True

Initialize static metadata for the database.

>>> status = exo.put_info(title, num_dims, num_nodes, num_elems,
...                      num_blocks, num_ns, num_ss)

Parameters

title : string database title num_dims : int number of model dimensions num_nodes : int number of model nodes num_elems : int number of model elements num_blocks : int number of model element blocks num_ns : int number of model node sets num_ss : int number of model side sets

Returns

status : bool True = successful execution

def inquire(self, inquiry): 
959    def inquire(self, inquiry):
960        """
961        Inquire about various properties of the database
962
963        Returns
964        -------
965        inq_res : int
966        """
967        return self.__ex_inquire_int(ex_inquiry_map(inquiry))

Inquire about various properties of the database

Returns

inq_res : int

  2. the software descriptor, e.g. version
  3. additional software data
  4. time stamp
>>> qa_recs = exo.get_qa_records()

def put_qa_records(self, records): 
 998    def put_qa_records(self, records):
 999        """
1000        store a list of QA records where each QA record is a length-4 tuple of strings:
1001          1. the software name that accessed/modified the database
1002          2. the software descriptor, e.g. version
1003          3. additional software data
1004          4. time stamp
1005
1006        >>> status = exo.put_qa_records()
1007
1008        Parameter
1009        ---------
1010        qa_recs : <list<tuple[4]<string>>>
1011
1012        Returns
1013        ------
1014        status : bool
1015            True = successful execution
1016        """
1017        for rec in records:
1018            assert len(rec) == 4
1019            for recEntry in rec:
1020                assert len(str(recEntry).encode('ascii')) < MAX_STR_LENGTH
1021        return self.__ex_put_qa(records)

store a list of QA records where each QA record is a length-4 tuple of strings:

  1. the software name that accessed/modified the database
  2. the software descriptor, e.g. version
  3. additional software data
  4. time stamp
>>> status = exo.put_qa_records()

Parameter

qa_recs : >>

status : bool True = successful execution

def put_info_records(self, info): 
1049    def put_info_records(self, info):
1050        """
1051        store a list of info records where each entry in the list is
1052        one line of info, e.g. a line of an input deck
1053
1054        >>> status = exo.put_info_records(info)
1055
1056        Parameters
1057        ----------
1058        info_recs : <list<tuple[4]<string>>>
1059
1060        Returns
1061        -------
1062        status : bool
1063            True = successful execution
1064        """
1065        for rec in info:
1066            if len(str(rec).encode('ascii')) > MAX_LINE_LENGTH:
1067                print("WARNING: max line length reached for one or more info records;")
1068                print(
1069                    "         info stored to exodus file is incomplete for these records")
1070                break
1071        return self.__ex_put_info_recs(info)

store a list of info records where each entry in the list is one line of info, e.g. a line of an input deck

>>> status = exo.put_info_records(info)

Parameters

info_recs : >>

Returns

status : bool True = successful execution

def get_sierra_input(self, inpFileName=None): 
1075    def get_sierra_input(self, inpFileName=None):
1076        """
1077        parse sierra input deck from the info records if inp_file_name
1078        is passed the deck is written to this file; otherwise a list
1079        of input deck file lines is returned
1080
1081        >>> inp = exo.get_sierra_input(inpFileName=inp_file_name)
1082
1083        Parameters
1084        ----------
1085        inp_file_name : string, optional
1086           Name of text file where info records corresponding to the Sierra input deck will be written
1087
1088        Returns
1089        -------
1090        inp : list<string>
1091           lines if inp_file_name not provided; otherwise, an empty list
1092
1093        """
1094        info_recs = self.__ex_get_info_recs()
1095        sierra_inp = []
1096        begin = False
1097        for rec in info_recs:
1098            vals = rec.split()
1099            if not begin:  # have not reached Sierra block
1100                if len(vals) >= 2 and vals[0].lower() == "begin" and vals[1].lower() == "sierra":
1101                    begin = True
1102            if begin:  # inside Sierra block
1103                sierra_inp.append(rec)
1104                if len(rec) > MAX_LINE_LENGTH:
1105                    print(
1106                        "WARNING: max line length reached for one or more input lines;")
1107                    print("         input data might be incomplete for these lines")
1108                    break
1109                if len(vals) >= 2 and vals[0].lower() == "end" and vals[1].lower() == "sierra":
1110                    break  # end of Sierra block
1111
1112        if inpFileName:
1113            with open(inpFileName.encode('ascii'), "w") as fd:
1114                for fileLine in sierra_inp:
1115                    fd.write(fileLine + "\n")
1116            return []
1117
1118        return sierra_inp

parse sierra input deck from the info records if inp_file_name is passed the deck is written to this file; otherwise a list of input deck file lines is returned

>>> inp = exo.get_sierra_input(inpFileName=inp_file_name)

Parameters

inp_file_name : string, optional Name of text file where info records corresponding to the Sierra input deck will be written

Returns

inp : list lines if inp_file_name not provided; otherwise, an empty list

def get_times(self): 
1139    def get_times(self):
1140        """
1141        get the time values
1142
1143        >>> time_vals = exo.get_times()
1144
1145        Returns
1146        -------
1147            if array_type == 'ctype' :
1148              <list<ctypes.c_double>>  time_vals
1149
1150            if array_type == 'numpy' :
1151              <np_array<double>>  time_vals
1152        """
1153        if self.numTimes.value == 0:
1154            self.times = []
1155        else:
1156            self.__ex_get_all_times()
1157        if self.use_numpy:
1158            self.times = ctype_to_numpy(self, self.times)
1159        return self.times

  <list<ctypes.c_double>>  time_vals

if array_type == 'numpy' :
  <np_array<double>>  time_vals
def put_time(self, step, value): 
1163    def put_time(self, step, value):
1164        """
1165        store a new time
1166
1167        >>> exo.put_time(time_step, time_val)
1168
1169        Parameters
1170        ----------
1171        time_step : int
1172            time step index (1-based)
1173        time_val : float
1174            time value for this step
1175
1176        Returns
1177        -------
1178        status : bool
1179            True = successful execution
1180        """
1181        self.__ex_put_time(step, value)
1182        self.numTimes = ctypes.c_int(self.__ex_inquire_int(ex_inquiry_map('EX_INQ_TIME')))
1183        return True

def get_coords(self): 
1251    def get_coords(self):
1252        """
1253        get model coordinates of all nodes; for each coordinate
1254        direction, a length exo.num_nodes() list is returned
1255
1256        >>> x_coords, y_coords, z_coords = exo.get_coords()
1257
1258        Returns
1259        -------
1260
1261            if array_type == 'ctype':
1262              <list<ctypes.c_double>>  x_coords  global x-direction coordinates
1263              <list<ctypes.c_double>>  y_coords  global y-direction coordinates
1264              <list<ctypes.c_double>>  z_coords  global z-direction coordinates
1265
1266            if array_type == 'numpy':
1267              <np_array<double>>  x_coords  global x-direction coordinates
1268              <np_array<double>>  y_coords  global y-direction coordinates
1269              <np_array<double>>  z_coords  global z-direction coordinates
1270        """
1271        self.__ex_get_coord()
1272        if self.use_numpy:
1273            self.coordsX = ctype_to_numpy(self, self.coordsX)
1274            self.coordsY = ctype_to_numpy(self, self.coordsY)
1275            self.coordsZ = ctype_to_numpy(self, self.coordsZ)
1276        return self.coordsX, self.coordsY, self.coordsZ

get model coordinates of all nodes; for each coordinate direction, a length exo.num_nodes() list is returned

>>> x_coords, y_coords, z_coords = exo.get_coords()

Returns

if array_type == 'ctype':
  <list<ctypes.c_double>>  x_coords  global x-direction coordinates
  <list<ctypes.c_double>>  y_coords  global y-direction coordinates
  <list<ctypes.c_double>>  z_coords  global z-direction coordinates

if array_type == 'numpy':
  <np_array<double>>  x_coords  global x-direction coordinates
  <np_array<double>>  y_coords  global y-direction coordinates
  <np_array<double>>  z_coords  global z-direction coordinates
def get_coord(self, i): 
1280    def get_coord(self, i):
1281        """
1282        get model coordinates of a single node
1283
1284        >>> x_coord, y_coord, z_coord = exo.get_coord(node_index)
1285
1286        Parameters
1287        ----------
1288        node_index : int
1289            the 1-based node index (indexing is from 1 to exo.num_nodes())
1290
1291        Returns
1292        -------
1293        x_coord : double
1294            global x-direction coordinate
1295        y_coord : double
1296            global y-direction coordinate
1297        z_coord : double
1298            global z-direction coordinate
1299
1300        Note:
1301        -----
1302        >>> x_coords, y_coords, z_coords = exo.get_coords()
1303        >>> x_coord = x_coords[node_index-1]
1304        >>> y_coord = y_coords[node_index-1]
1305        >>> z_coord = z_coords[node_index-1]
1306            ... is equivalent to ...
1307        >>> x_coord, y_coord, z_coord = exo.get_coords(node_index)
1308
1309        """
1310        listX, listY, listZ = self.__ex_get_partial_coord(i, 1)
1311        return listX[0], listY[0], listZ[0]

get model coordinates of a single node

>>> x_coord, y_coord, z_coord = exo.get_coord(node_index)

Parameters

node_index : int the 1-based node index (indexing is from 1 to exo.num_nodes())

Returns

x_coord : double global x-direction coordinate y_coord : double global y-direction coordinate z_coord : double global z-direction coordinate

Note:

>>> x_coords, y_coords, z_coords = exo.get_coords()
>>> x_coord = x_coords[node_index-1]
>>> y_coord = y_coords[node_index-1]
>>> z_coord = z_coords[node_index-1]
    ... is equivalent to ...
>>> x_coord, y_coord, z_coord = exo.get_coords(node_index)

def get_node_num_map(self): 
1341    def get_node_num_map(self):
1342        """
1343        **DEPRECATED** use: `get_node_id_map()`
1344
1345        get mapping of exodus node index to user- or application-
1346        defined node id; node_id_map is ordered the same as the nodal
1347        coordinate arrays returned by exo.get_coords() -- this ordering
1348        follows the exodus node *INDEX* order, a 1-based system going
1349        from 1 to exo.num_nodes(); a user or application can optionally
1350        use a separate node *ID* numbering system, so the node_id_map
1351        points to the node *ID* for each node *INDEX*
1352
1353        >>> node_id_map = exo.get_node_num_map()
1354
1355        Returns
1356        -------
1357            <list<ctypes.c_int>>  node_id_map
1358        """
1359        return self.__ex_get_node_num_map()

DEPRECATED use: get_node_id_map()

get mapping of exodus node index to user- or application- defined node id; node_id_map is ordered the same as the nodal coordinate arrays returned by exo.get_coords() -- this ordering follows the exodus node INDEX order, a 1-based system going from 1 to exo.num_nodes(); a user or application can optionally use a separate node ID numbering system, so the node_id_map points to the node ID for each node INDEX

>>> node_id_map = exo.get_node_num_map()

Returns

<list<ctypes.c_int>>  node_id_map
def put_node_id_map(self, id_map): 
1363    def put_node_id_map(self, id_map):
1364        """
1365        store mapping of exodus node index to user- or application-
1366        defined node id; node_id_map is ordered the same as the nodal
1367        coordinate arrays returned by exo.get_coords() -- this ordering
1368        follows the exodus node *INDEX* order, a 1-based system going
1369        from 1 to exo.num_nodes(); a user or application can optionally
1370        use a separate node *ID* numbering system, so the node_id_map
1371        points to the node *ID* for each node *INDEX*
1372
1373        >>> status = exo.put_node_id_map(node_id_map)
1374

1376        ----------
1377            <list<int>>  node_id_map

1381        status : bool
1382            True = successful execution
1383        """
1384        return self.__ex_put_id_map('EX_NODE_MAP', id_map)

def put_node_variable_name(self, name, index): 
1438    def put_node_variable_name(self, name, index):
1439        """
1440        add the name and index of a new nodal variable to the model;
1441        nodal variable indexing goes from 1 to exo.get_node_variable_number()
1442
1443        >>> status = exo.put_node_variable_name(nvar_name, nvar_index)
1444
1445        Parameters
1446        ----------
1447            <string>  nvar_name   name of new nodal variable
1448            <int>     nvar_index  1-based index of new nodal variable
1449
1450        Returns
1451        -------
1452        status : bool
1453            True = successful execution
1454
1455        Note:
1456        ----
1457        this method is often called within the following sequence:
1458
1459        >>> num_nvars = exo.get_node_variable_number()
1460        >>> new_nvar_index = num_nvars + 1
1461        >>> num_nvars += 1
1462        >>> exo.set_node_variable_number(num_nvars)
1463        >>> exo.put_node_variable_name("new_nvar_name", new_nvar_index)
1464        """
1465        NDvarNames = self.get_variable_names('EX_NODAL')
1466        if name in NDvarNames:
1467            print(f'WARNING: node variable \"{name}\" already exists.')
1468        if index > len(NDvarNames):
1469            raise Exception("ERROR: variable index out of range.")
1470        self.__ex_put_variable_name('EX_NODAL', index, name)
1471        return True

add the name and index of a new nodal variable to the model; nodal variable indexing goes from 1 to exo.get_node_variable_number()

>>> status = exo.put_node_variable_name(nvar_name, nvar_index)

Parameters

<string>  nvar_name   name of new nodal variable
<int>     nvar_index  1-based index of new nodal variable

Returns

status : bool True = successful execution

Note:

this method is often called within the following sequence:

>>> num_nvars = exo.get_node_variable_number()
>>> new_nvar_index = num_nvars + 1
>>> num_nvars += 1
>>> exo.set_node_variable_number(num_nvars)
>>> exo.put_node_variable_name("new_nvar_name", new_nvar_index)
def get_node_variable_values(self, name, step): 
1475    def get_node_variable_values(self, name, step):
1476        """
1477        get list of nodal variable values for a nodal variable name
1478        and time step
1479
1480        >>> nvar_vals = exo.get_node_variable_values(nvar_name, time_step)
1481
1482        Parameters
1483        ----------
1484            <string>  nvar_name  name of nodal variable
1485            <int>     time_step  1-based index of time step
1486
1487        Returns
1488        -------
1489
1490            if array_type == 'ctype':
1491              <list<ctypes.c_double>>  nvar_vals
1492
1493            if array_type == 'numpy':
1494              <np_array<double>>  nvar_vals
1495        """
1496        names = self.get_variable_names('EX_NODAL')
1497        var_id = names.index(name) + 1
1498        numVals = self.num_nodes()
1499        values = self.__ex_get_var(step, 'EX_NODAL', var_id, 0, numVals)
1500        if self.use_numpy:
1501            values = ctype_to_numpy(self, values)
1502        return values

get list of nodal variable values for a nodal variable name and time step

>>> nvar_vals = exo.get_node_variable_values(nvar_name, time_step)

Parameters

<string>  nvar_name  name of nodal variable
<int>     time_step  1-based index of time step

Returns

if array_type == 'ctype':
  <list<ctypes.c_double>>  nvar_vals

if array_type == 'numpy':
  <np_array<double>>  nvar_vals
def get_partial_node_variable_values(self, name, step, start_index, num_nodes): 
1506    def get_partial_node_variable_values(self, name, step, start_index, num_nodes):
1507        """
1508        get partial list of nodal variable values for a nodal variable name
1509        and time step.  Start at node `node_index` (1-based) and return `num_nodes`
1510        from that point.
1511
1512        >>> nvar_vals = exo.get_partial_node_variable_values(nvar_name, time_step, 10, 100)
1513
1514        Parameters
1515        ----------
1516            <string>  nvar_name   name of nodal variable
1517            <int>     time_step   1-based index of time step
1518            <int>     start_index 1-based index of node to start returning data
1519            <int>     num_nodes   number of nodes to return data for.
1520
1521        Returns
1522        -------
1523
1524            if array_type == 'ctype':
1525              <list<ctypes.c_double>>  nvar_vals
1526
1527            if array_type == 'numpy':
1528              <np_array<double>>  nvar_vals
1529        """
1530        names = self.get_variable_names('EX_NODAL')
1531        var_id = names.index(name) + 1
1532        values = self.__ex_get_partial_var(step, 'EX_NODAL', var_id, 0, start_index, num_nodes)
1533        if self.use_numpy:
1534            values = ctype_to_numpy(self, values)
1535        return values

get partial list of nodal variable values for a nodal variable name and time step. Start at node node_index (1-based) and return num_nodes from that point.

>>> nvar_vals = exo.get_partial_node_variable_values(nvar_name, time_step, 10, 100)

Parameters

<string>  nvar_name   name of nodal variable
<int>     time_step   1-based index of time step
<int>     start_index 1-based index of node to start returning data
<int>     num_nodes   number of nodes to return data for.

Returns

if array_type == 'ctype':
  <list<ctypes.c_double>>  nvar_vals

if array_type == 'numpy':
  <np_array<double>>  nvar_vals
def put_node_variable_values(self, name, step, values): 
1539    def put_node_variable_values(self, name, step, values):
1540        """
1541        store a list of nodal variable values for a nodal variable
1542        name and time step
1543
1544        >>> status = exo.put_node_variable_values(nvar_name, time_step, nvar_vals)
1545
1546        Parameters
1547        ----------
1548            <string>       nvar_name  name of nodal variable
1549            <int>          time_step  1-based index of time step
1550            <list<float>>  nvar_vals
1551
1552        Returns
1553        -------
1554        status : bool
1555            True = successful execution
1556        """
1557        names = self.get_variable_names('EX_NODAL')
1558        var_id = names.index(name) + 1
1559        numVals = self.num_nodes()
1560        self.__ex_put_var(step, 'EX_NODAL', var_id, 0, numVals, values)
1561        return True

store a list of nodal variable values for a nodal variable name and time step

>>> status = exo.put_node_variable_values(nvar_name, time_step, nvar_vals)

Parameters

<string>       nvar_name  name of nodal variable
<int>          time_step  1-based index of time step
<list<float>>  nvar_vals

Returns

status : bool True = successful execution

def get_num_map(self, mapType, idx): 
1582    def get_num_map(self, mapType, idx):
1583        """
1584        get user-defined map of exodus element/node/edge/face index to user- or
1585        application- defined element/node/edge/face values. Map values are arbitary integers
1586
1587        >>> elem_num_map = exo.get_num_map('EX_ELEM_MAP', 1)
1588
1589        Parameters
1590        ----------
1591            mapType   : ex_entity_type
1592                        type of map being queried ('EX_ELEM_MAP', 'EX_NODE_MAP', 'EX_FACE_MAP', 'EX_EDGE_MAP')
1593            idx       : int
1594                        which map to return (1-based).  Use `inquire(mapType)` to get number of maps stored on database.
1595        Returns
1596        -------
1597
1598            if array_type == 'ctype':
1599              <list<int>>  num_map
1600
1601            if array_type == 'numpy':
1602              <np_array<int>>  num_map
1603
1604
1605        Usage
1606        -----
1607        >>> em_cnt = exo.inquire('EX_INQ_ELEM_MAP')
1608        >>> em     = exo.get_names('EX_ELEM_MAP')
1609        >>> map    = exo.get_num_map('EX_ELEM_MAP', 2)
1610
1611        """
1612        return self.__ex_get_num_map(mapType, idx)

get user-defined map of exodus element/node/edge/face index to user- or application- defined element/node/edge/face values. Map values are arbitary integers

>>> elem_num_map = exo.get_num_map('EX_ELEM_MAP', 1)

Parameters

mapType   : ex_entity_type
            type of map being queried ('EX_ELEM_MAP', 'EX_NODE_MAP', 'EX_FACE_MAP', 'EX_EDGE_MAP')
idx       : int
            which map to return (1-based).  Use `inquire(mapType)` to get number of maps stored on database.

Returns

if array_type == 'ctype':
  <list<int>>  num_map

if array_type == 'numpy':
  <np_array<int>>  num_map

Usage

>>> em_cnt = exo.inquire('EX_INQ_ELEM_MAP')
>>> em     = exo.get_names('EX_ELEM_MAP')
>>> map    = exo.get_num_map('EX_ELEM_MAP', 2)
def put_num_map(self, mapType, idx, num_map): 
1616    def put_num_map(self, mapType, idx, num_map):
1617        """
1618        put user-defined map of exodus element/node/edge/face index to user- or
1619        application- defined element/node/edge/face values. Map values are arbitary integers
1620
1621
1622        Parameters
1623        ----------
1624            mapType   : ex_entity_type
1625                        type of map being written ('EX_ELEM_MAP', 'EX_NODE_MAP', 'EX_FACE_MAP', 'EX_EDGE_MAP')
1626            idx       : int
1627                        which map to write (1-based).  Use `put_map_param(node_map_cnt, elem_map_cnt)` prior to this
1628                        function to define number of maps on the database.
1629            <list<int>>  elem_id_map
1630
1631
1632        Usage
1633        -----
1634
1635        >>> exo.put_map_param(nm_cnt, em_cnt)
1636        >>> nm[0] = "My_Node_Map"
1637        >>> exo.put_names('EX_NODE_MAP', nm);
1638        >>> exo.put_num_map('EX_NODE_MAP', 1, scale_map)
1639
1640        """
1641        return self.__ex_put_num_map(mapType, idx, num_map)

put user-defined map of exodus element/node/edge/face index to user- or application- defined element/node/edge/face values. Map values are arbitary integers

Parameters

mapType   : ex_entity_type
            type of map being written ('EX_ELEM_MAP', 'EX_NODE_MAP', 'EX_FACE_MAP', 'EX_EDGE_MAP')
idx       : int
            which map to write (1-based).  Use `put_map_param(node_map_cnt, elem_map_cnt)` prior to this
            function to define number of maps on the database.
<list<int>>  elem_id_map

Usage

>>> exo.put_map_param(nm_cnt, em_cnt)
>>> nm[0] = "My_Node_Map"
>>> exo.put_names('EX_NODE_MAP', nm);
>>> exo.put_num_map('EX_NODE_MAP', 1, scale_map)

1644        """
1645        Define number of node and element maps that will be written to the database

1647        Parameters
1648        ----------
1649        node_map_cnt  : int
1650                        number of node maps
1651        elem_map_cnt  : int
1652                        number of element maps
1653
1654        """
1655        return self.__ex_put_map_param(node_map_cnt, elem_map_cnt)

Parameters

node_map_cnt : int number of node maps elem_map_cnt : int number of element maps

def get_id_map(self, mapType): 
1659    def get_id_map(self, mapType):
1660        """
1661        get mapping of exodus element/node/edge/face index to user- or
1662        application- defined element/node/edge/face id; id_map is ordered by the
1663        *INDEX* ordering, a 1-based system going from 1 to
1664        exo.num_???s(), used by exodus for storage and input/output
1665        of array data stored on the elements/nodes/edges/faces; a user or application
1666        can optionally use a separate *ID* numbering system,
1667        so the id_map points to the element/node/edge/face *ID* for each
1668        *INDEX*
1669
1670        >>> elem_id_map = exo.get_id_map('EX_ELEM_MAP')
1671
1672        Parameters
1673        ----------
1674            mapType   : ex_entity_type
1675                        type of map being queried ('EX_ELEM_MAP', 'EX_NODE_MAP', 'EX_FACE_MAP', 'EX_EDGE_MAP')
1676        Returns
1677        -------
1678
1679            if array_type == 'ctype':
1680              <list<int>>  id_map
1681
1682            if array_type == 'numpy':
1683              <np_array<int>>  id_map
1684
1685        """
1686        return self.__ex_get_id_map(mapType)

get mapping of exodus element/node/edge/face index to user- or application- defined element/node/edge/face id; id_map is ordered by the INDEX ordering, a 1-based system going from 1 to exo.num_???s(), used by exodus for storage and input/output of array data stored on the elements/nodes/edges/faces; a user or application can optionally use a separate ID numbering system, so the id_map points to the element/node/edge/face ID for each INDEX

>>> elem_id_map = exo.get_id_map('EX_ELEM_MAP')

Parameters

mapType   : ex_entity_type
            type of map being queried ('EX_ELEM_MAP', 'EX_NODE_MAP', 'EX_FACE_MAP', 'EX_EDGE_MAP')

Returns

if array_type == 'ctype':
  <list<int>>  id_map

if array_type == 'numpy':
  <np_array<int>>  id_map
def get_elem_id_map(self): 
1690    def get_elem_id_map(self):
1691        """
1692        get mapping of exodus element index to user- or application-
1693        defined element id; elem_id_map is ordered by the element
1694        *INDEX* ordering, a 1-based system going from 1 to
1695        exo.num_elems(), used by exodus for storage and input/output
1696        of array data stored on the elements; a user or application
1697        can optionally use a separate element *ID* numbering system,
1698        so the elem_id_map points to the element *ID* for each
1699        element *INDEX*
1700
1701        >>> elem_id_map = exo.get_elem_id_map()
1702
1703        Returns
1704        -------
1705
1706            if array_type == 'ctype':
1707              <list<int>>  elem_id_map
1708
1709            if array_type == 'numpy':
1710              <np_array<int>>  elem_id_map
1711        """
1712        return self.__ex_get_id_map('EX_ELEM_MAP')

get mapping of exodus element index to user- or application- defined element id; elem_id_map is ordered by the element INDEX ordering, a 1-based system going from 1 to exo.num_elems(), used by exodus for storage and input/output of array data stored on the elements; a user or application can optionally use a separate element ID numbering system, so the elem_id_map points to the element ID for each element INDEX

>>> elem_id_map = exo.get_elem_id_map()

def put_elem_id_map(self, id_map): 
1716    def put_elem_id_map(self, id_map):
1717        """
1718        store mapping of exodus element index to user- or application-
1719        defined element id; elem_id_map is ordered by the element
1720        *INDEX* ordering, a 1-based system going from 1 to
1721        exo.num_elems(), used by exodus for storage and input/output
1722        of array data stored on the elements; a user or application
1723        can optionally use a separate element *ID* numbering system,
1724        so the elem_id_map points to the element *ID* for each
1725        element *INDEX*
1726
1727        >>> status = exo.put_elem_id_map(elem_id_map)
1728
1729        Parameters
1730        ----------
1731            <list<int>>  elem_id_map
1732
1733        Returns
1734        -------
1735        status : bool
1736            True = successful execution
1737        """
1738        return self.__ex_put_id_map('EX_ELEM_MAP', id_map)

store mapping of exodus element index to user- or application- defined element id; elem_id_map is ordered by the element INDEX ordering, a 1-based system going from 1 to exo.num_elems(), used by exodus for storage and input/output of array data stored on the elements; a user or application can optionally use a separate element ID numbering system, so the elem_id_map points to the element ID for each element INDEX

1747        exo.num_XXX(), used by exodus for storage and input/output
1748        of array data stored on the entities; a user or application

1760

1762        -------
1763        status : bool
1764            True = successful execution

store mapping of exodus entity index to user- or application- defined entity id; id_map is ordered by the entity INDEX ordering, a 1-based system going from 1 to exo.num_XXX(), used by exodus for storage and input/output of array data stored on the entities; a user or application can optionally use a separate entity ID numbering system, so the elem_id_map points to the entity ID for each entity INDEX

def get_block_id_map(self, obj_type, entity_id): 
1770    def get_block_id_map(self, obj_type, entity_id):
1771        """
1772        Gets the map of elements found in the given entity_id of an object
1773        of obj_type.
1774
1775        *INDEX* ordering, a 1-based system going from 1 to
1776        number of elements in the elem_block, used by exodus for
1777        storage and input/output of array data stored on the elements;
1778        a user or application can optionally use a separate element *ID* numbering system,
1779        so the elem_id_map points to the element *ID* for each
1780        element *INDEX*
1781
1782        >>> elem_block_id_map = exo.get_block_id_map("EX_ELEM_BLOCK", 100)
1783
1784        Returns
1785        -------
1786
1787            if array_type == 'ctype':
1788              <list<int>>  elem_id_map
1789
1790            if array_type == 'numpy':
1791              <np_array<int>>  elem_id_map
1792        """
1793        return self.__ex_get_block_id_map(obj_type, entity_id)

Gets the map of elements found in the given entity_id of an object of obj_type.

INDEX ordering, a 1-based system going from 1 to number of elements in the elem_block, used by exodus for storage and input/output of array data stored on the elements; a user or application can optionally use a separate element ID numbering system, so the elem_id_map points to the element ID for each element INDEX

>>> elem_block_id_map = exo.get_block_id_map("EX_ELEM_BLOCK", 100)

  <list<int>>  elem_id_map
