def get_global_variable_values(self, name): 
4676    def get_global_variable_values(self, name):
4677        """
4678        get global variable values over all time steps for one global
4679        variable name
4680
4681        >>> gvar_vals = exo.get_global_variable_values(gvar_name)
4682
4683        Parameters
4684        ----------
4685            <string>  gvar_name  name of global variable
4686
4687        Returns
4688        -------
4689
4690            if array_type == 'ctype':
4691              <list<float>>  gvar_vals
4692
4693            if array_type == 'numpy':
4694              <np_array<double>>  gvar_vals
4695        """
4696        names = self.get_variable_names('EX_GLOBAL')
4697        var_id = names.index(name)
4698        num = self.__ex_get_variable_param('EX_GLOBAL')
4699        values = []
4700        for i in range(self.numTimes.value):
4701            gvalues = self.__ex_get_var(i + 1, 'EX_GLOBAL', 0, 1, num.value)
4702            values.append(gvalues[var_id])
4703        if self.use_numpy:
4704            values = self.np.array(values)
4705        return values

get global variable values over all time steps for one global variable name

>>> gvar_vals = exo.get_global_variable_values(gvar_name)

Parameters

<string>  gvar_name  name of global variable

Returns

if array_type == 'ctype':
  <list<float>>  gvar_vals

if array_type == 'numpy':
  <np_array<double>>  gvar_vals
def put_polyhedra_elem_blk(self, blkID, num_elems_this_blk, num_faces, num_attr_per_elem): 
4709    def put_polyhedra_elem_blk(self, blkID,
4710                               num_elems_this_blk,
4711                               num_faces,
4712                               num_attr_per_elem):
4713        """
4714        put in an element block with polyhedral elements
4715
4716        >>> status = exo.put_polyhedra_elem_blk(blkID, num_elems_this_blk,
4717        ...                                     num_faces, num_attr_per_elem)
4718
4719        Parameters
4720        ----------
4721            <int>     blkID               id of the block to be added
4722            <int>     num_elems_this_blk
4723            <int>     num_faces  total number of faces in this block
4724            <int>     num_attr_per_elem
4725
4726        Returns
4727        -------
4728        status : bool
4729            True = successful execution
4730        """
4731
4732        ebType = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type('EX_ELEM_BLOCK'))
4733        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_block(self.fileId, ebType, ctypes.c_longlong(blkID),
4734                                ctypes.create_string_buffer(b"NFACED"),
4735                                ctypes.c_longlong(num_elems_this_blk),
4736                                ctypes.c_longlong(0),
4737                                ctypes.c_longlong(0),
4738                                ctypes.c_longlong(num_faces),
4739                                ctypes.c_longlong(num_attr_per_elem))
4740        return True

4745                               num_faces_this_blk,
4746                               num_nodes,
4747                               num_attr_per_face):
4748        """
4749        put in a block of faces
4750
4751        >>> status = exo.put_polyhedra_face_blk(blkID, num_faces_this_blk,
4752        ...                                     num_nodes, num_attr_per_face)
4753
4754        Parameters
4755        ----------
4756            <int>     blkID               id of the block to be added
4757            <int>     num_faces_this_blk
4758            <int>     num_nodes           total number of nodes in this block
4759            <int>     num_attr_per_face
4760
4761        Returns
4762        -------
4763        status : bool
4764            True = successful execution
4765        """
4766        fbType = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type('EX_FACE_BLOCK'))
4767        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_block(self.fileId, fbType, ctypes.c_longlong(blkID),
4768                                ctypes.create_string_buffer(b"NSIDED"),
4769                                ctypes.c_longlong(num_faces_this_blk),
4770                                ctypes.c_longlong(num_nodes),
4771                                ctypes.c_longlong(0),
4772                                ctypes.c_longlong(0),
4773                                ctypes.c_longlong(num_attr_per_face))
4774        return True

def put_face_count_per_polyhedra(self, blkID, entityCounts): 
4778    def put_face_count_per_polyhedra(self, blkID, entityCounts):
4779        """
4780        put in a count of faces in for each polyhedra in an elem block
4781
4782        >>> status = exo.put_face_count_per_polyhedra(blkID, entityCounts)
4783
4784        Parameters
4785        ----------
4786            <int>     blkID               id of the block to be added
4787
4788            if array_type == 'ctype':
4789              <list<float>>  entityCounts
4790
4791            if array_type == 'numpy':
4792              <np_array<double>>  entityCounts
4793
4794        Returns
4795        -------
4796        status : bool
4797            True = successful execution
4798        """
4799        ebType = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type('EX_ELEM_BLOCK'))
4800        entity_counts = (ctypes.c_int * len(entityCounts))()
4801        entity_counts[:] = entityCounts
4802        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_entity_count_per_polyhedra(
4803            self.fileId, ebType, ctypes.c_longlong(blkID), entity_counts)
4804        return True

def put_elem_face_conn(self, blkId, elemFaceConn): 
4838    def put_elem_face_conn(self, blkId, elemFaceConn):
4839        """
4840        put in connectivity information from elems to faces
4841
4842        >>> status = exo.put_elem_face_conn(blkID, elemFaceConn)
4843
4844        Parameters
4845        ----------
4846            <int>     blkID               id of the elem block to be added
4847
4848            if array_type == 'ctype':
4849              <list<float>>  elemFaceConn  (raveled/flat list)
4850
4851            if array_type == 'numpy':
4852              <np_array<double>>  elemFaceConn  (raveled/flat array)
4853
4854        Returns
4855        -------
4856        status : bool
4857            True = successful execution
4858        """
4859        ebType = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type('EX_ELEM_BLOCK'))
4860        elem_face_conn = (ctypes.c_int * len(elemFaceConn))()
4861        elem_face_conn[:] = elemFaceConn
4862        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_conn(self.fileId, ebType, ctypes.c_longlong(blkId),
4863                               None, None, elem_face_conn)
4864        return True

put in connectivity information from elems to faces

>>> status = exo.put_elem_face_conn(blkID, elemFaceConn)

Parameters

<int>     blkID               id of the elem block to be added

if array_type == 'ctype':
  <list<float>>  elemFaceConn  (raveled/flat list)

if array_type == 'numpy':
  <np_array<double>>  elemFaceConn  (raveled/flat array)

Returns

status : bool True = successful execution

def put_face_node_conn(self, blkId, faceNodeConn): 
4868    def put_face_node_conn(self, blkId, faceNodeConn):
4869        """
4870        put in connectivity information from faces to nodes
4871
4872        >>> status = exo.put_face_node_conn(blkID, faceNodeConn)
4873
4874        Parameters
4875        ----------
4876            <int>     blkID               id of the face block to be added
4877
4878            if array_type == 'ctype':
4879              <list<float>>  faceNodeConn  (raveled/flat list)
4880
4881            if array_type == 'numpy':
4882              <np_array<double>>  faceNodeConn  (raveled/flat array)
4883
4884        Returns
4885        -------
4886        status : bool
4887            True = successful execution
4888        """
4889        ebType = ctypes.c_int(get_entity_type('EX_FACE_BLOCK'))
4890        node_conn = (ctypes.c_int * len(faceNodeConn))()
4891        node_conn[:] = faceNodeConn
4892        EXODUS_LIB.ex_put_conn(self.fileId, ebType, ctypes.c_longlong(blkId),
4893                               node_conn, None, None)
4894        return True

put in connectivity information from faces to nodes

>>> status = exo.put_face_node_conn(blkID, faceNodeConn)

Parameters

<int>     blkID               id of the face block to be added

if array_type == 'ctype':
  <list<float>>  faceNodeConn  (raveled/flat list)

if array_type == 'numpy':
  <np_array<double>>  faceNodeConn  (raveled/flat array)

Returns

status : bool True = successful execution

def close(self): 
4898    def close(self):
4899        """
4900        close the exodus file
4901
4902        >>> exo.close()
4903
4904        Note:
4905        -----
4906        Can only be called once for an exodus object, and once called
4907        all methods for that object become inoperable
4908        """
4909        print(f"Closing exodus file: {self.fileName}")
4910        errorInt = EXODUS_LIB.ex_close(self.fileId)
4911        if errorInt != 0:
4912            raise Exception(
4913                "ERROR: Closing file " + self.fileName + " had problems.")

close the exodus file

>>> exo.close()

Note:

Can only be called once for an exodus object, and once called all methods for that object become inoperable

def collectElemConnectivity(exodusHandle, connectivity): 
6135def collectElemConnectivity(exodusHandle, connectivity):
6136    """
6137      This function generates a list of lists that represent the element connectivity.
6138
6139    Usage:
6140    ------
6141    >>> with exodus("file.g", "r") as exodusHandle:
6142    >>>     connectivity = []
6143    >>>     collectElemConnectivity(exodusHandle, connectivity)
6144    """
6145
6146    if not isinstance(connectivity, list):
6147        raise Exception(
6148            "ERROR: connectivity is not a list in call to collectElemConnectivity().")
6149    if connectivity:
6150        raise Exception(
6151            "ERROR: connectivity is not empty in call to collectElemConnectivity().")
6152
6153    blockIds = exodusHandle.get_ids('EX_ELEM_BLOCK')
6154    for blId in blockIds:
6155        (elem_block_conn, num_elem, num_nodes) = exodusHandle.get_elem_connectivity(blId)
6156        for k in range(num_elem):
6157            i = k * num_nodes
6158            j = i + num_nodes
6159            local_elem_conn = elem_block_conn[i:j]
6160            connectivity.append(local_elem_conn)

This function generates a list of lists that represent the element connectivity.

Usage:

>>> with exodus("file.g", "r") as exodusHandle:
>>>     connectivity = []
>>>     collectElemConnectivity(exodusHandle, connectivity)
def collectLocalNodeToLocalElems(exodusHandle, connectivity, localNodeToLocalElems): 
6163def collectLocalNodeToLocalElems(
6164        exodusHandle,
6165        connectivity,
6166        localNodeToLocalElems):
6167    """
6168      This function generates a list of lists to go from local node id
6169      to local elem id.
6170
6171    Usage:
6172    ------
6173    >>> connectivity = [] ## If this is not empty it will assume it is already filled.
6174    >>> localNodeToLocalElems = []
6175    >>> with exodus("file.g", "r") as exodusHandle:
6176    >>>     collectLocalNodeToLocalElems(exodusHandle, connectivity, localNodeToLocalElems)
6177    """
6178
6179    if not isinstance(connectivity, list):
6180        raise Exception(
6181            "ERROR: connectivity is not a list in call to collectLocalNodeToLocalElems().")
6182    if not isinstance(localNodeToLocalElems, list):
6183        raise Exception(
6184            "ERROR: localNodeToLocalElems is not a list in call to collectLocalNodeToLocalElems().")
6185    if localNodeToLocalElems:
6186        raise Exception(
6187            "ERROR: localNodeToLocalElems is not empty in call to collectLocalNodeToLocalElems().")
6188
6189    if not connectivity:
6190        collectElemConnectivity(exodusHandle, connectivity)
6191
6192    numNodes = exodusHandle.num_nodes()
6193    for _i in range(numNodes + 1):
6194        localNodeToLocalElems.append([])
6195
6196    localElemId = 0
6197    for local_elem_conn in connectivity:
6198        for n in local_elem_conn:
6199            localNodeToLocalElems[n].append(localElemId)
6200        localElemId = localElemId + 1

This function generates a list of lists to go from local node id to local elem id.

Usage:

>>> connectivity = [] ## If this is not empty it will assume it is already filled.
>>> localNodeToLocalElems = []
>>> with exodus("file.g", "r") as exodusHandle:
>>>     collectLocalNodeToLocalElems(exodusHandle, connectivity, localNodeToLocalElems)
def collectLocalElemToLocalElems( exodusHandle, connectivity, localNodeToLocalElems, localElemToLocalElems): 
6203def collectLocalElemToLocalElems(
6204        exodusHandle,
6205        connectivity,
6206        localNodeToLocalElems,
6207        localElemToLocalElems):
6208    """
6209      This function generates a list of lists to go from local elem id
6210      to connected local elem ids.
6211
6212    Usage:
6213    ------
6214    >>> connectivity = [] ## If this is not empty it will assume it is already filled.
6215    >>> localNodeToLocalElems = [] ## If this is not empty it will assume it is already filled.
6216    >>> localElemToLocalElems = []
6217    >>> with exodus("file.g", "r") as exodusHandle:
6218    >>>     collectLocalElemToLocalElems(exodusHandle, connectivity, localNodeToLocalElems,
6219    ...                              localElemToLocalElems)
6220    """
6221
6222    if not isinstance(connectivity, list):
6223        raise Exception(
6224            "ERROR: connectivity is not a list in call to collectLocalElemToLocalElems().")
6225    if not isinstance(localNodeToLocalElems, list):
6226        raise Exception(
6227            "ERROR: localNodeToLocalElems is not a list in call to collectLocalElemToLocalElems().")
6228    if not isinstance(localElemToLocalElems, list):
6229        raise Exception(
6230            "ERROR: localElemToLocalElems is not a list in call to collectLocalElemToLocalElems().")
6231    if localElemToLocalElems:
6232        raise Exception(
6233            "ERROR: localElemToLocalElems is not empty in call to collectLocalElemToLocalElems().")
6234
6235    if not connectivity:
6236        collectElemConnectivity(exodusHandle, connectivity)
6237    if not localNodeToLocalElems:
6238        collectLocalNodeToLocalElems(
6239            exodusHandle, connectivity, localNodeToLocalElems)
6240
6241    numElems = exodusHandle.num_elems()
6242    for _i in range(numElems):
6243        localElemToLocalElems.append([])
6244    for localElemId in range(numElems):
6245        nodeList = list(connectivity[localElemId])
6246        newConnectedElems = []
6247        for n in nodeList:
6248            newConnectedElems.extend(iter(localNodeToLocalElems[n]))
6249        localElemToLocalElems[localElemId] = list(set(newConnectedElems))

This function generates a list of lists to go from local elem id to connected local elem ids.

Usage:

>>> connectivity = [] ## If this is not empty it will assume it is already filled.
>>> localNodeToLocalElems = [] ## If this is not empty it will assume it is already filled.
>>> localElemToLocalElems = []
>>> with exodus("file.g", "r") as exodusHandle:
>>>     collectLocalElemToLocalElems(exodusHandle, connectivity, localNodeToLocalElems,
...                              localElemToLocalElems)
def copy_mesh( fromFileName, toFileName, exoFromObj=None, additionalElementAttributes=None, array_type='ctype'): 
6252def copy_mesh(fromFileName, toFileName, exoFromObj=None, additionalElementAttributes=None, array_type='ctype'):
6253    """
6254    Copies the mesh data from an existing exodus database to a new exodus
6255    database.
6256
6257    Parameters
6258    ----------
6259    fromFileName : string
6260        File name of the exodus mesh to be copied
6261    toFileName : string
6262        File name of the new exodus mesh
6263    exoFromObj : exodus object, optional
6264        Exodus object to be copied from.  If an exodus object is supplied, the
6265        fromFileName string will be ignored.
6266    additionalElementAttributes : list
6267        list of element attribute names to add to all blocks or tuples
6268        ( name, blkIds ) where name is the element attribute to add and blkIds is
6269        a list of blkIds to add it to.
6270    array_type : 'ctype' | 'numpy'
6271        Specifies whether arrays will be imported and copied as ctype or numpy
6272        arrays.  (This option should make no difference to the user, but it can
6273        be used by developers to test whether the commands within this function
6274        handle both array types correctly.)
6275
6276    Returns
6277    -------
6278    exo_to : exodus object
6279        New exodus mesh
6280
6281    Note:
6282    -----
6283    This function also allows one to add new element attributes during the copy
6284    process.  The number of element attributes is permanently set when the
6285    block is created, meaning new element attributes can only be added to an
6286    existing mesh by copying it to a new mesh.  The values of the element
6287    attributes are set to their defaults so that the user can populate them
6288    later.
6289    """
6290    if additionalElementAttributes is None:
6291        additionalElementAttributes = []
6292    # If the user did not supply a exodus object to copy from, attempt to read an
6293    # exodus database with the name "fromFileName"
6294    if exoFromObj is None:
6295        exoFrom = exodus(fromFileName, "r", array_type=array_type)
6296    else:
6297        exoFrom = exoFromObj
6298
6299    if os.path.isfile(toFileName):
6300        raise Exception(
6301            "ERROR: ",
6302            toFileName,
6303            " file already exists cowardly exiting instead of overwriting in call to copy_mesh().")
6304
6305    title = exoFrom.title().encode('ascii')
6306    ex_pars = ex_init_params(num_dim=exoFrom.num_dimensions(),
6307                             num_nodes=exoFrom.num_nodes(),
6308                             num_elem=exoFrom.num_elems(),
6309                             num_elem_blk=exoFrom.num_blks(),
6310                             num_node_sets=exoFrom.num_node_sets(),
6311                             num_side_sets=exoFrom.num_side_sets(),
6312                             num_assembly=exoFrom.num_assembly(),
6313                             num_blob=exoFrom.num_blob())
6314
6315    exo_to = exodus(toFileName, mode="w", array_type=array_type,
6316                    title=title, init_params=ex_pars)
6317
6318    debugPrint = False
6319    if debugPrint:
6320        print("Transfer QA records")
6321    qaRecords = exoFrom.get_qa_records()
6322    exo_to.put_qa_records(qaRecords)
6323
6324    if debugPrint:
6325        print("Transfer Nodal Coordinates and Names")
6326    exo_to.put_coord_names(exoFrom.get_coord_names())
6327    (xCoords, yCoords, zCoords) = exoFrom.get_coords()
6328    exo_to.put_coords(xCoords, yCoords, zCoords)
6329
6330    if debugPrint:
6331        print("Transfer Node Id Map")
6332    nodeIdMap = exoFrom.get_node_id_map()
6333    exo_to.put_node_id_map(nodeIdMap)
6334
6335    if debugPrint:
6336        print("Construct mapping from block ID to element attribute data")
6337    # The exodus library does not provide a way to add only new element
6338    # attributes, so we must collect both the new and the old element
6339    # attributes
6340    e_attr_names = {}
6341    e_attr_vals = {}
6342    # Collect the old element attribute names and the number of elements in each
6343    # block
6344    blk_ids = exoFrom.get_ids('EX_ELEM_BLOCK')
6345    blk_num_elem = {}
6346    for blk_id in blk_ids:
6347        (elemType, numElem, nodesPerElem, numAttr) = exoFrom.elem_blk_info(blk_id)
6348        e_attr_names[blk_id] = []
6349        e_attr_vals[blk_id] = []
6350        if numAttr > 0:
6351            e_attr_names[blk_id].extend(
6352                exoFrom.get_attribute_names('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', blk_id))
6353            e_attr_vals[blk_id].extend(exoFrom.get_elem_attr(blk_id))
6354        blk_num_elem[blk_id] = numElem
6355    # Collect the new element attribute names
6356    # (The new names are mapped from "attribute name" to "list of block IDs that
6357    # contain that attribute".  We need to have them be mapped as "block ID" to
6358    # "list of attribute names contained in that block".)
6359    for item in additionalElementAttributes:
6360        if isinstance(item, tuple):
6361            e_attr_name = item[0]
6362            e_attr_blk_ids = item[1]
6363        elif isinstance(item, str):
6364            e_attr_name = item
6365            e_attr_blk_ids = blk_ids
6366        else:
6367            print(f"Warning additional element attribute item {item} is not right type to add.")
6368
6369            print("should be a string or tuple, skipping")
6370        for blk_id in e_attr_blk_ids:
6371            if blk_id in blk_ids:
6372                e_attr_names[blk_id].append(e_attr_name)
6373                # Concatenate all element attribute values into a single big list,
6374                # because that is format required by exo.put_elem_attr().
6375                e_attr_vals[blk_id].extend([0.0] * blk_num_elem[blk_id])
6376
6377    if debugPrint:
6378        print("Transfer Element Data")
6379    blkIds = exoFrom.get_ids('EX_ELEM_BLOCK')
6380    for blkId in blkIds:
6381        (elemType, numElem, nodesPerElem, _oldnumAttr) = exoFrom.elem_blk_info(blkId)
6382        numAttr = len(e_attr_names[blkId])
6383        exo_to.put_elem_blk_info(blkId, elemType, numElem, nodesPerElem, numAttr)
6384        (connectivity, numElem, nodesPerElem) = exoFrom.get_elem_connectivity(blkId)
6385        exo_to.put_elem_connectivity(blkId, connectivity)
6386        if numAttr > 0:
6387            exo_to.put_attribute_names('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', blkId, e_attr_names[blkId])
6388            exo_to.put_elem_attr(blkId, e_attr_vals[blkId])
6389        elemProps = exoFrom.get_element_property_names()
6390        for elemProp in elemProps:
6391            propVal = exoFrom.get_element_property_value(blkId, elemProp)
6392            if elemProp == "ID" and propVal == blkId:
6393                continue
6394            else:
6395                exo_to.put_element_property_value(blkId, elemProp, propVal)
6396        blockName = exoFrom.get_name('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', blkId)
6397        exo_to.put_name('EX_ELEM_BLOCK', blkId, blockName)
6398
6399    if debugPrint:
6400        print("Transfer Element Id Map")
6401    elemIdMap = exoFrom.get_elem_id_map()
6402    exo_to.put_elem_id_map(elemIdMap)
6403
6404    if debugPrint:
6405        print("Transfer Node Sets")
6406    if exoFrom.num_node_sets() > 0:
6407        nodeSetProps = exoFrom.get_node_set_property_names()
6408        nodeSetIds = exoFrom.get_ids('EX_NODE_SET')
6409        for nsId in nodeSetIds:
6410            (numSetNodes, numSetDistFacts) = exoFrom.get_set_params('EX_NODE_SET', nsId)
6411            exo_to.put_node_set_params(nsId, numSetNodes, numSetDistFacts)
6412            nsNodes = exoFrom.get_node_set_nodes(nsId)
6413            exo_to.put_node_set(nsId, nsNodes)
6414            if numSetDistFacts > 0:
6415                nsDF = exoFrom.get_node_set_dist_facts(nsId)
6416                exo_to.put_node_set_dist_fact(nsId, nsDF)
6417            nodeSetName = exoFrom.get_name('EX_NODE_SET', nsId)
6418            exo_to.put_name('EX_NODE_SET', nsId, nodeSetName)
6419            for nodeSetProp in nodeSetProps:
6420                propVal = exoFrom.get_node_set_property_value(
6421                    nsId, nodeSetProp)
6422                if nodeSetProp == "ID" and propVal == nsId:
6423                    continue
6424                else:
6425                    exo_to.put_node_set_property_value(
6426                        nsId, nodeSetProp, propVal)
6427
6428    if debugPrint:
6429        print("Transfer Side Sets")
6430    if exoFrom.num_side_sets() > 0:
6431        sideSetProps = exoFrom.get_side_set_property_names()
6432        sideSetIds = exoFrom.get_ids('EX_SIDE_SET')
6433        for ssId in sideSetIds:
6434            (numSetSides, numSetDistFacts) = exoFrom.get_set_params('EX_SIDE_SET', ssId)
6435            exo_to.put_side_set_params(ssId, numSetSides, numSetDistFacts)
6436            (elemList, sideList) = exoFrom.get_side_set(ssId)
6437            exo_to.put_side_set(ssId, elemList, sideList)
6438            if numSetDistFacts > 0:
6439                ssDF = exoFrom.get_side_set_dist_fact(ssId)
6440                exo_to.put_side_set_dist_fact(ssId, ssDF)
6441            sideSetName = exoFrom.get_name('EX_SIDE_SET', ssId)
6442            exo_to.put_name('EX_SIDE_SET', ssId, sideSetName)
6443            for sideSetProp in sideSetProps:
6444                propVal = exoFrom.get_side_set_property_value(
6445                    ssId, sideSetProp)
6446                if sideSetProp == "ID" and propVal == ssId:
6447                    continue
6448                else:
6449                    exo_to.put_side_set_property_value(
6450                        ssId, sideSetProp, propVal)
6451
6452    # If the user did not supply an exodus object to copy from, then close the
6453    # database.
6454    if exoFromObj is None:
6455        exoFrom.close()
6456
6457    return exo_to

Copies the mesh data from an existing exodus database to a new exodus database.

Parameters

fromFileName : string File name of the exodus mesh to be copied toFileName : string File name of the new exodus mesh exoFromObj : exodus object, optional Exodus object to be copied from. If an exodus object is supplied, the fromFileName string will be ignored. additionalElementAttributes : list list of element attribute names to add to all blocks or tuples ( name, blkIds ) where name is the element attribute to add and blkIds is a list of blkIds to add it to. array_type : 'ctype' | 'numpy' Specifies whether arrays will be imported and copied as ctype or numpy arrays. (This option should make no difference to the user, but it can be used by developers to test whether the commands within this function handle both array types correctly.)

Returns

exo_to : exodus object New exodus mesh

Note:

This function also allows one to add new element attributes during the copy process. The number of element attributes is permanently set when the block is created, meaning new element attributes can only be added to an existing mesh by copying it to a new mesh. The values of the element attributes are set to their defaults so that the user can populate them later.

def transfer_variables( exoFrom, exo_to, array_type='ctype', additionalGlobalVariables=None, additionalNodalVariables=None, additionalElementVariables=None, additionalNodeSetVariables=None, additionalSideSetVariables=None): 
6460def transfer_variables(exoFrom, exo_to, array_type='ctype', additionalGlobalVariables=None, additionalNodalVariables=None, additionalElementVariables=None, additionalNodeSetVariables=None, additionalSideSetVariables=None):
6461    """
6462    This function transfers variables from `exoFrom` to `exo_to` and allows
6463    additional variables to be added with `additionalGlobalVariables`,
6464    `additionalNodalVariables`, and `additionalElementVariables`.  Additional
6465    variables values are set to their defaults so that the user can populate
6466    them later.
6467
6468    Parameters
6469    ----------
6470    exoFrom : exodus database object
6471        exodus object to transfer from
6472
6473    exo_to : exodus database object
6474        exodus object to transfer to
6475
6476    additionalGlobalVariables : list
6477        list of global variable names to add.
6478
6479    additionalNodalVariables : list
6480        list of nodal variable names to add.
6481
6482    additionalElementVariables : list
6483        should be a list of element variable names to add to all blocks or
6484        tuples `(name, blkIds)` where `name` is the element variable to add
6485        and `blkIds` is a list of block ids to add it to.
6486    """
6487    if additionalGlobalVariables is None:
6488        additionalGlobalVariables = []
6489    if additionalNodalVariables is None:
6490        additionalNodalVariables = []
6491    if additionalElementVariables is None:
6492        additionalElementVariables = []
6493    if additionalNodeSetVariables is None:
6494        additionalNodeSetVariables = []
6495    if additionalSideSetVariables is None:
6496        additionalSideSetVariables = []
6497    # IDEA: It may make sense to make transfer_variables() strictly transfer
6498    # variables, and use add_variables() to add new variables.  Alternatively,
6499    # add_variables() could be called within transfer_variables() to add
6500    # new variables to the exo_to database.  Either way, we should minimize
6501    # duplicate code if possible.
6502
6503    debugPrint = False
6504
6505    if not isinstance(additionalGlobalVariables, list):
6506        raise Exception("ERROR: additionalGlobalVariables is not a list.")
6507    if not isinstance(additionalNodalVariables, list):
6508        raise Exception("ERROR: additionalNodalVariables is not a list.")
6509    if not isinstance(additionalElementVariables, list):
6510        raise Exception("ERROR: additionalElementVariables is not a list.")
6511    if not isinstance(additionalNodeSetVariables, list):
6512        raise Exception("ERROR: additionalNodeSetVariables is not a list.")
6513    if not isinstance(additionalSideSetVariables, list):
6514        raise Exception("ERROR: additionalSideSetVariables is not a list.")
6515
6516    if debugPrint:
6517        print("Transfer Info records")
6518    numInfoRecs = exoFrom.num_info_records()
6519    if numInfoRecs > 0:
6520        infoRecs = exoFrom.get_info_records()
6521        exo_to.put_info_records(infoRecs)
6522    if debugPrint:
6523        print("Transfer time values")
6524
6525    nSteps = exoFrom.num_times()
6526    if nSteps == 0:
6527        return exo_to
6528
6529    timeVals = exoFrom.get_times()
6530    for step in range(nSteps):
6531        exo_to.put_time(step + 1, timeVals[step])
6532
6533    if debugPrint:
6534        print("Add Global Variables")
6535    nNewGlobalVars = len(additionalGlobalVariables)
6536    nGlobalVars = exoFrom.get_variable_number('EX_GLOBAL') + nNewGlobalVars
6537    defaultNewVarVals = [0.0 for _ in range(nNewGlobalVars)]
6538    if nGlobalVars > 0:
6539        exo_to.set_variable_number('EX_GLOBAL', nGlobalVars)
6540        gVarNames = exoFrom.get_variable_names('EX_GLOBAL')
6541        gVarNames.extend(additionalGlobalVariables)
6542        for nameIndex in range(nGlobalVars):
6543            globalVarName = gVarNames[nameIndex]
6544            exo_to.put_variable_name('EX_GLOBAL', globalVarName, nameIndex + 1)
6545        for step in range(nSteps):
6546            gValues = exoFrom.get_all_global_variable_values(step + 1)
6547            if array_type == 'numpy':
6548                gValues = exo_to.np.append(gValues, defaultNewVarVals)
6549            else:
6550                gValues.extend(defaultNewVarVals)
6551            exo_to.put_all_global_variable_values(step + 1, gValues)
6552
6553    if debugPrint:
6554        print("Add Nodal Variables")
6555    nNewNodalVars = len(additionalNodalVariables)
6556    nOrigNodalVars = exoFrom.get_variable_number('EX_NODAL')
6557    nNodalVars = nOrigNodalVars + nNewNodalVars
6558    if nNodalVars > 0:
6559        exo_to.set_variable_number('EX_NODAL', nNodalVars)
6560        nVarNames = exoFrom.get_variable_names('EX_NODAL')
6561        nVarNames.extend(additionalNodalVariables)
6562        for nameIndex in range(nNodalVars):
6563            nodalVarName = nVarNames[nameIndex]
6564            exo_to.put_variable_name('EX_NODAL', nodalVarName, nameIndex + 1)
6565            if nameIndex < nOrigNodalVars:
6566                for step in range(nSteps):
6567                    nValues = exoFrom.get_node_variable_values(
6568                        nodalVarName, step + 1)
6569                    exo_to.put_node_variable_values(
6570                        nodalVarName, step + 1, nValues)
6571
6572    internal_transfer_variables(exoFrom, exo_to, 'EX_ELEM_BLOCK', additionalElementVariables, debugPrint)
6573    internal_transfer_variables(exoFrom, exo_to, 'EX_NODE_SET', additionalNodeSetVariables, debugPrint)
6574    internal_transfer_variables(exoFrom, exo_to, 'EX_SIDE_SET', additionalSideSetVariables, debugPrint)
6575    return exo_to

This function transfers variables from exoFrom to exo_to and allows additional variables to be added with additionalGlobalVariables, additionalNodalVariables, and additionalElementVariables. Additional variables values are set to their defaults so that the user can populate them later.

Parameters

exoFrom : exodus database object exodus object to transfer from

exo_to : exodus database object exodus object to transfer to

additionalGlobalVariables : list list of global variable names to add.

additionalNodalVariables : list list of nodal variable names to add.

additionalElementVariables : list should be a list of element variable names to add to all blocks or tuples (name, blkIds) where name is the element variable to add and blkIds is a list of block ids to add it to.

def internal_transfer_variables(exoFrom, exo_to, obj_type, additionalVariables, debugPrint): 
6578def internal_transfer_variables(exoFrom, exo_to, obj_type, additionalVariables, debugPrint):
6579    """ Internal support function for `exodus.transfer_variables` """
6580    if debugPrint:
6581        print("Construct Truth Table for additionalVariables")
6582    blkIds = exoFrom.get_ids(obj_type)
6583    numBlks = len(blkIds)
6584    newVariableNames = []
6585    newVariableBlocks = []
6586    for item in additionalVariables:
6587        if isinstance(item, tuple):
6588            newVariableNames.append(item[0])
6589            inBlks = [blkId for blkId in item[1] if blkId in blkIds]
6590            newVariableBlocks.append(inBlks)
6591        elif isinstance(item, str):
6592            newVariableNames.append(item)
6593            newVariableBlocks.append(blkIds)
6594        else:
6595            print(("Warning additionalVariable item ",
6596                   item, " is not right type to add."))
6597            print("should be a string or tuple, skipping")
6598
6599    nSteps = exoFrom.num_times()
6600    if debugPrint:
6601        print("Add Variables")
6602    nNewVars = len(newVariableNames)
6603    nOrigVars = exoFrom.get_variable_number(obj_type)
6604    nVars = nOrigVars + nNewVars
6605    if nVars > 0:
6606        exo_to.set_variable_number(obj_type, nVars)
6607        origVarNames = exoFrom.get_variable_names(obj_type)
6608        origVarNames.extend(newVariableNames)
6609        truthTable = []
6610        if nOrigVars > 0:
6611            truthTable = exoFrom.get_variable_truth_table(obj_type)
6612        if nNewVars > 0:
6613            newTruth = []
6614            for j in range(numBlks):
6615
6616                for k in range(nOrigVars):
6617                    index = j * nOrigVars + k
6618                    newTruth.append(truthTable[index])
6619                for m in range(nNewVars):
6620                    if blkIds[j] in newVariableBlocks[m]:
6621                        newTruth.append(True)
6622                    else:
6623                        newTruth.append(False)
6624            truthTable = newTruth
6625        exo_to.set_variable_truth_table(obj_type, truthTable)
6626        for nameIndex in range(nVars):
6627            varName = origVarNames[nameIndex]
6628            exo_to.put_variable_name(obj_type, varName, nameIndex + 1)
6629        truthIndex = 0
6630        for blkId in blkIds:
6631            for origVarName in origVarNames:
6632                if truthTable[truthIndex]:
6633                    for step in range(nSteps):
6634                        eValues = exoFrom.get_variable_values(obj_type, blkId,
6635                                                              origVarName, step + 1)
6636                        exo_to.put_variable_values(obj_type, blkId,
6637                                                   origVarName, step + 1, eValues)
6638                truthIndex = truthIndex + 1
6639            truthIndex = truthIndex + nNewVars

Internal support function for exodus.transfer_variables

def add_variables( exo, global_vars=None, nodal_vars=None, element_vars=None, node_set_vars=None, side_set_vars=None): 
6642def add_variables(exo, global_vars=None, nodal_vars=None, element_vars=None, node_set_vars=None, side_set_vars=None):
6643    """
6644    This function adds variables to the exodus object.  The values of the
6645    variables are set to their defaults so that the user can populate them later.
6646
6647    Parameters
6648    ----------
6649    exo : exodus database object
6650        Exodus database that variables will be added to.
6651    global_vars : list
6652        global variable names to add.
6653    nodal_vars : list
6654        nodal variable names to add.
6655    element_vars : list
6656        list of element variable names to add to all blocks or tuples
6657        ( name, blkIds ) where name is the element variable to add and blkIds is
6658        a list of blkIds to add it to.
6659    node_set_vars : list
6660        list of node set variable names to add to all sets or tuples
6661        ( name, setIds ) where name is the node set variable to add and `setIds` is
6662        a list of `setIds` to add it to.
6663    side_set_vars : list
6664        list of side set variable names to add to all sets or tuples
6665        ( name, setIds ) where name is the side set variable to add and `setIds` is
6666        a list of `setIds` to add it to.
6667
6668    Returns
6669    -------
6670    exo : exodus database object
6671        Exodus database with variables added to it.  (The values of the variables
6672        are set to their defaults so that the user can populate them later.)
6673
6674    Note
6675    ----
6676    This function does not allow one to add element attributes to an exodus
6677    database.  See `exodus.copy_mesh` function for that capability.
6678    """
6679    if global_vars is None:
6680        global_vars = []
6681    if nodal_vars is None:
6682        nodal_vars = []
6683    if element_vars is None:
6684        element_vars = []
6685    if node_set_vars is None:
6686        node_set_vars = []
6687    if side_set_vars is None:
6688        side_set_vars = []
6689    debugPrint = False
6690
6691    if not isinstance(global_vars, list):
6692        raise Exception("ERROR: global_vars is not a list.")
6693    if not isinstance(nodal_vars, list):
6694        raise Exception("ERROR: nodal_vars is not a list.")
6695    if not isinstance(element_vars, list):
6696        raise Exception("ERROR: element_vars is not a list.")
6697    if not isinstance(node_set_vars, list):
6698        raise Exception("ERROR: node_set_vars is not a list.")
6699    if not isinstance(side_set_vars, list):
6700        raise Exception("ERROR: side_set_vars is not a list.")
6701
6702    if exo.modeChar == 'r':
6703        raise Exception(
6704            "ERROR: variables cannot be added to an exodus object in read only mode")
6705
6706    if debugPrint:
6707        print("Add Global Variables")
6708    n_new_vars = len(global_vars)
6709    n_old_vars = exo.get_variable_number('EX_GLOBAL')
6710    n_vars = n_old_vars + n_new_vars
6711    default_vals = [0.0] * n_new_vars
6712    if n_new_vars > 0:
6713        exo.set_variable_number('EX_GLOBAL', n_vars)
6714        for i, var_name in enumerate(global_vars):
6715            exo.put_variable_name('EX_GLOBAL', var_name, n_old_vars + i + 1)
6716        # One might wish to put all the values for a given global variable in the
6717        # database at once, but exo.put_global_variable_value() ends up loading
6718        # all the global variables for a given step and then putting them all back
6719        # in, so we might as well just use
6720        # exo.put_all_global_variable_values().
6721        nSteps = exo.num_times()
6722        for step in range(nSteps):
6723            gValues = exo.get_all_global_variable_values(step + 1)
6724            if exo.use_numpy:
6725                gValues = exo.np.append(gValues, default_vals)
6726            else:
6727                gValues.extend(default_vals)
6728            exo.put_all_global_variable_values(step + 1, gValues)
6729
6730    if debugPrint:
6731        print("Add Nodal Variables")
6732    n_new_vars = len(nodal_vars)
6733    n_old_vars = exo.get_variable_number('EX_NODAL')
6734    n_vars = n_old_vars + n_new_vars
6735    if n_new_vars > 0:
6736        exo.set_variable_number('EX_NODAL', n_vars)
6737        for i, var_name in enumerate(nodal_vars):
6738            exo.put_variable_name('EX_NODAL', var_name, i + n_old_vars + 1)
6739
6740    internal_add_variables(exo, 'EX_ELEM_BLOCK', element_vars, debugPrint)
6741    internal_add_variables(exo, 'EX_NODE_SET', node_set_vars, debugPrint)
6742    internal_add_variables(exo, 'EX_SIDE_SET', side_set_vars, debugPrint)
6743
6744    return exo

This function adds variables to the exodus object. The values of the variables are set to their defaults so that the user can populate them later.

Parameters

exo : exodus database object Exodus database that variables will be added to. global_vars : list global variable names to add. nodal_vars : list nodal variable names to add. element_vars : list list of element variable names to add to all blocks or tuples ( name, blkIds ) where name is the element variable to add and blkIds is a list of blkIds to add it to. node_set_vars : list list of node set variable names to add to all sets or tuples ( name, setIds ) where name is the node set variable to add and setIds is a list of setIds to add it to. side_set_vars : list list of side set variable names to add to all sets or tuples ( name, setIds ) where name is the side set variable to add and setIds is a list of setIds to add it to.

Returns

exo : exodus database object Exodus database with variables added to it. (The values of the variables are set to their defaults so that the user can populate them later.)

Note

This function does not allow one to add element attributes to an exodus database. See exodus.copy_mesh function for that capability.

def internal_add_variables(exo, obj_type, entvars, debugPrint): 
6747def internal_add_variables(exo, obj_type, entvars, debugPrint):
6748    """ Internal support function for `exodus.add_variables` """
6749
6750    if len(entvars) == 0:
6751        return
6752
6753    if debugPrint:
6754        print("Construct Truth Table for additional variables")
6755
6756    new_var_blks = []
6757    blk_ids = exo.get_ids(obj_type)
6758    new_var_names = []
6759    for item in entvars:
6760        if isinstance(item, tuple):
6761            new_var_names.append(item[0])
6762            in_blks = [blk_id for blk_id in item[1] if blk_id in blk_ids]
6763            new_var_blks.append(in_blks)
6764        elif isinstance(item, str):
6765            new_var_names.append(item)
6766            new_var_blks.append(blk_ids)
6767        else:
6768            print(f"Warning additional variable item {item} is not right type to add.")
6769            print("should be a string or tuple, skipping")
6770
6771    if debugPrint:
6772        print("Add Variables")
6773    n_new_vars = len(new_var_names)
6774    if n_new_vars > 0:
6775        n_old_vars = exo.get_variable_number(obj_type)
6776        n_vars = n_old_vars + n_new_vars
6777        exo.set_variable_number(obj_type, n_vars)
6778        old_truth_table = []
6779        if n_old_vars > 0:
6780            old_truth_table = exo.get_variable_truth_table(obj_type)
6781        truth_table = []
6782        n_blks = len(blk_ids)
6783        for j in range(n_blks):
6784            for k in range(n_old_vars):
6785                ndx = j * n_old_vars + k
6786                truth_table.append(old_truth_table[ndx])
6787            for m in range(n_new_vars):
6788                if blk_ids[j] in new_var_blks[m]:
6789                    truth_table.append(True)
6790                else:
6791                    truth_table.append(False)
6792        exo.set_variable_truth_table(obj_type, truth_table)
6793        for i, var_name in enumerate(new_var_names):
6794            exo.put_variable_name(obj_type, var_name, n_old_vars + i + 1)

Internal support function for exodus.add_variables

def copyTransfer( fromFileName, toFileName, array_type='ctype', additionalGlobalVariables=None, additionalNodalVariables=None, additionalElementVariables=None, additionalNodeSetVariables=None, additionalSideSetVariables=None, additionalElementAttributes=None): 
6797def copyTransfer(fromFileName, toFileName, array_type='ctype', additionalGlobalVariables=None, additionalNodalVariables=None, additionalElementVariables=None, additionalNodeSetVariables=None, additionalSideSetVariables=None, additionalElementAttributes=None):
6798    """
6799    This function creates an exodus file `toFileName` and copies
6800    everything from exodus file `fromFileName` returning a file handle
6801    to `toFileName`.
6802
6803    Additional space is allocated for `additionalGlobalVariables`,
6804    `additionalNodalVariables` and `additionalElementVariables` if
6805    specified.
6806
6807    Parameters
6808    ----------
6809    fromFileName : string
6810        File name of the exodus mesh to be copied
6811    toFileName : string
6812        File name of the new exodus mesh
6813    array_type : 'ctype' | 'numpy'
6814        Specifies whether arrays will be imported and copied as ctype or numpy
6815        arrays.  (This option should make no difference to the user, but it can
6816        be used by developers to test whether the commands within this function
6817        handle both array types correctly.)
6818    additionalGlobalVariables : list
6819        list of global variable names to add.
6820    additionalNodalVariables: list
6821        list of nodal variable names to add.
6822    additionalElementVariables: list
6823        should be a list of element variable
6824        names to add to all blocks or tuples (name, blkIds) where name is
6825        the element variable to add and blkIds is a list of blkIds to add
6826        it to.
6827    additionalElementAttributes: list
6828        list of element attribute names to
6829         add to all blocks or tuples ( name, blkIds ) where name is the
6830         element attribute to add and blkIds is a list of blkIds to add it
6831         to.
6832
6833    Usage:
6834    ------
6835    >>> fromFileName = "input.e"
6836    >>> toFileName = "output.e"
6837    >>> addGlobalVariables = [] ## Do not add any new global variables
6838    >>> ## Add node_dummy1 and node_dummy2 as new node variables
6839    >>> addNodeVariables = ["node_dummy1", "node_dummy2"]
6840    >>> ## Add elem_dummy1 on blkIds 1, 2, 3 and elem_dummy2 on all blocks
6841    >>> addElementVariables = [ ("elem_dummy1", [1, 2, 3]), "elem_dummy2" ]
6842    >>> ## Add elem_attr_dummy1 on blkIds 1,2,3 and elem_attr_dummy2 on all blocks
6843    >>> addElementAttributes = [ ("elem_attr_dummy1",[1,2,3]), "elem_attr_dummy2" ]
6844
6845    >>> toFileHandle = copyTransfer(fromFileName,toFileName,addGlobalVariables,addNodeVariables,
6846    ...                             addElementVariables,addElementAttributes)
6847
6848    >>> ## Fill in new variables
6849
6850    >>> toFileHandle.close()
6851    """
6852
6853    if additionalGlobalVariables is None:
6854        additionalGlobalVariables = []
6855    if additionalNodalVariables is None:
6856        additionalNodalVariables = []
6857    if additionalElementVariables is None:
6858        additionalElementVariables = []
6859    if additionalNodeSetVariables is None:
6860        additionalNodeSetVariables = []
6861    if additionalSideSetVariables is None:
6862        additionalSideSetVariables = []
6863    if additionalElementAttributes is None:
6864        additionalElementAttributes = []
6865    with exodus(fromFileName, "r", array_type=array_type) as exoFrom:
6866        exo_to = copy_mesh(fromFileName, toFileName, exoFromObj=exoFrom,
6867                           additionalElementAttributes=additionalElementAttributes,
6868                           array_type=array_type)
6869
6870        exo_to = transfer_variables(
6871            exoFrom,
6872            exo_to,
6873            additionalGlobalVariables=additionalGlobalVariables,
6874            additionalNodalVariables=additionalNodalVariables,
6875            additionalElementVariables=additionalElementVariables,
6876            additionalNodeSetVariables=additionalNodeSetVariables,
6877            additionalSideSetVariables=additionalSideSetVariables,
6878            array_type=array_type)
6879
6880    return exo_to

This function creates an exodus file toFileName and copies everything from exodus file fromFileName returning a file handle to toFileName.

Additional space is allocated for additionalGlobalVariables, additionalNodalVariables and additionalElementVariables if specified.

Parameters

fromFileName : string File name of the exodus mesh to be copied toFileName : string File name of the new exodus mesh array_type : 'ctype' | 'numpy' Specifies whether arrays will be imported and copied as ctype or numpy arrays. (This option should make no difference to the user, but it can be used by developers to test whether the commands within this function handle both array types correctly.) additionalGlobalVariables : list list of global variable names to add. additionalNodalVariables: list list of nodal variable names to add. additionalElementVariables: list should be a list of element variable names to add to all blocks or tuples (name, blkIds) where name is the element variable to add and blkIds is a list of blkIds to add it to. additionalElementAttributes: list list of element attribute names to add to all blocks or tuples ( name, blkIds ) where name is the element attribute to add and blkIds is a list of blkIds to add it to.

Usage:

>>> fromFileName = "input.e"
>>> toFileName = "output.e"
>>> addGlobalVariables = [] ## Do not add any new global variables
>>> ## Add node_dummy1 and node_dummy2 as new node variables
>>> addNodeVariables = ["node_dummy1", "node_dummy2"]
>>> ## Add elem_dummy1 on blkIds 1, 2, 3 and elem_dummy2 on all blocks
>>> addElementVariables = [ ("elem_dummy1", [1, 2, 3]), "elem_dummy2" ]
>>> ## Add elem_attr_dummy1 on blkIds 1,2,3 and elem_attr_dummy2 on all blocks
>>> addElementAttributes = [ ("elem_attr_dummy1",[1,2,3]), "elem_attr_dummy2" ]

>>> toFileHandle = copyTransfer(fromFileName,toFileName,addGlobalVariables,addNodeVariables,
...                             addElementVariables,addElementAttributes)

>>> ## Fill in new variables

>>> toFileHandle.close()
def ctype_to_numpy(exo, c_array): 
6883def ctype_to_numpy(exo, c_array):
6884    """
6885    Converts a c-type array into a numpy array
6886
6887    Parameters
6888    ----------
6889    exo : exodus object
6890        exodus database object initialized with the option `array_type = 'numpy'`
6891    c_array : c-type array
6892        c-type array to be converted into a numpy array
6893
6894    Returns
6895    -------
6896    np_array : numpy array
6897        Numpy array converted from c-type array
6898    """
6899    # ctypes currently produce invalid PEP 3118 type codes, which causes numpy
6900    # to issue a warning.  This is a bug and can be ignored.
6901    # http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4964101/pep-3118-warning-when-using-ctypes-array-as-numpy-array
6902    if not c_array:
6903        return exo.np.array([])
6904
6905    with exo.warnings.catch_warnings():
6906        exo.warnings.simplefilter('ignore')
6907        np_array = exo.np.ctypeslib.as_array(c_array)
6908    return np_array

Converts a c-type array into a numpy array

Parameters

exo : exodus object exodus database object initialized with the option array_type = 'numpy' c_array : c-type array c-type array to be converted into a numpy array

Returns

np_array : numpy array Numpy array converted from c-type array
